Review.author: R. Stephenson
Review.title: Non-moving subjects outdoors on a sunny day? YES. Grandkids running and dancing indoors? NO.

Text.text: Slightly below my phone camera.
Photos at full rez in daylight are not sharp.
Contrast is lower than what you are seeing in the screen.
Actually the screen makes for a better image than the final saved shot.
The main problem is the tiny sensor, a Super HAD CCD sensor which is about 1/10th the size of what an entry DSLR has.
Lens must be plastic for the contrast to go south.
I took shots outdoors hand-held using this SONY and a 3-year old entry level DSLR.
Both are small portions of a full-size print, unretouched, and 350 DPI.
Both look similar when viewed side-by-side on your computer.
But when both are enlarged at the same ratio the older DSLR takes the prize for detail.
Bottom line: this is a $75 or less camera.
It is very small - like about six credit cards taped together.
Lighter than a feather.
If all you are wanting are average shots this will do that.
Car dealers - this may be what you need for your webpage.
However if you are taking photos of fast-moving grandkids indoors this just can't freeze the action.
You will only have photos of blurry kids.
I took it also to the Ringling Bros circus and tried making usuable photos.
Just couldn't do it, plus it slowed the shutter down to one shot about every 7 - 10 seconds.
For cars on a lot or for real estate photos this may be what you can use.
For action or night photos - no way.
Seems okay but pretty run of the mill.
Nothing real special about this camera and the pictures are mediocre.

I bought this from Walmart because they were out of the Cyber-shot DSCW-830 I wanted which is a newer version of my now 6 year old Cyber-shot DSCW-350 that is starting to act up on me.
I figured my Cyber-shot has lasted a good while and takes great pictures this slightly cheaper newer one can't be any worse.
I got it home and tried it out with a picture of the cat and it worked pretty for an $89 camera.
I tried it out again a couple days later to take some pictures of a PlayStation 2 I was repairing and I could not get the thing to focus and take a non blurry picture at all.

I tried sitting it on a tripod and it worked better when I took a picture out my window of the outside, but once I tried to take a picture again of the PS2 on the tripod it was blurry like I tried to run and take the picture.
I was able to fix the blurry issue by using the flash, but then the white balance was so off that a black PS2 looked like it was white.
After messing around with the settings some more I finally gave up went back to Walmart and got my money back.

I just bought a Cybershot DSCW-830 off amazon for the same price as I paid for this one and a warranty from Walmart and until that gets here I am very content and happy with using my old slightly malfunctioning Cyber-shot DSCW-350
I wish I have expended another $50.00 Dlls.
more for something better.

Review.author: Brian W
Review.title: Expensive for a disposable camera, avoid it

Text.text: Can't give it a zero, so 1 star it is.
This was a Christmas present for our daughter in 2015 and she really like the color and everything else about it.
It worked ok and the zink printing is really neat.
She and her friends had a blast printing little selfies and pictures of themselves for projects, ornaments, and who knows what else.
She almost made it through the initial 30 pack of paper in an almost 12 month period.
So maybe around 24 prints later, ironically a few days before Christmas 2016, the camera died.
It wouldn't charge or turn on, and couldn't be seen when plugged into any computer, nothing at all dead.....
I contacted customer service via email and the person who responded was helpful, asked about things I had tried, and suggested I try some things.
Although some of the suggested things were things I'd already told them I'd done, I tried them again to no avail.
Swapping cables, plugs, or computers had any effect.
The reset button did nothing and the suggested firmware update couldn't be attempted since no computer would see the camera.
So still a dead camera.
The consensus was that the non-replaceable battery had failed.
The rep eventually asked me to provide a copy of the invoice for the camera which I did.
I was then informed that there was nothing they could do for me since it was now over 12 months since the order date of the camera.
Not the delivered date or the actual day it was received since it was a Christmas gift, but the day I placed the order on Amazon which was several days before it actually got delivered.
So it seems that they're aware of the battery issues and aren't willing to stand behind the product.
Camera comes with no userguide...
I ordered 2 of these cameras.
One of them I kept for myself but I gave the other one to my little cousin and it produces blurry pictures.
I have tried several times to contact GadgetBasket but no one has gotten in touch with me.
It would be really nice if someone could please help me out since one of the cameras is very defective.

I bought this for my wedding and was excited since the photos can be used as stickers.
However the blue card in the film packs would jam the camera everytime.
I tried taking the blue card out, but the photos don't turn out as well because you need the blue card to calibrate for coloring.
And even still was only 50/50 printing as it is supposed to without the blue card.
Tried leaving in the blue card and taking a few out in case it was too much film in at once.
Did not work.
I returned the camera and bought another thinking it was a fluke, same exact thing on the new one.
I read a bunch of forums, I was doing absolutely nothing wrong.
Just a bad camera.

Review.author: EG206
Review.title: Should You Buy This Camera? In One Word: No

Text.text: I'm not a picky person when it comes to generalizing a product.
If something works I'll typically give it a positive review.
In the case of this camera, the quality is SO LOW that I really have to say that it doesn't live up to its potential, especially given the technology available to us today.
Color quality is horrendous and picture clarity is what I remember from pre-smart phone cameras (1-3mb).
You're literally better off snapping a picture from your smart phone and printing it on an inkjet printer than using this gimmicky camera.
Excellent value!

Review.author: Janieh

Text.text: This camera was all that my daughter wanted for Christmas!
She received it and was so excited--until it wouldn't work.
I also purchased extra film and accessories for the camera because she was planning a trip and was going to bring it along.
She brought it with her anyway and at the end of her trip, it took a few pictures.
When she arrived home--for a family birthday party, the camera wouldn't work again.
Since it is outside of the '30 day return period', I have no recourse.
Other purchasers have reviewed this product and said it was UNRELIABLE.
I should have listened to those reviews!
I guess I'll be throwing this $100+ in the garbage can--what else can I do?

Small, portable, and most importantly, super cute!
I love taking my Polaroid Snap with me wherever I go, since it easily fits in my tiny purse.
I especially like how there's three filter options (b&w, sepia, color) and also the option to add a classic white Polaroid border on your picture.
If you choose the border option, make sure you take a step back before taking the photo, since the borders end up chopping out a small chunk of your pic.
The pics don't have the greatest resolution, but let's be real-- this camera isn't a fancy DSLR.
Overall, super satisfied with my Polaroid Snap.
I'd definitely recommend this to a friend.

I was extremely disappointed with this Polaroid camera.

I had high expectations for this modern version because not only did it have an options for borders or no borders, but it also had a spot to insert an SD card so you can keep the photos digitally (along with, of course, the sleek and portable size).
The reason I paid the extra money compared to other, cheaper Polaroid cameras was because I could transfer the photos I took to my computer.

However, the picture quality turned out horrible on all 20 varying photos I took (meaning some were in a daylight setting, others at darker times) and there's quite a delay when you press the button to take a pictureâ€”so don't expect to capture a fleeting moment with this camera.

I love that there is no ink to, its all part of the paper.
Camera takes decent pictures for what it is.
Other peoples reviews have examples of the prints, so I'm not going to touch on that.
For me, the disappointing thing about this product is its design.
It seems whenever I want to use it, it's dead.
The reason being, the pop-up view finder is also the power switch.
It doesn't take more than a light touch to deploy it.
As such, when i put it in my pocket, my backpack, anything actually; eventually it touches something that turns it on and kills the battery.
works great
I am in love with this Polaroid snap camera!
I love the nostalgia of it!
I like that you can choose to print it with the standard Polaroid frame or without.
I also like the sepia or black and white options to take your photos as well as the standard color option.
There's also a 10 second timer, if needed.
It has an internal battery and comes with a usb cord for charging purposes.
I think this is the perfect companion for a smash book (which is what I've been using it for) with the sticky back on the zink photo paper.
There is a slot for a microSD card (not included).
I love that this option is available so that I can also have a digital version of my photo.
I have not yet uploaded the images I've taken to check the digital quality.
In the times before smartphones, Polaroids were the best way to instantly share photos or to keep a tangible memory of a specific moment.
The Polaroid Snap brings me back to that time and I love it.
Best feature that it has is the ability to save your picture to a micro SD memory card where you can print additional Polaroids and distribute.

Review.author: Atsuna M.
Review.title: Reminds me of the lomo toy cameras!

Text.text: The build of this camera is soo nice!
The cap is a magnet that just snaps onto the camera lens and the flash button acts as the power button.
When you want to turn the camera off, the flash is flipped down and when you want to turn the camera on, you slick on the flash button and it'll flip open.
There's 3 color settings: black and white, sepia, and color.
The quality of the photos definitely reminds me of the lomo toy cameras that were popular in the early 2000's.
The photos have a vintage, nostalgic tone, so don't expect an HD or super clear images.
I think it's still a fun camera to have to capture candid moments with the instant gratification of instaprint photos.
Just set your expectation low in terms of the quality of the images because I think it's trying to mimic film photos.
So this Polaroids snap instant digital camera is way to cool.
Its fantastic !
Didn't love it.
Was were just OK. Should wait a while.
Let them iron out the kinks

It was a massive disappointment.

Review.author: C. Berman
Review.title: I absolutely love that it does not require ink

Text.text: I purchased this camera for my niece who loves hanging photos in her room and showing her teachers/friends pictures but can't always take her phone with digital photos where she goes.
I absolutely love that it does not require ink.
Like older Polaroid cameras, the ink is basically in the paper.
She has enjoyed this camera so far!
It is very easy to use.
In fact a simple photographic representation of instructions is all that is needed.
The look is retro, with the 'old school' Polaroid rainbow.
That look is making a come back so she really thought it was 'cool'.
It comes with a wrist strap so when she is out and about she can make sure she doesn't misplace the camera.
And it charges by USB!
No batteries to replace!!!!
(That is my favorite part).
I even purchased extra photo paper for her because it's so inexpensive and she can have fun making copies of any photos she likes.
I love that she doesn't have to make copies of every picture.
Just her favorites.
That is what sold me on this camera.
It's the best decision I've made for her Birthday!

Review.title: This camera is excellent!, one thing though

Text.text: This camera is excellent!, one thing though, the power button should be separate and recessed.
The flip up eye piece also turns on the power.

This in turn can run down the battery unknown to the user until they get ready to use it and discover that the battery is dead.
Otherwise it's an excellent camera!

This is by far my favorite camera to use.
The picture quality gives a more vintage feel - be aware if you do not like that look.
The zink paper is easy to install.
The SD card saves your printed pics so you have a digital copy as well as a printed pic.
There really isn't instructions so I had to play with it to figure it out myself.
The battery will last a long time if you can keep the flash/power from popping up and draining it in your bag, but it is a lot of fun to use, and I love it.

Review.title: It's nice that you can get a digital file and also ...

Text.text: I ended up returning the camera because it fell short a greatness.
I found highlights got blasted out in many pics and colors were far from accurate.
It's nice that you can get a digital file and also a print, but lame you can't print MULTIPLE images.

Lets say you take a pic with two of your friends and everyone wants a pic, the camera only outputs one single polaroid image, theres no way to command the camera to print a second or 3rd copy...bummer.
You may recall that classic polaroid images had an extra wide margin at the bottom to write details about pic.
This camera does the same but instead of being at the bottom it runs along the side of the print, it just looks odd.
I wished there was an option to have an even white border all around the print but there isn't.
On the surface it's a fun little camera but I think it needs to undergo one more revision before achieving greatness.

Review.author: Margaret Greenough
Review.title: fun, don't expect great photo quality

Text.text: This served my purpose well, not too expensive, pics are fun to stick in a guestbook or around your house.

The photos are terrible--not only are they tiny, tiny (which I knew), I can't hardly tell what I took pictures of!
They are all blurry and low quality.
And the photo is not centered on what's centered in the viewfinder!

I wasted several photos trying to get a pic of something but it kept getting well below where I had the viewfinder pointed--in some cases, what I was looking at in viewfinder isn't in the photo at all!
It's also next to impossible to hold this thing without accidentally pressing one of the buttons, especially the stupid color mode button.
The old Polaroid instant cameras were a million times better than this junk.
Loved being able to give pictures taken instantly to friends and enjoy seeing their reactions ðŸ˜€

Otherwise, spend your money on a nice photo printer and just print your pics at home.
The power on/off is actuated by opening the flash.

This is a design flaw as there is no lock or latch to keep it from popping open at an inconvenient moment like in your purse... To add frustration, the shutter button is extremely easy to press to snap a pic.
That combination is deadly for a device that needs the printer side to be unobstructed in order to not damage the camera.
If you buy this, budget for the case as well.
I am just waiting for this camera to turn on and snap a pic while pressed up against something and cause a jam and ultimately failure.
My wife likes it though, so I will keep it and will see how long it lasts.

We have now tried it over 50 shots and the quality is horrific.
We've tried it inside, outside, in the shade during the day, in the sunlight and you get very poor consistency.
Half the time the paper just keeps printing blank pages and you have to put it back in.
For $100 I would expect much better quality of printing.
My strong advice would be to stay away from this.
There has to be a better option for instant.

Print time is roughly 12-18 seconds based on how much color and variation there is in the photo.
A selfie in a dark room will print a bit faster than a group photo at a park.

This is a well built instant camera, the image quality is good and the camera built is strong.
Matte finish makes it even better.
just been two day since my hands on.

Text.text: Pros: To start off the camera quality is all right for the price don't be expecting such high quality like I did also there is a neat feature that you could select to give your picture the original Polaroid border.
Second pro the second benefit I found with this camera is let's say you're going to buy the Instax mini basically overtime I guess the Instax film price is going to start stacking up.
But, the period snap is going to basically cost more upfront and less over time.
The third feature I like about having this camera is the film is actually a sticker you could rip off the back part and make it a sticker or keep it the same way it is.
The final and last compliment I have about this is its battery life I would say it is decent especially for the time it takes to charge.

Review.author: Scout1846
Review.title: Waste of money: poor quality and horrible alignment

Text.text: I purchased this instant digital camera with fairly low expectations.
I just wanted something that would give me decent but not great instant photos of my young son doing the small daily things that are so important to record as a baby grows.
This camera, however, produces VERY poor quality images, no matter what the ambient light level and no mattter what settings are used.
The printed pictures are either way to bright or are unfocused.
But the thing that makes this purchase a true waste of money is that the pop-up view finder does not represent the image that is captured by the camera.
Centering a personâ€™s head and shoulders in the viewfinder, for example, results in a photo of that personâ€™s torso and upper legs.
As a result, the user is forced to play a guessing game and â€œoffsetâ€ the image in the viewfinder in a blind attempt to capture the desired image (i.e.
aim above the personâ€™s head in an attempt to get an actual picture of their face).

The viewfinder is useless - what it actually takes a picture of is centered completely differently than what you see, and, since it prints every picture, it's a HUGE waste of (expensive) paper.

I ended up returning this and getting the Fujifilm instant camera, which I love.

Review.author: CG
Review.title: ... Polaroid fan and user from way back and am delighted the company has stayed in the game

Text.text: I am a Polaroid fan and user from way back and am delighted the company has stayed in the game.
This context led to the SNAP being given to me as a Valentine's Day gift.
I've had a blast this camera!
People LOVE it!
I think I sold a few last night at a party.

Here's the thing: I have several cameras including 2 DSLRS, point and shoot Powershot, GoPro, which I share because when I pick up the SNAP I have a different mindset than when I'm in photographer mode with the other cameras.
I am creating mementos to give away in the moment.
The viewfinder isn't always easy for me, so sometimes the photo is framed differently than planned.
There is a brief lag for the flash, so I entertain until shot is captured (a few more seconds than usual with other cameras).
I am old school, so I like saying, 'Here's a shot for your refrigerator.'
People get a kick out of it.
Last night at a retirement party, responses ranged from, 'Oh my god, I didn't know they still made Polaroids,' to one man who just kept laughing and laughing as he looked at the pic.
Fun surprise when you can hand someone the photo booth (4 tiny pics on one sheet) version.
Choosing black and white or color options, it's all good.
With a white border or edge to edge - you choose.
One time as the photo exited the camera, it fell into my beer - I can report the photo held up fine and everyone at the table got a good laugh.
I highly recommend this product if you use it the way it is intended and have realistic expectations.
The magnetic lens cap cover adds to the cool factor, and it's another fun feature to show off.
Based on the reactions I receive when I hand over the pics to people, the film sheets are worth every penny.
Last night I got 20-some shots on one charge.
People think it's magic: no batteries, no ink, dry immediately.
Sometimes, I 'shake it like a Polaroid picture,' just for fun.

This is definitely a very convenient camera to have but it's the last camera I would use to print a picture.

It is simple to use and it is fun seeing the pictures print right away.

My camera came with a 5 zink zero photo paper which was unexpected and the view finder opens only by pressing the timer button so thereâ€™s no reason to worry that it will open by accident and ruin the photo or deplete the battery.
All in all, I am really glad that I got this camera.

Review.author: Jordan Rousseau
Review.title: This is a fantastic little instant camera

Text.text: This is a fantastic little instant camera.
For those reviewers complaining about the colors, it sounds like they aren't familiar with the type of photography this kind of camera is simulating.
No, the pictures are not super-sharp, high-definition prints, but that's not what this camera is trying to be.
Under the 'standard' color setting, the photos come out looking like a film camera from the late 80s, where the 'sepia' photos look like they were taken from my grandpa's camera from the 60s.
The focus has been sharp and impressive at all distances I've shot.
I'm very pleased with this camera

There is no way to get the exact picture you want.

You can't even tell if everything you want in the picture will be captured.

All of this causes the user to waste the sticker paper, which isn't cheap.

The instructions for use are poor.

Since the color is so poor it doesn't matter if you choose B/W sepia or color.
They all look sepia.
The border option is useless and you have to be very.careful handling the camera or you might accidently take a picture without meaning to because even the slightest touch sets it off.
I guess the only good thing is that the paper is good quality sticker paper.
I would highly recommend not buying this item and try another brand.

I have no solutions if you aren't photographing people.
When I have time (and don't mind wasting some film paper), I plan to test the viewfinder picture against actual pictures so I can manually mark up my viewfinder window to be more accurate.
This function is integral to the worth of a camera.

The Polaroid Snap is a fun, retro, instant print camera with nostalgia and novelty value.

You cannot use it as an instant print camera without Snap compatible ZINK Photo Paper, and it does not come with so much as a single piece of ZINK (zero ink) paper, so you should order some when you order a Snap.For someone who is in the market for a fun, retro, instant print camera with nostalgia and novelty value that they can take to parties, etc., the Snap is cool enough that despite the fact that you have to buy a pack of ZINK pape in order to use it as it's meant to be used, I can easily rate it 5 stars.
But keep in mind that I'm a grandpa who has still has photo albums filled with Polaroids that I took in the sixties.
And when I look at what comes out of the Snap, I definitely get the nostalgia effect, especially when I select the print option that puts an old-fashioned Polaroid border around the print.

The print quality itself adds to the nostalgia, in that the print quality is apparently designed and intended to be reminiscent of original Polaroid prints.The Snap has no built-in memory, but it does have a slot for a microSD card.

Technically, if you put a microSD card in a Snap, you can use the Snap without ZINK paper, and you can access the images by putting the microSD card into another device or by connecting the Snap to a computer with the included USB cable (which is also the charging cable).
But based on my experience, I'd say there'd be no point in using a microSD card in the Snap unless you are also using ZINK paper.
Let's say that you're at a party and you take a Snap shot of someone and give them the instant print.
Great camera!

This camera is so much fun.
I got it for my five year old daughter is obsessed with taking pictures like her mom.
I thought it would be so much fun for her to get an actual picture to hang up immediately.
This camera comes with a 20 sheet set with 2x3 inch Zink paper.
The paper comes in two sleeves of 10 within foil wrapping so not to be easily exposed by the Sun.

When putting the paper in, the camera didn't come with a set of instructions within the box, although it did give a website to be able to download the latest firmware, but I wanted to see if I could figure it out on my own and through trial and error, I figured that the paper goes picture side up.
So you can see the backing of the paper has the logo and writing on it that will face the inside of the camera.
I showed in the video exactly how to do this.
You don't have to slide it through or anything, you just place it flat in there and close it quickly so there isn't much light exposure.

Review.author: jlam949
Review.title: this Polaroid Snap camera works pretty well. Itâ€™s the size of the typical digital ...

Text.text: Compared to the Fujifilm Instax MINI 8, this Polaroid Snap camera works pretty well.
Itâ€™s the size of the typical digital camera.
So you can slip it into your back pocket unlike the Instax.
But I do admit, the Instax is cuter, looks more like a traditional camera with better color options.
But I guess it comes down to more of a preference.
The Snap uses zinc paper, so when the photo prints, it looks like you printed directly from a printer rather than an old school Polaroid photo, like the Instax (prints slower too.)
The photos are smaller than the Instax but the Zinc paper has a sticker backing, so itâ€™s like a sticker pix.
The Snap photos can be printed with a white border and can be printed in color, sepia and black in white.
But what I do like is that this camera can print with a photo booth option, so 4 photos in one print.
And this camera has a Micro SD Card option, which is a plus for me.
I normally end up giving the printouts to others, but now I have a copy for myself.
The only difference that Iâ€™ve notice is that the SNAP is on auto, while the Instax has lighting options.
And the Instax is at a lower price point.
Other than that, they work pretty similar.
You still need good lighting and your photos should probably be within 3-5 feet away.

Flat, with an off blue cast and questionable contrast.
So - great for a kid, but adults may want to consider something else.

Review.title: The pictures were not very good. I liked the idea of having an internal ...

Text.text: The pictures were not very good.
I liked the idea of having an internal memory for maybe saving the photos later, but it kind of took away from the idea behind polaroid.
Polaroid, an iconic brand makes another iconic product, the Polaroid Snap.
The new Polaroid Snap comes in a sleek and stylish design that is trimmer and lighter than it's predecessors.
Delivering excellent quality instant images, there were a few changes that I loved.
I am able to select a color scheme from button on the top of the camera that will expose the film in those range of colors, creating a unique artistic feel.
Also, an accidental discover, the images are all stickers!
Go ahead and take a shot, peel off the back, and have an instant brand new bumper sticker or another souvenir for the refrigerator.
Polaroid truly tries to innovate, and the Polaroid Snap is a testament to that.
Took this Polaroid out for the first time to Havasupai and it was awesome!
Super easy to carry around on our hikes.
The colors of the photos came out great.
It is a really fun camera for instant photos!
As a photographer, the absolute coolest thing about this camera is its ability to capture 'moments' in a classic, hazy way reminiscent of the original instant print Polaroid cameras.
Simply amazing, not to mention the cameras themselves are absolutely gorgeous.
100%, would recommend.
The Polaroid Snap is so fun to use and also makes a GREAT gift for anyone.
It's cool, fun, user friendly and I absolutely love it.
My niece also got one for Christmas and was still loving and using it during the fourth of July.
I love the different colors and the fact that the photos print instantaneously!

This would seriously be the perfect gift for someone, including for my grandmother, who thinks that all pictures are going to be 'lost in the cloud' one day and likes to print them, but doesn't like to go to the store.
It would also be nostalgic for people who use to use polaroid cameras.
I love that Polaroid snap brings back the hard copy photo with just the touch of a button.
Can't recommend this product enough!
Love this camera!!
It is everything I expected it to be and more.

Text.text: Great camera if you like constantly clearing photo paper jams.
We purchased this camera for our daughter for Christmas.

You have to press down on the view finder to turn the camera on and off.
Once we figured that out, we were excited to take some pictures.
But again, there were no instructions with the camera that told you how to load the photo paper in to the camera.
Once we figured that out, we tried to take some pictures.
We used the photo paper that came with the camera and loaded 10 sheets of photo paper into the camera.
First attempt, jam.
After clearing the paper out of the camera, tried again.
The blue zinc reader card came out after taking the first picture.
So, we tried again.
Next attempt was another jam.
I removed all of the photo paper from the camera and put 5 sheets in to the camera.
It didn't seem to matter that there were fewer sheets of photo paper loaded.
The camera jammed probably 70-80% of the time.
We finally resorted to loading a single sheet at a time.
It still jams even with just a single piece of photo paper.
My daughter still likes playing with the camera but this camera is not worth the price tag.

We can store photos on the camera with a micro sd card, which is a nice feature.If we really want to print photos, it would be a lot less frustrating to send the digital prints to Snapfish or other service to get that done.
It's frustrating fighting with the photo paper and clearing jams 70-80% of the time.
Brings back childhood memories.
Love it!
All I expected it would be!
Granddaughter loved it!

Review.author: Miss Rita
Review.title: she loved it. Is very easy to operate and the ...

Text.text: This was a Christmas gift for my ten year old granddaughter....she loved it.
Is very easy to operate and the photos come out looking really good.
Would recommend this item to others.
Hated to see it returned, but it was a gift, that she decided she didn't want.
I can say just from looking at it, it has that same Polaroid quality of cameras from back in the 1970's, when I had my own Polaroid.
If your looking for a quick print camera, the quality of a great camera can still be found in these Polaroid's.
This is a great idea, but pretty poor execution.
Lets start with the packaging.
There are pretty much NO instructions.
Admittedly, there isn't a lot to figure out, BUT there are things you would never know without accidentally doing it and thus wasting some of the expensive zinc paper.

For example if you hold the shutter button down longer than intended the camera with take a 4 in 1 quad photo, which is actually pretty cool, but how would you know that until you did it and wasted at least one zinc sheet?

Also there are error codes represented by lights on the back, however they are ANOTHER thing that they do not explain, so you can guess what they mean, but even after searching polaroid.com and messages boards I have found no answer for my issues.
Another major problem is the viewfinder, which is tiny and does not accurately depict what ends up on the final printed image.
Also, it acts as the only power button in popup form, and if you carry the camera in anything, such as a backpack or pocket, it turns on and drains the battery before you can use it.
The idea of this thing is fantastic, however its execution, lack of directions, and frequent errors are very hard to recommend the current generation of this product.
Very disappointed, mostly because it has so much potential, and when it was working I really enjoyed it, but that was less than 4 months.
Very disappointed that it came with so few instructions and no photo paper at all...not even a sample.
I misunderstood that the photo pack of 30 was not included as it was listed right next to it.
At the price of the paper, I don't think it is worth it.
Much easier to take a picture, send it to Walgreens from my phone, and pick it up in an hour!
And the pictuers are so small!
I don't think this retro fad will last, but you never know.
My daughter is very pleased with this product.
Easy to use.
Great product!

Review.author: Redcon1
Review.title: It made my 10 year old cry. Nice work.

Text.text: You know how most cameras take a picture whenever you press the shutter button?
Not this little guy, it likes to turn off instead.
Then, to add insult to injury, whenever you turn it back on, it spits out a blank film sheet to show you the picture it didn't take.
But hey, you can always just get the pictures off of the memory card, right?
No pictures on the sd card either.
I guess asking for a camera that actually takes pictures is just a bit too much.
I received a camera that might have been used as a hacky sack.
had dings on the side and did not work at all none of the buttons or anything worked.
Straight garbage.
Got one as a Christmas present.
All 30 photos taken came out terrible and off center.
Took multiple photos inside and outside with the three filters, and none came out nice.
I thought maybe the camera I received was defective, so I exchanged it for another, but quality did not improve.
Well be returning for a refund.

Review.author: Cool Cucumber
Review.title: This was a gift. Cute. But - you ...

Review.author: WebTalker
Review.title: SNAP! Don't Forget the Film and Memory Card, OK!

Text.text: I received this camera as a Holiday gift and I cannot use it.
I researched how to use it, after a brief online tutorial - but the camera is totally useless out of the box.
What I mean is that it powers-up with included batteries and that's it!
You cannot use it to take print pictures because you need the printer paper not included with the camera - that a Holiday FAIL!

Nor can you take digital pictures and download them through the included mini USB cable because there is no included memory (you need to install a MicroSD card - not included with the camera) - another Holiday FAIL!
This gift is totally worthless to me.
Just like many other gifts I get for the Holidays - file 13 for re-gifting.
The prints and memory will cost another $50 or more - that's just outright ridiculous!
I'm not saying this is a bad product - it's just a product I cannot afford to use as a senior.
Polaris does not work.
Is there a way to fix this or get a new one or refund?
I received a dirty used camera.

Review.author: ricardo

Text.text: If i could rate this zero stars i would.

Bought it to use for making memories when i travel and Iâ€™ve only been able to print 1 picture from it that was â€œdecentâ€.. although the camera is compact and cuter then the Fujifilm instax mini itâ€™s absolutely horrible in photo quality (pictures come out with lines throughout the picture) and now my camera wonâ€™t even print.

Go get a Fujifilm.

Then all 3 lights blink.

I bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift so that we could take pictures with it as a family Christmas tradition to start.

Has no instructions and 2.
Made my wife and I spend our entire Christmas figuring out why it's not working.
Thanks for that.
Daughter loves it product exactly ass stated

Review.author: Reviewerman
Review.title: BUYER BEWARE! Polaroid does not support their products!

Text.text: I have a Polaroid GL10 printer.
This is still a fully functional device, but there is no app on the app store that will print to this printer.

Awesome fun, just to save time you should know that the color spectrum circle is on the top left, you turn on by lifting the middle square viewing frame, and take pictures by pressing the red button once.
Load film by opening back up, put green code paper face down first then the white film next, glossy side down.
Press the red button to take your first picture then wait til the green code paper comes out.
When it is done the picture will come out next.
Amazing little camera.
Perfect gift.
Great product!
Works great and prints very cool looking pictures w/ different options like color and border.
It is very easy to use and not to mention you can insert an sd to save your pictures!
Seems to hold a good charge as well.
My girlfriend loves it, and the many accessories you can get with it too
Terrible pictures!!!!!!!
I love my camera.
The fact that u can print it right then n there is amazing.
The pictures are of an older style that I happen to love.
Theyâ€™re different n authentic.
Daughter does not like camera.
SAys it does not take good pictures and is slow processing when trying to take a picture.
Granddaughter seemed to love it!
I bought this for my daughter, I am really disappointed with the picture quality.....so fuzzy and lacking in color.
The price for the quality of picture is really awful.
I paid $90 for this camera and a $15 throw away camera has way better picture quality.

Review.author: Jon

Text.text: While I enjoyed being able to customize whether or not I included the classic Polaroid white border I was disappointed with the picture quality compared to the Fuji Film Mini series.
My girlfriend loves it

Review.author: davealley
Review.title: Dont waste your money on this pos

Text.text: Dont waste your money on this pos.
I had it for 2 days, took about 15 horribly exposed pictures, and then it decided to stop working entirely.
I took a photo and the print light came on as usual, but nothing printed.

Review.author: Zampcaster
Review.title: Cute, but could have been simpler to use

Text.text: This is a cute concept, but I think it tries to do too much.
I found myself triggering the burst modes by accident, and ditto for the black and white vs. color mode.
Call it user error if you'd like, but if I wanted a more sophisticated camera, I wouldn't be shooting on polaroid film.
For a retro throwback item, I would have preferred a simple point and shoot format with less frills.

Review.author: Megan Vogler
Review.title: The picture quality is really good and the functionality is easy to figure out

Text.text: This product met all expectations.
The picture quality is really good and the functionality is easy to figure out.
The pictures are not as big as the original polaroid but the quality is superior.
The film develops really quickly and the camera itself is very lightweight.
You could easily carry this camera in your pocket.

The film also has a removable adhesive backing which is nice because you can snap some pictures and make a collage in a scrap book or take them to your office and post them up in your work area to brighten your day.
All in all I'd say this was a great purchase and would highly recommend.
The film is a bit expensive in retail stores, but you can buy online and save a lot.
It worked fine for about 15 days.
Now its not detecting the films.
Iâ€™ll start right now a request to get my money back
The idea of this camera is great, my son wanted it for Christmas but It just does not take good pictures!

Polaroid needs to make these better!

great product and fast shipper, as expected.

Takes great pictures.

Review.author: Lee

great camera, neat features.

Fun gift.

Difficult to use
Dont waste your money, very cheap product...pictures come out horible

Review.author: BEG77541
Review.title: Great Product That Gets Heavy Usage

Text.text: Bought for daughter to replace broken 'old school' Polaroid.
Was a little hesitant about making the change before asking at first, but turns out that I made a great decision.
My daughter has become addicted to it and doesn't miss her older camera at all.
I will be purchasing 2 additional cameras as Christmas gifts for my teenage cousins.
Not the best quality camera, but a great price point and loads of fun for parties, holidays and other social events!
I love the camera!
The color is awesome and the photos come out 4.5 / 5, but it's great!
Don't trust the view finder.
Takes a lot of practice to be able to center objects and actually capture what you want to in it.
The film is really expensive, and it's a really barebones camera.
Flash doesn't work that well.
I really wanted to like this camera.
It was cute, and the perfect size, and the film was cheap: BUT it turned out to be the biggest waste of money.
The camera turns on by popping up the view finder, but even in the hard case that I have for it, the smallest movement causes it to turn itself on and run out of battery before I can even use it.
From the day I got it, it wouldn't print pictures even with a new pack of film in the camera, or it would just print out a blank white sheet.
It is difficult to use, hold, and doesn't hold a charge.
Do not buy this camera, it's a gigantic waste of money.
Really like the camera the only thing that keeps me from loving it is that the picture comes out too slow.
This is my husband's camera.
He hasn't said anything negative about it.

Review.author: Idolfan
Review.title: Takes great photos in low lighting

Text.text: Got this for three tour stops on Billy Idol's most recent US tour.
Takes great photos in low lighting.

Review.author: Peter Jensen
Review.title: Great photos, dust on sensor and poor warranty left me frustrated

Text.text: Camera takes amazing photos and gets good battery life.
Wifi and associated app are actually useful, but app abuses android alerts to tell you about new products.
Despite a poor service experience I will probably still replace it with the next model in the lineup.
I know little to nothing about cameras so this review may be for those like me.
The guide that came with the camera was a joke.
Found a guide on amazon that made the use of this camera fun and easy.
I think the pics look amazing.
Only pics that did not come out very good were moving objects in the dark but it was probably user error.
Very happy with the purchase.
Last note: nice and compact but it's not going to fit comfortably in you front pocket.
I bought this camera for an upcoming trip to Spain.
And I cannot say how pleased I am with this purchase.
It is a fantastic little camera that is super portable, yet it takes really nice and quality photos.
Another part about the camera that I really like is the wifi capabilities and how you can transfer photos directly to your phone or pc.
Not to mention the fact that you can use your phone as a remote control for the camera!
Only downside to this would be the price... but you get what you pay for, and with this you're paying for quality.
I've enjoyed using this camera for three years, until the pop-up flash died!
Per Sony's repair center, after the first year the repair costs are almost as much as a used replacement, so this has been the most expensive disposable camera ever.
Great camera while it works, but Nikons are built like a tank, while this one is buggy.
Not only did the flash die, but it also needed firmware update to stop serious focus vibrations.
Sony can do better than this!

Review.author: EG Jorgensen
Review.title: Fantastic camera and very clear pictures!

Text.text: Fantastic camera and very clear pictures.
I have spent a lot of time trying out different cameras, trying to find a small point and shoot, with the quality that is at least similar to a DSLR.
I was trying to determine whether to go with the 2 or 3 and decided to go with a used 2, because the price was about $300 less than the used 3.
If I could have gotten the price to about a $100 difference, I may have pulled the trigger on the 3.
I was a little worried about the smaller zoom on the 3, and I have not seen it so I cannot say whether it would have been sufficient, but on the 2 I am happy with the zoom quality.
This is small enough to fit in my pocket, although of course it is a bulge, but similar to what other people have said, it is small, yet solid, but I do worry that I will drop it because of the size.
Also, I tend to have my finger on top of where the flash is, so the flash will attempt to pop up and I am afraid overtime I may break it.
I have to make sure I do a better job of placing my finger elsewehere on the camer to avoid this issue.
Great light weight camera I can store in my backpack.
I'm ready to take great photos w/o the hassle of lugging around my larger camera.
I used to own version 1 of this camera before my father 'borrowed' it.
I always get compliments on the photos I take with this camera.
The camera broke just out of warranty.
I got the all too common C:32:60 error.
They won't tell you why it has the error.
They just want you to send it in.
The internet is covered with this error.Sony wants $425 to repair a camera that has less than 1000 pictures through it.
It's a great compact camera.
The price is pretty steep for brand new.
I waited a couple of years to buy this camera when the price has dropped a few hundred dollars.
I love the NFC feature for Android.
I can transfer a photo quickly via NFC, if I want to upload it via social media.
Wish there was a better how to book that came with the camera

Review.author: Chris W.
Review.title: Great color depth and excellent for an amateur who wants ...

Text.text: Great color depth and excellent for an amateur who wants great pictures.
It is very forgiving and 'helps' make the photographer look good!
Camera was as represented.
Easy to use, great pictures, very compact size.

Review.author: deafbuzz
Review.title: design look nice and feel quality to use

Text.text: design look nice and feel quality to use.
nice size to carry with me.
zeiss lens give nice sharp for general purpose.
able to do photo in dark without using flash by pushing to high iso.
but it could not perform nice bokeh as family portrait like full frame like i did with sony a900.
i should not compare apple vs orange so i am still wait for new rx-2 to be released one day.
I was hesitant to buy this little baby.
I am of the opinion that a small camera cannot take a good shot - PERIOD.
Well I am eating those words.
This little camera is full of surprises - you will not be disappointed.
If you are a novice shooter...you might have some problems...but take a basic camera class and you'll be able to use all the functions this camera is capable of spitting out.
You have the option to shoot in Manual, Aperture, Shutter Priority, and yes even Program.
This little baby even shoots RAW.
Best pocketable camera.
It's like having a DSLR with you everywhere you go.
Just put it in your pocket and live life.
This camera takes amazing photos, but it's not surprising given its full frame sensor and German Leica lens.
The RX100 III is now out, but not worth the extra money.
Buy this, and you'll be happy for many years.

Review.author: dn
Review.title: Best Travel Camera (for me, that is)

Text.text: So far (2 weeks of heavy use) - it is the best camera I had ever had.
Despite having CanonT3i with good lenses.
I bought it for travel (lightweight but capable) and I am not disappointed.
Picture quality amazing.
Movie quality - even better.
My only gripes - not very articulate screen.
Canon T3i has a better one, even my old Canon A640 has a better one.
But - now days you can not get any better in such a small package.
Of course, flash is very incontinent - for my hands, at least, but again - it is for travel, I knew what I am getting.
I bought a case, but no screen cover - it defeats the purpose of the screen: anti-glare, good colors.
I do not care about scratches - I am not planning to use it for 10 yrs.
I did not go for RX100 iii because I was expecting to shoot more landscape type of shots, which I did (as well as portraits and close ups) - and all pictures look just great.
Close ups, though, not very close (may be I have to train myself more in that respect, may be you have to use manual focus - we'll see later).
I am VERY satisfied.
I have to say I'm disappointed.
It shoots great daytime shots but I mainly got this camera thinking I could take some good quality night shots without flash.
It did not perform better than my 10 year old Canon Powershot A95.
The Sports Action setting did not catch good night shots, the Handheld Twilight and High Sensitivity settings caught some good shots but many were blurry.

Review.author: Jankran
Review.title: This camera is amazing in what it is able to do for such ...

Text.text: This camera is amazing in what it is able to do for such a compact size.
Unfortunately the included information from Sony is not much help at explaining the many menu and setting options.
Gary L. Friedman's e-book is a great reference for how to get the most out of the camera.
Many of the reported 'problems' with the camera by other reviews reflect the reviewers' lack of knowledge of how to use the camera.
The flash is very flexible, and shooting in low light without a flash is possible with great results using the iAUTO+ (â€œSUPERIOR AUTOâ€) shooting mode.
Get a screen protector, and check out he Vivitar compatible batteries.
My friend wouldn't put it down for two straight weeks.
Never had a camera before and never wanted one.
Shots are amazing.
Auto modes perfects.
Can't say anything about manual mode - she won't let me even hold it :).
Highly recommended for a newbie photographer.
Oh, and loads of compliments on the looks :)

Review.author: CookieMonster
Review.title: ... camera for a few days but so far I love it. It takes amazing pictures

Text.text: I've only had the camera for a few days but so far I love it.
It takes amazing pictures, and it was easy enough for me (a non professional!)
to figure out.

Review.author: Entranced
Review.title: it's a good camera. The reason for the two stars is ...

Text.text: Actually, it's a good camera.
The reason for the two stars is to get your attention.
Incredible images for such a small camera.
I find raw images significantly distorted when taken at f/1.8.
The camera corrects the distortion for JPG.

Review.author: Expat Family
Review.title: Perfect Camera for when its too important for a cellphone shot, but a few recommendations...

Text.text: This is the perfect camera for us.
We were not looking for a professional camera, but with three kids we needed better memories than a cellphone camera can provide.
We have had the camera for a year now and have taken hundreds of pictures and lots of movies- the camera still functions like its brand new.
Sony is always a safe bet, but we have been extremely impressed.
A few notes for the camera:
Great compact camera.
The large 1' sensor does a great job in a compact body.
Great little camera
I ordered a Sony DSC-RX100M II.
I received a RX100 II.
Note that there is a difference.
The one i received is of lesser quality.
Also, I did not receive a tripod or case as shown in the add.

Review.author: A. Jordan
Review.title: A fantastic on-the-go camera for the novice.

Text.text: This camera is amazing.
I bought it as a gift for someone else, but have had a few hours with it.
The part I'm most stunned by is the user-friendly menus and default settings, things I didn't expect from a Sony.
I am not a photographer.
I have a basic DSLR but can bang out some better shots on this with my very limited skills thanks to the full suite of very snappy auto settings.
It's fun to use and the results are far better than the snapshots I've managed from any other camera.

Review.author: chris d williams
Review.title: This camera is amazing for it's size

Text.text: This camera is amazing for it's size.
This whole series by Sony is groundbreaking with the 1' sensor.
Put it in your pocket and have fun!
Very customizable.
I got a very good deal on it too.
Look for those deals and get it.
You will not be disappointed.

Review.author: S. Vogt
Review.title: Great camera, but don't order it without the grip

Text.text: Even though they share the same form factor, the RX100 II is a clear improvement over its predecessor in just about every respect.
Image quality is better, image stabilization has improved, and the autofocus is more accurate.
This is like having a small professional camera, with tons of nice features and takes beautiful pictures.
You won't regret.
I purchased this camera as a pocketable alternative to my Sony NEX7 and am very satisfied.
While it is a stretch to get it into jeans pockets, it easily fits in cargo pants pockets or jacket pockets.
The photos are comparable to those from the NEX, and particularly good in low light settings.
This is my first camera that doesn't have at least an EVF and I was worried about how it would do in bright sunlight, but that is not a problem.
The only objection is that it really does need the hand grip attachment....easy to install, works well, looks fine, inexpensive.
So all in all, while pricey, it is a great little camera.

I bought this camera through Beach camera, and overall the camera does meet my expectations --a sharp lens, crisp images, good low light sensitivity, and more image processing gimmicks than anyone can handle.
However, we have run into a small, but annoying problem.
As we use the camera, the battery indicator continues to register 'full' until the battery dies, and the camera freezes.
There seems to be no gradation in the response.
Either there is some power, or there is none.
On the one hand, it is a small problem, but it is quite distressing to have spent some time setting up the perfect shot only to have the camera die without warning.
A little tough to figure all the options out but once you do the photos it takes are outstanding.
Amazing quality!!
I love this camera - sure it has it's quirks, as do all products.
I got this to take pictures of my grandkids, and it's great for that.
The size and capabilities just can't be beat today.
It's pricy I'll give you that, but if you want to take pics in low light - this is the camera for you.
It arrived in two days and was well packaged.
Highly recommended.
It is overpriced.
Can not add threaded filters - must use an adapter which is a bummer as it takes away from its pocket-ability.
Great picture quality.
Love being able to used my iPad to zoom and shoot.
Wish i had access to the camera menu from the iPad.
Video quality is also great.
My hand held video is shaky so if you don't have stable hands, recommend you get a portable monopod to help.
Can transfer photos to pcs and tablets via wifi, which is super.

Review.author: DarkMaN
Review.title: We can talk and talk about photos and etc... BUT

Text.text: First, I didnt buy this in Amazon because I live in a state where items from Amazon gets taxed.
For big purchases, I definitely sought other vendors.

Review.author: Hi-Tech-Dad
Review.title: It's a compact little giant of a camera.

Text.text: I can't give enough praise for this camera and Sony for making it.
I bought the RX100 about 3 weeks before this one came out from Best Buy.
I was a little taken back that the Best Buy guy didn't even tell me that a new one was coming out.
I live in San Diego and go to Comic-Con each year and the pictures I took with the RX100 were amazing.
I returned it and ordered the RX100M2 thru Best Buy but it went on back-order when it was supposed to ship.
I saw it available and in stock through Amazon and quickly cancelled my Best Buy order and ordered it through Amazon.
I got it the next day and quickly started to measure it up against the RX100.
The extra features are really great.
The NFC for transferring photos to your smart phone is awesome.
I am having issues with trying to transfer images to my computer (PC) but I hope this will be resolved in time.
For right now I just connect it via cable.
I didn't have the RX100 for that long to do much comparison testing but the images so far a really great.
The auto settings are good but if you buy this camera start getting into more manual shooting to really use the capabilities of this camera.
The LCD screen is very clear and the ability to tilt is a bonus for me since I have a 1 year old so I don't have to get low to film or take pictures of him.
It's so compact as well you can take it with you pretty much anywhere.
It has a video modes that some of my friends with more expensive DSLR camera don't even have.
I am no pro by any means but I have been getting better with my photography for sure by using the camera.
I like it that I can't buy lenses for it as well so it will save me money.
Really enjoy the camera.
Focus is super fast and pictures taken in low light are awesome.
Wish the the lens is a little bit wider.

Review.author: Chris Moore
Review.title: This camera makes me a good photographer, which says a lot

Text.text: This camera makes me a good photographer, which says a lot!
It takes amazing pictures and in automatic modes does a lot to improve your pics, including composition.
Super happy with this purchase!
Like most camera manufactures Sony tells you not to use this camera in high humidity or not to get it wet... well, they mean it!
I was shooting in a very light drizzle and the next day the camera would not turn on.
Apparently, there is zero weather sealing, and moisture has no problem getting in.
When I connected the battery charger to the camera the morning after, the camera charger light would not even light up, so i took it back to the a camera shop where I bought it.
They couldn't get the camera to work either, so now, it is on it's way back to Sony, to see if they can work some magic on it.
Hopefully I didn't fry the circuitry, and they can fix it.
Other than this bit of stupidity on my part, the RX100M2 packs a lot in a very small package, and is an excellent choice for a pro or advanced amateur needing a truly pocketable walk-around camera.
I bought this after returning a less-expensive Nikon because I wanted crisp gorgeous pictures and ease of handling.
The Sony is a wonderful camera, easy to work, but with a depth of choices that I still haven't gotten used to.
That's my project for 2015.

Review.author: The Awesome Family
Review.title: compared to other compact cameras i've owned, mainly canon ...

Text.text: compared to other compact cameras i've owned, mainly canon, i find this too complicated and use our other cameras instead even though the quality of this sony is highly recommended

Review.author: Retail junkie
Review.title: Best walk around low profile camera you Can get, imo

Text.text: Great little walk-around camera!
If you are looking for a camera to take everywhere with you this is the one.
I love my dslr's and would never replace them but for traveling and wanting gear that can fit in my pocket this is the one.
I don't care about the fluffy gimic features like 50 megapixels and a massive 200x zoom lens as that is just marketing hype.
The ability to have a fast 1.8 aperture on the wide end is huge the basic modes and manual control is a must for me.
This delivers.
Raw shooting ability is a plus but not something that is mandatory for a walk around camera.

Review.author: ThereminSong
Review.title: This is a fine camera, and is certainly capable of taking great ...

Text.text: This is a fine camera, and is certainly capable of taking great pictures.
My complaints; I find it hard to frame shots only using the rear viewfinder, and the electronic finder, priced at almost the cost of the camera, is a prohibitive accessory.

Also, the autofocus, while good, is slower than I might have hoped for, the camera struggles with close focal lengths, lack of intuitive manual control, a slightly slow startup time, and the paint on the hot shoe, and the LCD screen have both shown more wear than I would have hoped after only a few months of regular use.

That said, it does basically everything else very well, and given the excellent image quality, it's hard to complain about the shortcomings when this camera so easily slides into a coat or pant pocket.
It is only about the size of a pack of cigarettes; that alone is a reason to consider having it around.

I'm used to shooting on medium format film cameras, and purchased this for a trip where I needed something discreet and nondescript looking that could also shoot high quality, RAW images, and in that regard it was a perfect purchase; the camera looks like a very ordinary point and shoot, and doesn't attract much notice, and the shutter, even in burst mode, is almost silent.

The RX-100 mk III seems to have dealt with the complaints of the lack of a eye level finder and the removal of the easily scuffed hot shoe, but if those factors are not an issue for you, I'd certainly recommend this model.
PLEASE READ - This camera stopped working 8 months after purchase.
It was sent in under warranty.
Sony says it was damaged and voided the warranty.
As an avid amateur photographer who has had a string of cameras without any problems I say that's BS.
After a month of haggling the best Sony will do is replace the camera for $279.
I will sell new on on eBay and buy a camera from a company that stands behind their product.
WHAT GOOD IS A CAMERA IF THE COMPANY DOESN'T STAND BEHIND IT ??
Love this camera!!
The RX100 series of cameras are just fantastic.
I have a Canon T4i but for most day to day shooting I go for the sony.
This thing fits nicely in a pocket and takes great shots.
Some of my best shots and almost every unplanned great shot has come from this camera.
Between the very good RAW capture, manual controls, and F1.8 (when zoomed all the way out), this is a truly great portable camera.
I'm not saying this is better than a good SLR but a good SLR doesn't fit in your pocket.
At the same time for most day to day use this will get the job done and done very well.

Review.author: Audi
Review.title: Good enough to replace my Canon 5D2

Text.text: The best compact camera i've ever had in my hands.
Completely replaced my Canon 5D mk2 due to balance of convenience, size and quick-shoot performance.
I don't miss the 5D2 quality when I shoot RAW with this puppy.
Amazon sold a made-in-China RX100 M2.
lens movement is loud and has some clicking noise.
Not sure if this is a 'standard' feature.
Photo quality is sub-par compared to T2i.
Is this due to the poor manufacturing in China?
Box was not sealed.
Only had it a week.
Very solid built.
Heavy for size.
Quality materials.

As a professional photographer who mostly carries a 36 megapixel Nikon D800 SLR, I also needed a strong ultra-compact camera for those times when the big camera is just too much or I need to be inconspicuous in my shooting, and also for convenient personal/family use.
For both uses, I find that the RX-100, Model 2 really exceeds all of my expectations.

Review.author: Pat J. Dooley
Review.title: Amazing P&S camera with near DSLR Image Quality

Text.text: My primary camera is a Sony A65 with a G Series 70-300mm zoom, a macro prime, a wide angle prime and a 18-135mm kit lens.
I shoot wild life, ultra marathons, sunsets, friend's weddings, events and anything else that takes my fancy.
I keep buying point and shoot cameras because I love the idea of a pocket sized camera that is always ready.
But the image quality is never good enough and I end up selling them.
I read the reviews of the RX100 and decided to go all in on the RX100 II.
Maybe this time I'd find a worthy compact camera to supplement my A65.

Review.author: A. Taylor
Review.title: Absolutely Superb. Amazingly Betters Canon in Many Ways.

Text.text: First things first, I am a Canon fanboy.
I love Canon cameras and have been shooting with Canon cameras since my 35mm film days.
This is the first non-Canon camera I have purchased in over 20 years, and I don't regret it one bit.
camera is very good but just only camera.
This camera is definitely more expensive than your average point and shoot, but it is quality for the money.
I was looking for something better than my Canon G9 and I had tried the Canon SX280 and my wife's G12, but I wasn't truly impressed with either.
I have an old Nikon D80, but I wanted something small that packed a lot of power.
I had heard good things about the RX100, so I decided to give the Mark II a try.
I spent a day taking photos that you would normally shoot with a smartphone.
Dogs in a dimly lit room, my lunch at a restaurant... those kind of things.
The photos were truly remarkable.
The white balance is spot on, creating colors that aren't cartoony vivid or cast in blues or yellows.

In the past I had grown used to taking hip-steadied ISO 200 photos for the best possible quality, but the Superior Auto frequently produced ISO 400-800 photos which were better than anything I can manually program.
Truly beautiful images.
Better than my Nikon D80 DSLR, actually.
Very impressed.
I've just bought this camera and I'm pretty happy with it.
Some first impressions:

Review.author: Rich
Review.title: Good pocket camera for still images

Text.text: I spent this weekend playing with the new RX100 II camera.
Here is what I observed:
Image quality is still great.

Review.author: Anne MK
Review.title: I hate how I have to hold the flash and I ...

Text.text: I hate how I have to hold the flash and I can't go back to view videos if I last photographed and vice versa.
very nice
Faster and good quality
Excellent camera upgrade.
Almost as good as a DSLR.
Nice small compact, 1' sensor, hot-shoe, remote, placed a filter adapter on the unit, Ziess lens is 1.8 f/stop, saves jpgs at 350 dbi awesome!

Review.author: N. Goodman
Review.title: ... worried at first and hoping I would receive this great camera at the price listed with no negatives

Text.text: I was worried at first and hoping I would receive this great camera at the price listed with no negatives.
So I've had it for awhile now and....NO negatives!
Lol, I am very happy and very fortunate to have received such a great product at such a great price.
Everything went perfectly.

Review.author: APC Reviews
Review.title: The Sony DSCRX100 is the 'killer app' of P&S travel cameras. A Mini-NEX.

Text.text: The Sony DSCRX100M2 has hit a home run with me for traveling light while not giving up any picture quality.
I am a long time fan and user of Sony NEX/alpha mirror-less cameras, that I will refer to as 'NEX' from here on to avoid confusion.
Over the years I have owned NEX-3, NEX-5n, NEX-7 and a6000 bodies and a wide range of Sony E-Lenses.
But, as wonderful as the NEX camera bodies have been, as compact and easy to carry as they are, you still have to mount normal sized lenses to them.
That hasn't really been a problem.
But I have longed for an NEX type camera that I could tote in a pocket or bag like a point and shoot.
So the Sony DSCRX100M2 and its 20.9 MP 1' Exmor R CMOS sensor was both on my must have list and also something that I was eager to test relative to my past and present NEX/alpha APS-C camera bodies.
Fantastic camera!
Great size and worth the price!

Review.author: Kindle Customer
Review.title: Great camera with tons of functions and easy to carry.

Text.text: We've had this camera for almost two years and still going strong.
It works very well - just charge it up and it takes excellent pictures and video.
Video in particular is really excellent.
Memory cards are easy to put in and take out to transfer to laptop.
Flash works well and is easy to control.
It is small and relatively light, although it can be a bit awkward to carry around.
Awesome takes great pictures

Review.author: California Customer
Review.title: I sent this back as I didn't like the Sony interface compared to that of the Canon ...

Text.text: I sent this back as I didn't like the Sony interface compared to that of the Canon and was also discouraged by the long delays it had when taking pictures.
It takes good quality shots, but it just wasn't the right fit for me.
I would up going with the Canon G7X Mark II and love it.
Awesome pocket camera, best I've ever used.

Review.author: AdamDZ
Review.title: I'm very happy with this camera, wonderful piece of technology.

Text.text: I don't know what to say.
Basically everything good that reviewers said about this camera is 100% true and everything bad reviewers said is grossly exaggerated.
This is a marvel of technology with very little flaws.
Very high image quality, not really DSLR (more noise, weak zoom, can't do shallow DOF like DSLR) but it's good enough that I haven't used my Canon 7D since I bought this camera.
Compared to my old Canon S110 this is way better.
Low light shooting at ISO 1600 is usable.
Fast zoom.
Basically I have no complaints except yeah, the mount screw obstructs the battery door.
Minor thing.
Oh, I love the remote shooting with an iPhone!
A god send on events when you want group photos.
Beats remote controls :)
Best camera I've ever owned.
I was tired of my nighttime and indoor pictures being too dark or blurry... no more!!
If you are on the fence, do it.
Took me a while to take the plunge because of the price tag, but I should have ordered sooner.

Review.author: Jeremy Wilker
Review.title: Don't leave the house without it

Text.text: Incredibly compact with extremely high image quality means you don't ever have to leave this camera at home.
For travel and vacations, this is the best!
The JPG images off this camera hold up to or exceed full-frame DSLR JPGs, so you won't miss any details (and it can shoot RAW, too).
And the video quality is very very good.
I've cut together video from a Sony FS100 and the RX100 and they blend seamlessly.
The 1' sensor does allow for good depth of field.
Batteries seem to last quite a while.
Screen is great.
Flash is actually quite good.
Absolutely love this camera.
It is easy enough to pull out and shoot but advance enough for many photographer as a secondary camera when you don't want to bring the big one out.

Review.author: Susan T.
Review.title: Akward and clumsy to use with small hands

Text.text: Returned it.

Review.author: R. Vincent
Review.title: Professional quality in a pocket sized package

Text.text: This camera delivers quite well on its promises, particularly in low light circumstances.

I attended a Joe Bonamassa concert in May, and set the camera to ISO 1600, Aperture priority, Optical zoom only, and got very good, sharp photos of the concert from our seats in the 7th row of the orchestra.
It's performed admirably in a variety of shoots, from macros in the back yard to family gatherings, and has not let us down once.
It's nice to get the level of quality I'm accustomed to from a heavy bag full of Nikon DSLR bodies and lenses, in such a small, convenient form factor.
The only downside at all is that the Sony Play Memories Software is an absolute nightmare to work with.
Fortunately, I only need use it as a means to offload my photos, which I then 'process' in Adobe's Lightroom.
I get so many compliments on the photos I have taken.
Im always getting asked what kind of camera I use and people are surprised when I tell them.
They are usually expecting me to say I use a huge DSLR.
Although I purchased this really as a camera for taking still photos which by the way are just stunning, it works very well as a camcorder.
In fact it works better than my dedicated Full HD Panasonic camcorder.
I've filmed videos simultaneously with both and side by side comparison shows that the Sony camera does a better job.
Only advantage the panasonic camcorder has is the superior zoom.
As a camcorder it is much superior to some DSLRs I've used such as Canon Rebel T5i which have a hard time auto focusing but not the Sony - its auto focus is quick and accurate.
After 18 months of light use (during which time the camera was never dropped and was always carried in a case), the memory card reader no longer works and all memory cards read as 'locked.'
Because the unit does not register a memory card, it will not save any photos.
The only recourse is to pay out of pocket to send the unit back to Sony for inspection and then shoulder the cost of any repairs.
Needless to say, I would not recommend this camera and would not purchase another Sony digital camera.
I guess there's a reason other brands are more renowned in this space.

Review.author: Cat
Review.title: Ok but not what I expected

Text.text: I had high expectations for this camera but for my surprise, it was just an expensive point and shoot.
The quality of photos were not as crisp and sharp, and the colors were also not that great.
I had a Canon EOS that was great but too big - it was just too big for my trips - I was hoping this would be the one but was not, ended up returning.
Really like it once I got used to it.
I mostly shoot in Aperture mode and then Manual mode.
I don't ever shoot in Auto mode as it chooses shutter speeds too slow for crisp photos.
That's why it gets 4 stars and not 5.
ISO 800 is quite good for me.
1600 not as good.
The camera works fine, I get that I bought a used but it would've been nice to know that then camera won't charge using the micro USB.
Had to purchase a wall charger.
I would've chosen another camera in better condition knowing that.
Other than that, the camera is perfect
Like new condition camera, came with a basic wall charger and battery as expected, quick shipping.

Review.author: PghDrake
Review.title: GREAT camera for an Average Joe going from filming from his phone to nearly professional-looking pictures and movies.

Text.text: I'm going to try to keep this review fairly short because I'm certainly no professional photographer or someone who knows a ton about the inner workings of cameras - what I am is a 'normal guy' who wanted to take better pictures than I can get with my phone (I have an iPhone 6s Plus).
I film shows for a comedy group and snap pictures.
I also used it on a short vacation recently and for stuff around the house/whatever.
Just like a non-enthusiast would - and I can say this was a fantastic purchase.
I'll list a few things I love about it:
Had a first generation that went swimming with me so it died.
After some research I decided on this second generation (used/like new) and I am very happy with it, also.
It's basically the same as a first generation but with some significant improvements.
If you want the smallest camera you can get (fits in a pocket) with a larger then average size sensor this is it.
Picture quality in the enlargements I make is very good.
More advanced photographers will have be able to take advantage of the the settings this camera offers and get some great results.
People who shot auto will still be happy but will not be able to take full advantage of what it can do.
The newest generation (4th or 5th?)
of this camera is a bit pricey - I noticed.
This camera was okay, but I recommend spending a little more money for the Sony A6500.
Best present I ever bought.
Bought one for my mom years ago and then this version for my boyfriend.
It is so versatile and takes great pictures.

Review.author: arnaud lacour
Review.title: great camera, no telephoto but astounding low-light performance

Text.text: Solid camera all around, we carry it with us even if we take the DSLR.
I began my prosumer photography only a few years ago when I bought a Nikon D40X with 15-200mm VR lens back in January of 2007.
I would haul around that camera everywhere I went and got very good at setting and framing shots.
But as time went on I noticed I wasn't taking my camera with me as much, then not at all.
The issue for me was the size and the amount of storage space I required for my other lenses and accessories.
I felt odd carrying all of that around.
I was about to buy the Sony RX100 M2 today (Oct 29, 2013) until I did an online chat with Sony TECH Support.
I asked if the WiFi on the camera is compatible with MAC OS 10.9 (the latest MAC OS).
They told me that NO IT IS NOT compatible.
Then I asked them when Sony would update their software to be compatible with MAC OS 10.9.
The response was NO DATE AVAILABLE.
This was very disappointing to me and my purchase has been cancelled until I have assurance that a very expensive (for me) Sony camera and my MAC with OS 10.9 are fully compatible.
I purchased this camera about a month ago.
The picture quality and versatility provided by this pocket-size point and shoot is simply amazing.
Shoot raw, shoot jpeg, shoot raw + jpeg.
Menus are more intuitive than expected.
But, here is the real surprise--our town set this past Sunday as trick-or-treat day.
I decided to get some photos of neighbor kids in costume as they walked up to our entry for their Halloween handouts.
Best spot in the house, or so I thought, was a second story window overlooking the entry walk.

I fixed the RX100m2 on a small Joby table top tripod (big mistake, the tripod is too light), opened the window, set the tripod/camera on the window ledge and backed off with the intent to be out of sight of the window and trigger the camera with my smartphone app.
Before I could get my smartphone up and running, the tripod teetered, tipped and camera and tripod fell to a rocky garden two stories below.
When I retrieved the camera, to my surprise, not a scratch or dent and it worked flawlessly.
I would not try to replicate this fall, but from my experience, I will say this is one tough little pocket camera.
this pricey new Sony RX 100M II had all the bells and whistles plus wiFi which makes moving pics from camera to other electronics possible.
I am quite pleased with this purchase which arrived ahead of schedule.
I do fine art photography, and my regular camera is a D800.
I got this because I wanted something to carry around all the time, not just when I was specifically on a photo shoot.
This little thing is impressive, not just impressive for its size, but just darn impressive.
While it doesn't have the flexibility that my bigger DSLR's have, when used properly the image quality is absolutely good enough to make big prints that are plenty good enough to show in a gallery.

Review.author: MEKAEEL
Review.title: I upgraded from RX100 only for the Wifi option and wasn't disappointed

Text.text: I'm not a professional photographer and I don't know all the options or modes.
However, the Superior Auto mode in this camera never disappointed me in taking astonishing images.
Since I got the camera I didn't even feel the need to change the mode, just turn it on and snap.
When you see that the results are wonderful you become encouraged to take more pics everyday.
Now I became addicted to carrying my camera everywhere I go.
I have been looking for and pricing point and shoot cameras for quite some time.
I had to decide should, I go in debt and get a full senscor camera or get something very good with a smaller sensor.
Well full sensor point and shoot are more problematic then you would think it not just the price.
A full sensor using average lenses can cause you to lose resolution out away from the center of your pictures.
So to get a point and shoot with a great lens or lens system and full sensor, I would have to pay over $2000 and I just can't see paying that much.
