Review.author: Peter R. Dinella
Review.title: I almost bought it but didn't

Text.text: I came a few clicks away from buying this camera based on all the comments, and that it seemed like a 'replacement' for a DSLR.
I'm very excited about this camera.
First of all, it's a beautiful little thing.
I use Zeiss optics for hunting, the quality is in my opinion excellent, and the lens on this camera is no exception.
I bought it from Amazon after reading this review: [...] - kinda my go-to review place!!
and it was shipped super quick, I think I got it in perfect condition in about 3 days.

Review.author: Moedy
Review.title: perfect camera not so perfect price tag

Text.text: I previously had a rx100 and thought it was the perfect camera minus a few additions I wish it had for it's price.
I wanted it to have wifi, a built in nd filter and maybe more optical zoom.
ND filters can now be attached to the front of the camera with an adapter so that wasn't a problem anymore.
Having wifi is nice but I upgraded to the rx100 II mainly for one thing only which was the ability to control the camera with my smartphone.
I was nervous about this camera because I have always used cannon for a point and shoot camera.
Lately, I have not wanted to lug around my d7000.
My s95 felt so slow it was irritating.
So, I looked at the s110 and a lot of the reviewers mentioned the rx100.
I was going to buy the rx100 and I heard rumors of the update, I preordered the camera as soon as I could.

Review.author: TishKitty
Review.title: Original RX100 is better for Low Light

Text.text: When I first read that they came out with an upgrade to the RX100 in less than a year of it's release and it was $100 more I was frustrated, but Sony's promise of 40% better sensitivity in low light because of the new style sensor I decided to preorder it.

I even asked the Sony reps directly if it was across the board in all ISO's or just because it added one extra high ISO setting of 12800 and they verified it was more sensitive across the board with less noise, I don't see that claim on their website anymore.
I tested both cameras against each other for the last week and the RX100 II requires a lower shutter speed for the same shot, or a higher ISO.
There also seems to be more fringing at 1.8.
I shoot events with a lot of dancers and moving people and I was expecting to be able to use a slightly higher shutter speed so this is a huge detriment for me, I'm sending it back.
It also requires a different case, the screen will not open because the bottom left corner catches on the original Sony case (the new one is cut deeper and more square).
It feels a bit heavier and the flash shoe adds unwanted height (and makes the old case a tight fit).
Comparison photos show approximately the same amount of noise, and while the images might look a bit sharper, it seems because it's at a slower shutter speed or higher aperture.
The RX100's have internal image correction and I believe it may have been changed to increase the contrast and I don't see any way to correct this.
If you only shoot in JPG format, or don't want to do any post processing this might be a nice feature for you, but for manual RAW shooters it's a disadvantage.
I have two other Sony's including an Alpha, this is my back up camera, it's the only brand I have owned since my first digital camera.
I love Sony and if you don't have the original RX100 and don't shoot a lot of night and low light photography it's an excellent camera, but I prefer the original.

Review.author: Paul Noble
Review.title: Simply the best in its class.

Text.text: I have a Canon 5D mk 3 for work, a Leica M9 for play, and a Sony RX-100 MK 2 (and RX 100 for back up) for taking photos!
It and its predecessor are outstanding and outstandingly well designed and built little cameras that I use to catalog my life and travels.

Review.author: Matt Eye
Review.title: Same camera as RX100 with four upgrades

Text.text: The RX100 is agreeably one of the best cameras Sony has ever invented, although its performance falls behind the DSC-HX30V; however, the image quality is far better on the RX100.
This is because the sensor on the RX100 is four times larger.
However, if you mostly shoot video with the camera, the HX30V is a better choice, especially if you prefer to record in 1280x720, which the RX100 cannot do, and neither does the RX100M2.
However, you get the 24p AVCHD 1920x1080 ability to shoot, choice between 17mbps (divide by 8 to get MB per second; 8 bits per byte) or 24mbps.
This is better than the 28mbps at the 60p setting, as each individual frame is less compressed or has more color to it.
Do the math; the 24p versus 60p setting yields about 50% larger file size, useful for extracting a frame from a movie clip.

You cannot shoot stills in the 60p setting, and the image quality is atrocious because a small region of the sensor is used for video-recording, and the file is enlarged to the 17MP (you cannot shoot 20MP stills in video mode because of the aspect ratio at 16:9 versus the 3:2 for the 20MP still setting).
Video quality is the same.
You get very smooth capture at the 60p setting, but the interlaced mode I do not use due to playback problems.
Somehow, it is either my computer, or the interlaced 60i codec does not work as well as the one on an NEX model, for instance.
I am unsure if this issue were resolved, as I have not had the desire to shoot at the 60i setting on the DSC-HX5V, which I used to own but wrote a review on back in the day.
The HX5V's interlaced AVCHD was very jittery and blocky, and that had me frustrated since.

Review.author: R. G. Rottschalk
Review.title: Best camera swap I've ever made

Text.text: I have a habit of selling cameras to get whatever new one sounds great.
I've had Canon 30D, 20D, 2 'L' lenses, a Sont NEX 7 with the 18-55 kit lens.
Didn't want to lug the weight of the DSLRs and the NEX7 demands another $800-&1000 for a lens capable of the technical features of the camera.
I've had the RX100M2 for a week now and am thoroughly pleased.
Image quality is outstanding.
I can crop 10% out of a full sized image and still retain clear detail.
It is small in my large hands but an added Lensmate front grip has solved my confidence in holding it.
I tried he wrist strap for a few days but felt it slightly inadequate considering the value of this camera.
I've ordered the reasonably priced leather strap made for the NEX7.
Maybe I'm old fashioned but I can't imagine trying to carry his fine camera in my pocket with no protection.
A decent LCD screen protector is $11, very with the investment on a $750 camera.
I have a Canon 5d M2 with 24-70, Fuji X pro 1 with 35mm 1.4 but wanted a compact camera.
I've had the RX100M2 for a few days now and i am very happy with it, it is solidly built, images are very good.
I am glad i bought the RX100M2 before i read some of the unfair negative comments about it.

Review.author: J. Chung
Review.title: Better than a DSLR / Mirrorless with bundle lens kit

Text.text: Amazing camera, and simple to use.

Review.author: Ken
Review.title: I can not say enough good things about this camera

Text.text: I can not say enough good things about this camera.
If you are a photo enthusiast that wants a break from the SLR.
This camera is it.
I have tried the mk3 and it is even better.
The images are fantastic from the camera without editing from auto mode.
It gets everything right, and with its fast lens night shots are incredible for a camera that fits in your pocket.
I bought mine from the Amazon used section, it is expensive.
But I am telling you it worth every penny.
And the video is as good as any camcorder on the market.
The fast lens and excellent image quality make it so good.
Get one now and if you are the fence, just do it.
The picture of Cinderella's castle was handheld at night, f1.8 aperture is the real deal.
Best crazy good from something so small.
Very good

Review.author: Amir A
Review.title: Great camera but not worth the price tag

Text.text: Read amazing reviews about this camera for months and finally decided to pull the trigger.
I used it during a trip in Egypt and I honestly was not impressed.
It takes decent photos but it's not worth the price tag.
We ended up using my iPhone 6 for most of the trip and left the camera at the hotel.
We're still hunting for the perfect pocket camera!
Sure, it takes good pictures, like many other devices.
However, true to generations of Sony products, it is woefully incompatible with other products.
Example: If you have an iPhone (or any other phone) it cannot transfer movies recorded in its default (AVCHD) mode to smartphones or your computer.
Poorly thought out.
But typical for Sony, they don't care.

Review.author: Wes
Review.title: Really great camera but for two things

Text.text: Great camera, really, BUT two features would make it so much better.

(1) a more artciulated display that allowed one to hold the camera lower or higher or off to the side and allowed selfies, and (2) an option to give a big bold error if you try to take a still pic or a movie with no chip.
There is an alert for no chip but it is tucked up in a corner where it is easy to overlook.

Review.author: jd
Review.title: The piece I got seemed to be faulty with sporadic ...

Text.text: The piece I got seemed to be faulty with sporadic events of buzzing noise, which wouldn't stop until the camera was restarted.
I would not recommend this camera.
Type this into Google and read the forums ' RX100 buzzing'

Review.author: P. J. DeFranco
Review.title: Best Camera I Have Ever Owned!

Text.text: I purchased this camera approximately two years ago.
During that time period is have used this camera in the coldest mountain tops of Switzerland, fun streets of Paris and the hot weather of southern Italy.
I have never owned a pocket camera this dependable and rugged.
Pictures are awesome and I rarely use the flash.
Absolute best pictures I have ever taken with any camera I have ever owned and wouldn't even consider trading it in for a newer model.
I love this little camera and highly recommend this model.

Review.author: Justin
Review.title: I routinely can get better picture on my smart phone just due to the ...

Text.text: Amazin picture quality, but the focusing on the camera is a joke.
I routinely can get better picture on my smart phone just due to the fact that its able to actually focus on a subject
I love the RX100M2!
I can make a 8 paragraph long review, but to make it short here is my review.

Review.author: L. Ryan M. Douthit
Review.title: Best Compact Camera (for stills or video) Ever!

Text.text: I was doing a video production job and needed something small so I could take stills between setups.
This little camera has been amazing, but it takes some experience to get the most out it.
And, unlike my large cameras, it's not great in low light.
But for a compact, I've never used such a capable little unit.
4-STARS > Picture quality (both video and stills) is superb, outstanding.
MUCH better than my iPhone 5s, much better than my old Panasonic camera.
Controls and menu's are ok, not super complicated, but far from simple.
There is no such thing as the perfect camera.
In general, small cameras must sacrifice picture quality for convenience; most professional grade cameras must sacrifice portability.

I chose the RX-100- II as a possible compromise, choosing portability with the expectation that I would have the camera with me more often, and because of the relatively large sensor the photo quality would satisfy for most purposes.
After about a month of use, I find the camera is slightly less portable than I thought.
At the same time the picture quality far exceeds my expectations.
Like many of my generation, my photography interests started with smart phones.
Unlike many of my peers I was never interested in ruining my photos with instagram(it probably helped that instagram wasn't available for Windows Phone at the time).

I started with the Lumia 920 which was the first smart phone to introduce optical image stabilization; I enjoyed taking superior low light pictures with it and read up about the technology behind OIS.
These pictures while excellent compared to other smart phones still resulted in a lot of blur and/or noise especially with moving objects in low light(a limitation of OIS).
In good light the 920 was merely ok.
I then moved up to the Lumia 1020 which builds upon the 920 by adding a xenon flash, a 41 mega pixel 2/3' sensor with OIS, and full manual controls in the camera app.
The 1020 was a definite leap over the 920, but it still wasn't enough; the slow shot to shot times, the lack of optical zoom, and the inferior optics were enough to convince me to buy a real camera.

Review.author: vvv
Review.title: Protect your investment in the Sony RX-100

Text.text: The BEST thing you can do to preserve the lens & value of this camera is to order/use Mega West's MegaGear Multi-Coated LENS ARMOR UV attached FILTER Sony Cyber-shot RX100, RX100 II.
I bought several so if/when my filter got scratched, I could replace it immediately.

Review.author: Princess of Pima Pell Ekia
Review.title: YOU CAN'T USE THIS CAMERA WHERE WI FI IS PROHIBITED BECAUSE YOU CAN'T TURN IT OFF ON THIS CAMERA. BAD DESIGN.

Text.text: Sony has to rethink the whole Wi - Fi idea because as long as there is NO manual option to turn it off and this has been checked and true by Sony Tech Support - this camera is absolutely useless in many siutations.
This review specifically pertains to buying the RX100M2 from Amazon Warehouse.
I bought the camera as 'used-very good' with the description that it was suppose to have minor cosmetic imperfection on the front .5x.5' and item was repackaged.
When I received it, the only thing that I could tell after very close inspection was maybe a fingerprint on the front of the item.
Other than that, the entire camera appeared completely clean and new with no scratches anywhere.
All accessories were present, and the camera functioned as it should for being turned on for the first time.
The box was original and appeared a bit dinged up.
I highly recommend anyone considering a used purchase to trust the amazon warehouse.

Review.author: raerae
Review.title: Simply awesome!!! But my reason for giving it 4 stars is...

I've been meaning to buy the RX100 but forgot about it and by the time I remembered to get it, this model had already come outâ€¦ And I'm glad I forgot!

Quality, but what else from Sony

Review.author: Mark Vinci
Review.title: Amazing camera. Purchased this to take photos for business

Text.text: Amazing camera.
Purchased this to take photos for business.
I am not a professional photgrapher, but the quality of the pictures make it seem like I am.
I recommend this camera.
Love this camera.
It's small, and I use an adapter so I can use all my old Olympus lenses with it.
This was my second one, purchased for a second/backup body.

Review.author: Ben
Review.title: Takes fantastic photos. The electronic zoom on the kit lens ...

Text.text: Takes fantastic photos.
The electronic zoom on the kit lens seems problematic (first one I got didn't work, but Amazon return went well).
Purchased to go with the inexpensive dive boxes available on Amazon (camera+dive box was cheaper than the dive box for my main SLR).
The dive box I have is:
This camera is amazing.
A small camera with a big sensor.
We took it on a trip to Europe and it fit in the pocket of my jacket but took professional quality images every time.
Specially good in low light and uses HDR automatically if needed.
I got a great photo in a dark Scottish whiskey warehouse with no lights on and no flash - could not believe it.
It is easier than my much more expensive Canon equipment and for 95% of the shots you would take it does just as good a job.
Plus those Canon L lenses are a lot heavier and bigger to tote around.
This is a good camera.
The focus speed is very fast, easy to use

Review.author: Domenica Massamby

Text.text: It does the job!
I wanted a versatile camera that had a stylish design, lightweight, compact and easy interface.
I'm very pleased.
It is as professional as it needs to get for an amateur.
Loved it.
Fantastic little camera

Review.author: Matt
Review.title: Love it. Never moving to anything else up I move up the Sony ladder (maybe a6300 one day) because I do shoot video too

Text.text: Love this camera.
got one when it first came out, sold it a while ago to upgrade, bought a different brand dSLR and then I sold that and bought this again.
I just missed the mirrorless camera and the incredible photos that this takes, even with the kit lens.
Also just missed the Sony brand, their Superior and Intelligent Auto modes are the best auto modes I've ever seen on any camera I've used.

Review.author: Bookrated
Review.title: Mobile app for iPhone is horrible

Text.text: Great camera but their mobile app for wirelessly transferring photos leaves a TON to be desired.
It is not easy.
It is not simple.
It is beyond frustrating.
This is my first mirrorless camera (Nikon D7100 previously) and the pictures on this thing are awesome.
However, the difficulty I've encountered in trying to connect my photos to my iPhone have honestly made me wish I would have stuck with Nikon.
If you have an iPhone, seriously give some thought on how you'd like to transfer your photos.
If you want to do it wirelessly...find another camera.
Best camera purchase!!
I was hoping to replace my Canon EOS-M3 with this camera as the Canon's detachable viewfinder makes the camera kind of awkward to store when it's attached to the camera.
But the images with the Sony a6000 couldn't compare with Canon's and Canon's viewfinder is far superior.
So, I decided to return the Sony and stick with the Canon.
I'm sure at some point Canon will update their design and have a built-in viewfinder.
Meanwhile I really appreciate the quality of the M3 images and will just have to make do with a bit larger carrying case!

Review.author: BELawson
Review.title: Like this camera and have no issues with Sony customer ...

Text.text: Like this camera and have no issues with Sony customer service.
There was an imperfection on the camera mirror and it was fixed and back to me within a matter of days.
There was no issue with warranty.
I registered the camera with Sony as soon as I got it from Amazon.
Happy with camera and Sony customer service.
love this camera.
using in all of my photography right now.

Review.author: grant carter a/k/a Turnip Truck Driver
Review.title: probably the best amateur photography camera for the price made today

Text.text: Very impressed ...probably the best amateur photography camera for the price made today.
Great Camera But.
The 'but' is the battery life.
It borderline unacceptable.
I've tried all the fixes and nothing is running that isn't absolutely necessary and the battery won't last even 3 or 4 hours in some situations of intermittent shooting.
I always have two or three spares available.
Even in the off state with the eye sensor protected it can go dead in 10 days.
Its basically good picture performance is the only thing that prevents me from giving it a zero.
Awesome pictures!
Really a good camera!

Review.author: Madison Taskett
Review.title: Makes me Look like a Better Photographer than I am

Text.text: I was nervous to relinquish my DSLR but since I travel full-time, I really wanted a smaller camera that I could take with me everywhere.
Now that I have my Sony a6000, I wish I'd made the switch much sooner!
This baby is GREAT in low light (check out my night photo attached) and captures colors vividly.
It's intuitive to use, whether you just want to point-and-shoot or if you want to go into manual mode to snap the perfect shot (either way you use it the photos will be fantastic).
This is a great camera, I'm an amateur at photography but with this camera, my shots come out like professionals.
I'm still learning.
Great camera!
Great service and awesome camera.

Review.author: Doug C
Review.title: Glad I made the choice to go with Sony

Text.text: Just what I was looking for.
This camera does everything I want.
Glad I made the choice to go with Sony.
As I figured this camera went way beyond my expectations.
It could be used to do weddings product photography anything.
Took some pictures of my grand kids and they were gorgeous

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Great camera. Now I just need to buy some ...

Now I just need to buy some additional lenses.

Review.author: amazon buyer
Review.title: No auto zoom or fix zoom in auto tracking mode ...

Text.text: No auto zoom or fix zoom in auto tracking mode but very FAST auto object tracking with clear video.
However the image color is too wash out
Love this camera!
I started many years ago with the Canon AE-1; I have owned Nikon, Fuji, and several smaller Sony cameras.
This one is relatively small, light, and takes great photos -- especially in low light.
I have the Sony SELP18105G E PZ 18-105mm F4 G OSS lens which I have used with it to shoot over 100 photos at this point.
I have also used it for video -- no overheating problems which I think were solved with a firmware update.
Just an amateur, but this camera can make you look like a pro.
You can spend a lot more money, but if you're not making money with it it's probably a waste.

Review.author: L. Johnson

Text.text: Takes great pictures and the auto focus is incredibly fast, and quite.

Review.title: So far my iPhone pictures are better in every way than my a6000

Text.text: I would rate this camera with the kit lens as 3 stars..
I would rate the iPhone 6s camera as 4 stars.
So far my iPhone pictures are overall consistently better than my a6000.
As one reviewer said: 'The kit 16-50 f3.5-5.6 lens is very unsharp, yielding at best, 6 megapixels of detail (usually less).
A pretty depressing number, considering the camera has a 24-megapixel sensor.
Additionally, the lens has horrid distortion'.
That said, the camera will occasionally get used on the job for wide, telephoto, macro and portrait shots.
At least until I can afford better glass.
Make sure you can afford better glass, or you will be downgrading from your smartphone!

Can't wait to learn more.

I am very impressed with the sharpness of my image.
The camera has a viewfinder which I find to be an essential feature.
The camera is small and lightweight so I can take it for times when I do not want my bigger camera.
Lenses are interchangeable so I can do all ranges of distance.
Love the camera.
Must develop better photography skills to get those impressive stills, but the two auto and intelligent auto modes are awesome.
very good!

Review.author: pedro salinas
Review.title: Bad quality. Bought it for a family trip and ...

Review.author: Wildflower7200
Review.title: Everything seemed to be just right

Text.text: Love this camera

Review.author: RealPGA
Review.title: ... for golf course and real estate photography and have enjoyed it very much (I'm pretty much a novice photographer)

Text.text: I purchased this camera in early June of last year for golf course and real estate photography and have enjoyed it very much (I'm pretty much a novice photographer).
The reason I'm writing this review is because the lens that came with the camera is now malfunctioning.
It will cost over $120 to repair it since the warranty is for only one year.

I'm pretty disappointed and I don't think I'll be purchasing another Sony product in the near future.
I should have stuck with a Canon product based on the experience I had with my rugged PowerShot S3 IS that I owned for 10 years with absolutely no problems.

Review.author: Be Cool

I purchased this camera in May 2016.

Turn power off then on.'
Needless to say, turning the camera off and on did nothing.
Searching on Google didn't help, other than to connect me with other frustrated users.
I contacted Sony support, who told me my only option was to send the camera in for an out of warranty repair.
The cost?

Only downside is the expensive price.

Had to purchase seperate.

Lots to learn but it's definitely everything u hoped for.
Awesome image quality and price

Review.author: Balbuena

Review.title: Love the camera but have not had the time to ...

Text.text: Love the camera but have not had the time to really play with it.
I will work it hard in the next few months but so far so good.
I have the Sony NEX-6 and bought the Alpha6000 so I'd have two similar cameras to do some weddings, gatherings, and any other photography I do without always changing lenses and fiddling around.
I love this camera.
It is everything the NEX-6 is and more.
Looks less well made than the NEX and is lighter but seems durable (I dropped it out of my bag accidentally).
The extra megapixels is huge for me as I live near the beach and want to start selling some of my landscape and wildlife shots.
It seems a little better than the NEX in low light and is a little more user friendly although mostly the same menu-wise, which I like.
I would probably give it a 4.5 if I could because I don't know if anything deserves 5 stars but it has delivered everything I have needed so far.
[...] ...for my Sony Alpha shots.
very nice camera.
takes great pix.
fast shooting.
I do wish the 16-50mm lens was just a bit faster, like f:2. iso up to 12,000 makes it very flexible.
still very handy.
I like that only 2 lenses cover this broad a focal length spectrum.
This camera is great.
It connects very easily to your phone with the smart remote app.
The pictures and video have amazing quality for the purpose of a family camera.
The camera is in a much smaller package which makes it easy to pack or carry.
Great product from Sony!
Nice camera.

It was shipped from Amazon Warehouse, so if you get it used from somewhere else it may not be as good.

Review.author: mark Jenkins
Review.title: Love this! Just what I needed

Text.text: Love this!
Just what I needed.
Great camera that takes superb photos.
It's smart so you don't have to be!
BOY I AM UNHAPPY.
I bought a Sony A6000 as a small carry camera.
Very disappointing!!!
The photographs are of average quality but that is what I kind of expected as I am accustomed to the high quality images of Nikon and Canon.
The video, WHO KNOWS, I cannot even download it to view let alone edit it to a common format and burn to DVD.
It seems to be a Sony proprietary format.
I have spent many hours looking for software that will convert it to a common format for editing and burning, So far no success!
I have the Sony Movie Studio Platinum 12 and it is not compatible.
I downloaded the Sony PlayMemoriesHome and it tells me it will not accept the format either.
This Sony software wants to control your whole system of video and photographs and that is NOT ACCEPTABLE as I use many types of software depending on the photograph type and content.
It burns up batteries and only takes between 50 to 75 photographs and I must change batteries.
If one leave the camera dormant for a few days, even though it was100% at the time, the battery has run done and you have to recharge it.

Review.author: W. Lockwood
Review.title: Decent camera maybe, but terrible documentation and poor standard lens ruin the experience

Text.text: I've been a photographer for my entire lifetime and was excited to get the a6000 based on reviews.
This is my first and perhaps last Sony camera product I will own.
So far I have owned it for a month and I must say that I am disappointed with the camera.
The main issue is that instead of being an enhancement, the technology side of the camera is in your face, literally.
The issue here is the absolutely abysmal documentation.
All that comes with the camera is a poor quick start guide.
Maybe I am spoiled by my previous cameras, which have all been Canons.
Their documentation have been excellent even as their cameras became more electronic and complex.
The other issue is the stock lens.
They are disappointingly soft.
This camera is just the right size and takes wonderful pictures.
I currently am using my old Canon F1 lenses via adapters with great success.
I only wish the Sony lenses were more reasonably priced as most of them are the cost of the camera and more.
My favorite lens is the 35-105 Canon FD zoom, which with the adapter, makes it a well balanced piece of equipment.

Review.author: Thomas
Review.title: Great camera, finding the right lenses is harder.

Text.text: Great little camera well worth the reduced price.

Finding the right lenses was harder, but after trying just about everything suggested and reviewed I ended up keeping the Sigma 1.4 30mm, the Sigma 2.8 60mm, and the sony 2.8 90mm macro (huge lens, but awesome picture quality).
The zooms are do not touch these and if a zoom is truly needed I would suggest a different system.
Everything about this camera is great, except one thing.
Wonderful for beginners

Review.author: Professional Filmmaker

Text.text: Its a b cam for my Sony fs100.its quality is just as good as my fs100 for video but if you will want video Your better off getting the black magic pocket camera.
It's only 100$ more.
You have no audio capabilities except for the built in microphone but it's usable for upclose personal selfie videos.
It's great to have a camera I can just press record and trust it's auto focus.
Battery life is bad.
This was was all the money.
Have used it every chance I can get.
The only reason I am not giving this camera 5 stars is because of a couple small features I wish had been addressed long ago before it was put on the market.
Excellent camera, great controls, high quality images, many lens options.
I have the 16mm, 35mm, 60mm, 18-55 zoom and 18-200 zoom.
Compact system, easy functions, very happy with this camera.
Very nice little camera.
A great carry around camera that takes pretty amazing pictures.
Excellent small mirrorless camera that can keep up with the big boys.
great camera, lots of useful features and professional grade images.
I love this camera!!
Awesome photos!

Review.author: Tina
Review.title: Loved its size and the pictures were just fine

Text.text: I could only record short 15 min clips as it overheated every time.
I it is spring here and temps that day were in the 50s, I am not sure what would happen in the warm summer.
So if you are looking for video and picture camera this is probably not the one for you.
Do a little research on this topic before buying just to be certain you are okay with this overheating problem.
Solving the overheating issue is nearly impossible, leaving the battery open/screen out...not interested.
During my special moments I can not consider this at all a reliable camera.
Loved its size and the pictures were just fine, but the camera issue of video is why I had to return it.

Review.author: Ray Drohan
Review.title: Can't say enough about how good this little camera is

Text.text: Can't say enough about how good this little camera is.
With cheap adapters and focus peaking you can use most vintage lenses with manual focus.
Excellent camera, so happy I purchased it.
Has been great for recent trips and taking pics at family events.
It's sleek, light and fast.
This camera has helped me to reach the next level of photography for my business.
Definitely get a fast card though.
If you don't then you will constantly be waiting for the card to catch up with the speed of the burst shots.
I am the proud owner of my first state of the art camera, the Sony a6000 crop sensor.
It has all the features I can imagine an amateur and a professional would need.
It takes great pictures and is so very user friendly..

Text.text: The lens that came with this camera stopped working 17 months after purchase.
Only used camera for special occasions.

This review will evolve as I get to know the camera better.

They provide a quick start manual about 30 pages that does not begin to cover the camera's features, and it is tricky to locate the 200+ page manual online that covers everything, and even the longer manual doesn't explain everything.
Great camera so far so good

Text.text: I've had this camera for more than 2 years now and they are sturdy enough for family trips!
many times I strap it on my neck and it swings on to objects and walls and it still works perfectly fine!
im not saying you should do that to put it to the test, but im letting you know that ive had many scenarios when i thought i broke them but they didnt.
ive travelled with them even sometimes without a case and just slipping it into a bag.
Needless to say more on how this camera can withstand a good level of neglect for care.

In fact I am tempted to say that it beats the quality of my Nikon 7100, though I can't verify this without more sophisticated equipment.
Of course the camera is very compact.
And if you keep it on airplane mode when you don't need wireless transmission, the batteries are long lasting.

I can't wait to learn more and expand my lens collection.

i loved it

Text.text: Everything I hoped for and more.

Easy to use

Review.author: Da Lowrider
Review.title: It's small and out of the way, perfect to have along .. just in case.

Text.text: I bought this camera two years ago this month.
Only shot about 10k with it but .. enough to know it does a good job.
I bought it for the times I didn't feel like carrying around one of my Nikon cameras and gear or the times I didn't think I'd be using a camera for anything serious or at all.
You know how that is, you jump in the car, don't take a camera and voila ..
THERE IT IS .. that perfect opportunity.
Or perhaps you want to go for a bike ride, a walk in the park, maybe down the street for a cuppa joe.
It's way better than any cell phone wannabe camera that simply isn't going to get it done.
I mean if you like postage stamp pixelated images you're ok with a cell phone camera.
For my uses the a6000 is a great camera.
It fills a niche for me.
For serious photography, I'm a Nikon guy, through and through.
I wish it had the selfie-screen.
awesome camera that is easy to use.

Review.author: P. Carpineta
Review.title: Light weight and compact mirrorless camera

Text.text: The camera, plus good lenses, equals to a great performance.
Even for a 2014 model!
The Sony a6000 is an amazing little compact camera for my food photography needs.
I manage social media for a restaurant and while my Nikon is an excellent camera, it does not have the capability to communicate with my phone (though I could probably get an adapter).

But I am able to shoot, transfer to my phone, edit photos in my mobile photoshop app and post real time whereas with mg Nikon, I have to take out my memory card, insert to laptop, edit in the real lightroom, save and post.It just takes mich longer.
But the Sony a6000 has been great and transfers photos in less than 5 seconds.

Review.author: Mike
Review.title: Quick to use, Very fast and lightweight. Just a few quirks...

Text.text: At this time I'm not sure I could recommend buying the Sony A6000 camera.
After researching multiple cameras for a dependable, lightweight and powerful cam for traveling I transitioned from my Nikon 3400 DSLR to the Sony A6000 with high hopes.
I initially got used to the lens 16-50mm having slightly dark edges and even chalked up the blurred images to my amateurish abilities with a new camera.
Unfortunately, what I cannot ignore is how the camera does not always function when needed.
I've had the battery go from 50% to zero while on a gorgeous evening walk making me switch to my cell phone cam for backup.

Another issue that seems to be getting worse since I bought this just shy of a month ago is the software occasionally seizes like a computer having a driver issue and requires me to power off then on (reboot) to reset it.
This has happened three times in the last week.
I've also noticed after a picture, if I turn the cam off and this happens even with a full battery, the lens does not always retract.
I have to 'power-cycle' the camera a few times to get it to retract the lens.
Overall, the camera is fast and does take great photo's but the 'quirks' are quickly adding up.

Another quirk would be that in order to view the pictures in lets say Adobe Photoshop or any other photo editing software I use I first need to covert the pics from using Sony's proprietary format ARW or Sony's (Alpha RAw) format.
This format is default and your pics must be converted to another format after the fact.
This is not impossible, it just adds another step in the processing and is a little annoying.
The software is free and can be easily downloaded and installed from Sony's site on the off chance you wish to test this out before purchasing your camera.
An example of why this is annoying.
In order to upload example photo's for this review, I first had to cover them to JPEG.
I will say, however, when uploading for google photos I did NOT need to covert them.
Whats up Amazon?
Good camera.
Poor me.
Ahah ahah.
Easy to use.
My wife like it
You would expect it will last longer than 1.5 years when you paid $600+ for a camera.
Mine prompted 'Camera Error Turn Power Off Then On' in the middle of vacation and never recover and Sony wants me to pay $200+ to send it for diagnostic minus the parts & labor.
Looks like I will never buy Sony ever again and I will make sure all my friends & families stay out of SONY.
Stay away or you might have to buy extended warranty for this crappy product.

Review.author: Chong C Campbell
Review.title: Great Camera! light and small, fits in my hand well.

Text.text: I like the small and lightness, taking a very clear pictures.

Review.author: ImmortalJeremy
Review.title: A few setbacks donâ€™t mean itâ€™s a bad camera

Text.text: Thatâ€™s what I said within seconds of using this camera.
I came from a dedicated camcorder that cost me $1,000.
Sold it and bought this and the 50mm 1.8 from Sony.
Best decision ever.
The 1080p looks almost like 4K because of the large sensor size and downsampling.
Pictures are crisp and it has many pro level features in an affordable package.
My only regret is not buying a 6500 for 4K and less overheating.
Iâ€™ve had this camera overheat at the worst of times but overall it never killed my final product.
As long as youâ€™re prepared with a b cam, itâ€™s not a huge deal breaker.
Never has overheated from photos, even full speed.
Only once you record 50mbps video for about 15 minutes in sunlight or 20 minutes indoors.
Screen out battery door open you may can squeeze a couple more seconds, but it doesnâ€™t solve it for good.
Hooked up to an external recorder does solve the issue it seems.
I do hope Sony includes a micro fan in any future models in this line that cuts on when the temp warning comes on.
Wouldnâ€™t even matter if it made a little noise.
Overall though, this was a GREAT buy and this camera made me switch from canon.
My wife has a T5 and it doesnâ€™t even compete, even with similar lenses despite being a similar price.

To get this setup on Cannon would cost you hundreds more, possibly even a thousand more... itâ€™s like buying a Mac just for the name... itâ€™s worse than a custom desktop at the same price... similar story here.
You get more bang for buck ..You canâ€™t go wrong with this camera, despite flaws Iâ€™ve mentioned.

Review.author: Mon Vandy
Review.title: If photography is a hobby, this is a great camera!

Text.text: I can not speak to how professionals would use this camera because i am not one.
I use this for video and photos just as a hobby.
The focus and clarity really led me to want this camera.
Its easy to change the settings and its easy to use.
I really dont know that much about cameras.
I have had two canons and now this one.
This is the best one i have had and dont plan on purchasing a new camera.
I still use it for Everything depending upon the lens, this camera is superb.
Love my camera.
Just got this camera and it is all I hoped.
Takes great pictures and easy to work.
I love this camera, great pictures even in low lights.
Same said for videos, Incredible shoots, I love it.
The very best mirrorless camera.
I love it and appreciate all it does.
Quite a nice little camera.
I did not want to take my larger
A great camera body by Sony.
Well designed, Sony has created a nice durable product.
One of the greatest camera packages ever made.

Review.author: sail4life
Review.title: So glad i switched to Mirrorless

Text.text: I was a little nervous about switching from a dslr but once I did I am glad.Believe it or not there was a learning curving going to mirrorless.
But the size and weight is a big difference from my Nikon D5000.
Only thing I do not love is the sttap and will probably switch to a new lense.
Lastlythe eye piece is sensitive if your finger is by it thwn it will turn of the lcd screen thinking your using the eye piece.
The camera body works great, and the image quality is quite good for a kit lens.. however.. my kit lens came, apparently, with some imperfections in it.
when I use apertures f22 or above some dots start to show up in my photos.
I thought it was dust so I cleaned up my lens but, these dots won't come off, it really looks like there are some imperfections inside my lens.
I'd give this camera 5 stars but having these dots in my pictures is really disappointing, for $700 i was expecting better quality control.
I like the camera itself.
However, after a few weeks of light use one of the dials stopped working on the top.
It was still under warranty so Sony told me to send it to Precision Camera to get fixed.
Ten days passed and I received my camera back and the defect was still present.
It's a fairly obvious defect so it appears that no one at PC verified that it was fixed.
Sony had me send the camera back to PC to get it fixed again.
This time I included detailed instructions on how to reproduce the issue.
Ten days more days pass, I receive the camera back and it's still broken.
I call Sony yet again and they tell me they will send me a new camera but they need me to send it back to PC as a formality.
This is almost 6 weeks since I initially sent it in for repairs.
Now I find out that the camera is being shipped back to me and is 'Fixed'.
I bought this camera to to take pix of our newborn and have missed a month and a half of priceless memories because of this abysmal customer service.
Nice camera.
sent it back the battery life was horrible.....
Excellent camera.
Super light and focuses fast.
Don't buy this camera.
It will break, and Sony customer service is of zero help, even though the camera is 6 moths old and under warranty.
If there was a zero star rating, that's what their camera service deserves.

Review.author: BPunzAmazon
Review.title: A6 goes the mile and more.

Text.text: Top notch at an unbeatable price.
I've been using the a6 for little over a year and have yet to complain about it.
It's one of the best mirriorless with tons of functions and addons.
The smaller size, yet super powerful.
Make sure you update the firmwares so everything runs smoothly.
This camera would be absolutely fabulous to take on vacations or for travel.
The features are wonderful and it delivers great quality photos in raw.
I bought it as a second camera for wedding photography.
I have the spider holster and thought it would be a lightweight and way easier option to carry on my hip.
The photos were wonderful but I noticed that the hot spots were a lot more exaggerated with this camera and I just can't deliver a product that is not the best quality.
I bought this with the prime wide angle lens and like I said, they would be perfect for vacations or travel.
I think if I decide to go mirrorless I am going to have to opt for a way more expensive camera unfortunately.
I love

Review.author: Debbie Reid
Review.title: This camera takes great photos and video

Text.text: This camera takes great photos and video.
I bought this camera because I am into video and wanted a good still camera as well.
I thought I could kill two birds with one stone by buying this camera.
Well if you use want to use this primarily for video.
Forget it.
I am only able to take video with my old manual Nikon lens.
When using the automatic Sony lens that comes with the camera, The unit over heats and shuts down.
Now I am going to have to buy a Video camera so that I can video without the unit shutting down after 10 minutes or so.
I am looking at the Sony FDXR53 which I think I would really like but now I'm kind of afraid to buy Sony because of the over heat problem with this camera.

Review.author: Free Range Clickin'
Review.title: So much bang for the buck - a great travel camera!

Text.text: I've had the a6000 for two years now, and never a moment's buyer's remorse.
The camera's many functions and features are well covered in other reviews so I won't re-invent the wheel here.
This is usually my go-to camera, and my first choice for a travel camera.
Had it for over a month now and have used it for 1000+ pics.
I love it!

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: not knowing that it's useless without a lens attachment

Text.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas, not knowing that it's useless without a lens attachment.
She was very disappointed and now I have to figure out what lens to buy.
Wish it came ready to use.
Obviously we are novices.

Review.author: GO FOR IT
Review.title: Very compact and the image quality seems to be quite good. Will update in a month

Text.text: Just got my hands on it.
Very compact and the image quality seems to be quite good.
Will update in a month.
Camera was delivered a day earlier than promised.
It works great and there are many features to learn about.
Great, great camera.
I won't go into the good things since others have already done that quite well.
My small complaints are with the menu system, the sound quality and the shutter noise.
The menu system is manageable if you have loads of time to find things, but in a hurry its difficult to find the exact mode and setting changes.
The audio quality is not good.
The equalization is very thin and tinny.
And the slightest wind negatively affects the sound.
I take a lot of 5-10 min videos where the camera is stationary and just captures the ambiance of the location, e.g., beach, mountains, travel, etc.
The wind noise is terrible.
I've tried the mic attachment; while its better, its a headache to attach.
Given all the high-quality audio recorders out there (even my iPhone records better audio), Sony should have better audio at this point.
And the shutter noise...
I know the design of a mirrorless camera usually means there will be a physical shutter noise, but its loud.
Taking silent pictures of animals, children, speaker presentations, etc, is almost impossible without everyone hearing you.
When my iPhone can take silent pictures, the technology on mirrorless has to match it.

Review.author: Dylan Timov
Review.title: Disappointed with the White Balance and the software

Text.text: I bought the camera in February and noticed there is an issue with the white balance.

It was $367.29 and didn't know that I should expect an issue with the camera, however when I was taking my first photographs I noticed that the image is very blueish and I always have to edit it afterwards, which shouldn't be an issue with a $700 camera.
This happens in AWB mode and to prove this, I went to BestBuy and B&H in NYC to compare it with an A6000 there and they confirmed that the camera has a major issue with the white balance.
I could clearly see the temperature on my camera was way blueish than the A6000 in B&H.
It's very disappointing to know that I now have to pay for a repair (possibly around $200) and my favorite camera is faulty, which wasn't explained in the description at the time of purchase.
Bought it for a friend who takes it everywhere - it's a workhorse.

Review.author: M. Harmison
Review.title: Great camera for everyday use and travel

Text.text: I've been very happy with this camera.
I only wish it had a GPS encoding feature.
We got it for our trip to Australia and New Zealand and took thousands of pictures over the course of a month.
I love the light weight and small size.
I use a wrist strap instead of a neck strap and that is very handy.
Battery life was fine, but I did buy some extra batteries and needed one when we were out all day.
The features available are amazing, but it is still easy to use.
I will be mastering it for months more to come.
There are some great tutorials on the web and I'd encourage you to watch them.
I've had this camera for about 9 months now and although not perfect, I love it!
I use mine for backpacking and astrophotography.
It is good and convenient to carry.
Great camera.
Better performance than my previous NEX6.
Easy to use....takes amazingly clear pictures.
Love it !
Take good picture
Before you buy this camera, be aware Sony's photo and video down loader (PlayMemories Home) to your computer DOES NOT WORK if you have a Microsoft computer with operating system 10.
I've been trying for 2 days now to get mine to work, ever since Microsoft updated my computer!
Talked to their representatives in the Philippines and the last person I talked to today admitted they are having problems with PlayMemories Home.
It will NOT work, so you will have to find some way other than using PlayMemories Home to download your pics & vids from your camera to your computer.
I like the camera, but Sony isn't concerned about the problem I'm having.
One of the Philippino reps was so rude, I had to tell her good bye as she kept typing and was not helping me with the issue I presented her with.
for the price this is a phenomenal camera
With everything that has been said about this camera, it is becoming pointless to rave further, especially now that Sony has announced its successor, the a6300.
But I will say that as a Sony Alpha 900 user, pining for mirrorless but reluctant to 'step down' to an APS-C sensor, I was immediately blown away by this camera.
The image quality is actually better than that of my old Alpha 900 (R.I.P.).
It has similar resolution, but better low light capability, better color, and better noise.
Yes, even the noise - when you can see it - is better!
Softer, rounder, more natural.
Seeing such beautiful images come from such a small camera has rekindled my passion for photography.
So if you are tempted by mirrorless, reluctant to move from full-frame to crop sensor, but can't afford an A7 - then I recommend going for the a6000 or its successor the a6300.
Their small size, incredible auto-focus, and after-market versatility make these little cameras a joy to use, and with image quality that can scarcely be believed.

Review.author: Kit Hautamaki
Review.title: Love the camera - takes great pictures

Text.text: Love the camera - takes great pictures.
Perfect size, fits nicely in my hand.
I'm an amature photographer and it took some time to learn the various functions, however once you do it's easy to use.
Sometimes I can't even close it fully.
otherwise it's okay

Review.author: brhoff
Review.title: It arrived on time and love it! As with any new camera it takes ...

Text.text: It arrived on time and love it!
As with any new camera it takes a while to learn how to use all of the features, but love it's size, image quality (especially low-light), features, and ease of operation.
Would highly recommend for a camera at this price point..

Review.author: Blackhorse
Review.title: Astonishing competency for the investment cost...and way fun!

Text.text: My fourth digital camera over the years, obviously the most completely competent.
I mean, it is stunningly good at doing things that we had no idea we had to have even five years ago.
You're reading this because you're thinking of buying one?
In your search for info you should go to U Tube and search under the camera name...TONS of top of the line pro reviews, etc.
Some are a pain to watch but most are very good.
I'll stress keeping 'what is right for your specific intended uses' as what should be your underlying mantra while doing your pre purchase research.
For me...vacation/travel/family/image quality/value for investment/use of old lenses...were what was most important.
I got the silver body and kit lens, a nice bag, Wasabi charger and 2 batteries and an extra Sony 32 GB fast memory card for a stunning $550 just after New Year.
The camera is rated as best in class for a wide variety of functions and 'as good as' on most others...up against darn near anything.
Often out does current gear costing 3 - 4 times as much.
Jack of all trades...master of a bunch as well.
Example: I have an OLD Olympus 50mm f1.2 prime and a classic Vivitar 70-200mm zoom of incredible quality...and I can use them via a $25 adaptor.
And they work WELL thanks to several of the a6000's unique focusing features making the required manual focus thing do-able.
I started out in the 70's with the fabulous Olympus Pen FT half frame I carried all over Viet Nam in my cargo pocket.
A roll of 36 got me 72 shots.
The lens was about 38-40mm f 1.2 as I recall...a stunner for resolution.
Now we do digital with Light room and memory cards and sensors and mega pixels and whatnot.
What a wonderful world.
And in that world there are very few cameras that will do that this camera does especially when it has good glass on it.
As a well rounded, vastly usable, bang for the buck camera, IMHO it's the king.
Great camera and kit lenses.
Love this camera.
Great response.
Great features.
Definitely recommended.
If ever there was a physical embodiment of the word 'compromise,' it would be the a6000.
When I saw that the 55-210 bundle was on sale for Christmas of 2015, I made the impulsive decision to sell all my Canon DSLR gear and jump ship for Sony mirrorless.
I think I wanted something fresh and new.
And in that regard, the a6000 certainly delivers.
Before I go any further, I'll say that I'm actually returning the camera, but not because it isn't great.
Sony is rumored to be releasing the follow-up to the a6000 in the coming months, and I'm hoping that it addresses some of my concerns.

Review.author: Glenn Hoskins
Review.title: I purchased it to replace my Canon t4i and am very satisfied with it

Text.text: I've had my a6000 for several months now and have taken several thousand images with it.
I purchased it to replace my Canon t4i and am very satisfied with it.
I am amazed at how quickly I have gotten used to viewing and composing images using the digital screen rather than the electronic view finder.
This is something that was almost impossible to do with the Canon because of the slowness of the Live View feature in the Canon camera.
Image quality is great, even with the stock lens.
Videos are great as well.
I purchased this camera in anticipation of our first grand child and am very glad I did.
The fact that you can take 11 frames per second with focus tracking is very cool!
FABULOUS Camera!
Camera overheats when video taping.
It gets very hot and a message warning appears and the camera shuts off.

Review.author: Pamela Leanza
Review.title: This camera is nice and light and compact

Text.text: This camera is nice and light and compact.
And takes great pics.
I'm still learning to use all the features!
I didn't buy this through Amazon, but I figured I would leave a review here anyways.
This is a great camera.
I love the object recognition feature for autofocus.

Review.author: EtherImp
Review.title: Returned camera as images came out with a blue tint

Text.text: We ultimately returned this camera as the images came out with a blue tint (using the default settings).
The camera was smaller than most DSLRs (which was nice in some ways), but we found it difficult to hold the camera and not press buttons or bump up against the lens.
Given the excellent ratings of the Sony a6000 on the DPReview website, we were disappointed.
Should mention the camera has a fast shutter speed and other than the blue tint, the images were of high quality.
The a6000 is a great Camera this is my second.
good camera
Great camera.
I LOVE this camera, the only thing is I wish it has a flip screen.
NOT for self vlogging.
Doing everything as promised.
Love it.

Review.author: Sam
Review.title: But the EVF remains dead unless you let it cool and then reset (reboot) the camera - it would ...

Text.text: Sony is no longer a quality brand name.
I have the NEX7, the top of the alpha mirror-less camera line before they changed the name to Axxxxx.
It broke after 2 years (used a couple of times a year for vacation).

The EVF finder stop working, and the camera heats up and the battery is drained if you leave it on for more than a few minutes, so now I have to constantly switch it off after every a couple of shots.
But the EVF remains dead unless you let it cool and then reset (reboot) the camera - it would then work until you leave the camera on for too long, then the whole problem starts again.
Sony is expensive and extremely unreliable, so now I stay away from Sony cameras.
Exactly what I was expecting!

Review.author: mjb
Review.title: very happy with results so far and still discovering all the ...

Text.text: my first graduation from a point and shoot.
very happy with results so far and still discovering all the new goodies
I love this camera, the size is perfect it i not as bulky as the Nikon DSLR's.
I also love the color I have the white one and it looks very nice!
The picture quality is very nice, the pictures comes up very sharp and colorful, there is no need to edit.
Overall this camera is very good one of the best out there!
This is a great camera but has too many adjustments available.
The video quality is excellent, photos are good but not great.
Also the macro does not work that well.
But for the size it can't be beat by the competition!

Review.author: keren
Review.title: NO GOOD - GO FOR THE A7 II INSTEAD!

Text.text: I found this product to be a disappointment, shots are often blurred or simply don't look good.
I've been through many cameras over the past few years and none has been 'it' like this Alpha a6000.
It produces the closest images I've seen to professional quality from a compact camera.

Review.author: unclegar
Review.title: Great camera. Wish I had ordered the zoom with it.

Text.text: I haven't explored all the options on this camera but I have taken some very nice pics with it.
Mainly portrait type photos, like family members.
I ordered this during a package sale and ordered just the camera and basic lens, bag, gift card and memory.
I also ordered a larger memory card and battery charger with 2 batteries.
I had second thoughts after placing the order, but before it had been shipped.
I tried to reach someone to ask about adding the zoom lens as well since I realized it was a bargain at only an additional $150 added to the package.

I could not reach anyone that spoke English well enough to understand my problem and my question, 'Was it an option to still add the zoom lens to the package and pay the difference for the upgraded package since that was a different package offered at the time I ordered it.'
After some explaining, I was afraid my current package was going to be canceled so I ended up stressing that the package I ordered was fine and I wanted no changes.
A little disappointing but the camera was in good shape and I think I will be very happy with it once I have had the opportunity to use it more.
The basic lens really has very little zoom so be aware of this if you order it.
My issue was more with the Amazon order modifying process than the actual item being reviewed.
Love, Love, LOVE!
I got this camera for Christmas and it is amazing.
The quality is some of the best I have seen.
I am not a professional photographer but this allows me to take great quality photos would definitely recommend to anyone looking to capture high quality images of life's special moments.

Review.author: Yuan Yang
Review.title: If I left it in there for a month and the better died, I wouldn't be so surprised

Text.text: I purchased this camera in Nov 2015 however I have not used it too often.
After a few use lately, I found the battery would be exhausted if I left it in the camera for 3 to 5 days.
If I left it in there for a month and the better died, I wouldn't be so surprised.
I don't know if this is a common issue for this camera or just mine is defective.
I'm totally disappointed for this product.
Great camera for the price.
FANTASTIC for videography.
It honestly rivals cameras that are thousands of dollars comparatively.
Sony consistently hits it out of the park with their cameras!
The autofocus with video on this is wild.
Love this camera!

Review.author: Christopher Mantz
Review.title: very good if you're into photography and having a dedicated camera.

Text.text: This is a solid camera.
Takes great pictures and quality video.
I am returning it.
I like to travel and be on the go.
Having a dedicated camera is extra work for me.
It is much easier to use my phone (Samsung Galaxy s8) to take photos and videos and edit them on my phone.
One draw back to the camera is the lack of a mic input jack.
I wanted to do some vloging with this camera, but buying a specific microphone was a little much and is just another piece of equipment to worry about.
I own a 5D Mark III and that is my go to for events.
However I wanted a camera for hiking that I wouldn't worry as much if it was damaged.
I love the size of this camera and the fact it can do anything a dslr camera can.
I did sacrifice on the full frame so I have that crop factor.
However the quality of the images is very close and I can take waterfall pictures with no issues.
Plus I carry a lot less weight around when hiking.
The compact carbon fiber Amazon basic tripod is a perfect companion for the avid nature photographer.
I am neither a photographer nor a wannabe but I know how to shoot and what to shoot.

Review.author: CBrown
Review.title: Good camera for beginners: five stars

Text.text: I bought this as a newer camera for hobby photography.
Itâ€™s got some great features such as the WiFi built in, which is my favorite for sharing.
Such a great camera.
The wireless transfer between camera and phone could be much better though.
BEST CAMERA MADE.
LOVE IT, I WANT MORE
Best camera ever!
I love this camera.
Easy to use and takes excellent pictures (all types).
Pros and beginners will love this camera.
I was in Utah and was able to take night photos of the stars (from tripod).
I've shared one of the night photos, which was taken while pitch black at night.
Whale watching action photos from a boat in Maui Hawaii.
The shutter speed is second to none for this price point.
If you purchase one more camera make it this one.
I chose the bundle/kit, which came with the 50mm and 210mm.
You won't be disappointed.

Review.author: michael palacio
Review.title: Stop wasting time and just get it!

Text.text: I love this camera.
I'm new to photography and it takes a while to learn what it can do but once you're familiar with it.
You'll be unstoppable.

Review.author: Faisal Zeeshan
Review.title: This is an amazing camera, I am currently using a Vintage Minolta ...

Text.text: This is an amazing camera, I am currently using a Vintage Minolta Lens with an adapter, the quality is just out of this world.
Love the product, came in pretty quickly as well.
Picture quality is similar other cheaper pocket camera.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: My latest purchase was a D7200 which is a great camera but when you are traveling it can become ...

Text.text: Since 1978 I am Nikon fanatic.

My latest purchase was a D7200 which is a great camera but when you are traveling it can become a heavy burden having to carry the camera plus additional lenses and accessories, so I decided to give it a try with the Sony Alpha a6000.
I must say I am very pleased with the quality of the photographs,it is so light even with an additional 200mm zoom lens.
As far as I am concerned I absolutely love this small camera, which is the one I now take when I travel both as a tourist and for business.
It's by my side all the time.
Very handable, potable and powerful..

Review.author: Michael Tovatt
Review.title: seems pretty good. Only negative i can see right now ...

Text.text: ive only had it a few days, seems pretty good.
