I only have one complaint, it's not very user-friendly but other than that it's a great little powerhouse.

Review.author: johnj2803

The Canon t5i.

I also have the Canon 50mm f1.8 and the Canon 55-250mm STM as well as the Canon 430EX speedlight.

Let me say that I have been so comfortable with the canon system for the past 7 years.
I have had enough success in my photos for my family.
Here is my gallery: [...]
I love this little camera.
I don't suggest using in low light conditions unless using a flash/continuous light.
The lens are detachable, the auto focus is super fast.
It doesn't shoot in 4k but it does have 1080p @60fps which is great.
It does not have a 3.5mm external mic jack but Sony makes mics that work with the hot shoe.
The monitor flips out and the lens it comes with is power zoom.

Review.author: Spencer
Review.title: The camera takes fantastic quality of pictures

Text.text: The Sony A6000 is everything I could have wanted in a camera as an amateur photographer.

The camera takes fantastic quality of pictures, gives the user as much or little control as they want, and is a very sturdy and strong quality of camera that can hold up to the abuse of moving to get the right photos.
Here are some of my main points from my use with the camera the last 2 months.
Lightweight and lightning fast.
A bit of a learning curve with the menu settings.
The panorama setting is tricky getting the right speed.
The picture quality is exceptional.
It's easy to change out the lenses.
This camera is a great buy.
I would highly recommend checking out the video Chris Burkard did with this camera.....
Taken for what it is - which is not a full DSLR - this camera is incredibly impressive!
Lightweight, compact, and just about on par with any other crop sensor camera I've ever owned, this thing has become my go-to everyday carry camera.

Review.author: Michael

Text.text: Sensor is very dirty a month after use, using self cleaning swabs didnâ€™t help, they must come with a better system, the photos are ok but nothing more, I got a sigma 16mm f1.4 and while it produce sharper images compared with the kit lens itâ€™s still not great, my 15 years old 5mp Nikon produced the same quality images 15 years ago.
Great camera!
Very excited to take it on our next vacation.

Review.author: Erin Zischke
Review.title: This camera is so smart. I learn new things about it every time ...

I learn new things about it every time I use it.
It has never failed me!
I use it for mid ski shots.
The quick focus picks up the powder trails really well.
The RAW format makes post edit a breeze.
It's also small enough for the pocket!

Review.author: kevin

Text.text: I bought it on black Friday and let me tell you this i love this so much and to make this even better get a glide cam or a cheaper one for a more stable video
I cannot tell you enough how much I love my Sony a6000.
It is my most prized possession!
This last July I started a travel blog (http://becauseshecantravel.com) and needed to 'up my photography game'.
After lots of shopping around and reviews, this seemed like the obvious choice.
I got a screamin' deal over Black Friday that includes the telephoto lens and a camera bag.
I'm a fairly beginner photographer, but have taken classes sporadically and have gotten some great photos out of my iPhone camera.
However, the jump from iPhone camera to this camera...wow.
You will be so amazed!

The only flaw is you can transfer the movies you capture via WIFI or at least I haven't been able to.

Review.author: Amazon Customer

Presently the latest is version 2.0.
Mine came with version 1.2 or 1.25.
I did mess around with it with the old firmware.
The shutter speed and auto focusing weren't as good as with the newer firmware.
I'm using this with a Tamron 18-200mm (B011).

small and pretty good

The kit lenses are not the best but will get you started and are much better that some other kit lenses I have had over the years.

Text.text: I bought this camera specifically for documenting a very long motorcycle ride.
So far, images are crystal sharp!
The camera feels good in my large hands, and the kit lens (1650) is more than adequate.
Love the images.
The settings on these guys are funny.
Once I got them figured out, I was very happy.
Seller was great.
As advertised.
This is a great camera.
Coming over from Nikon world, Iâ€™ve adjusted to the menus on this one and find them intuitive now.
Have been using some for product photos with some post in Gimp.
I bought this camera used locally, and it has been a great buy.
I bought this as a gift after reading good reviews and I think it has lived up to my expectations.
While not the best camera available it is about the best in its price range.
I am a professional sports photographer and have the Sony a6000 as my secondary camera (in sports you typically take two cameras with you).
I would not be afraid to put my photos up against people with cameras costing $5,000 due to the quality of the a6000.
Sony really hit the ball out of the park with this one in terms of quality of parts, quality of photos, and the small size.
Iâ€™m very disappointed with my purchased.
The camera itâ€™s very nice but Iâ€™m upset because Amazon gave me a camera that was an open box.
It looks like somebody bought it and returned and Amazon gave me that camera.
The box was open and the camera and the rest of the stuff that it comes with it was very dusty.
Lastly, the memory card itâ€™s missing.
Iâ€™ll definitely going to send it back.. i wanted to be impressed for the quality of the camera but i was disappointed for the type of camera they send me :(
OK, I'm an idiot and forgot to put the memory card in.
Went out and took some before and after pictures of some major garden work.
The camera just focuses and snaps away like normal with me thinking I was getting some great pictures that were never recorded.
It would be nice if there was a more than the microscopic 'no card' indicator that is impossible to see in daylight.
My Sony DX-100 screen would not show a picture if there wasn't a card.

Review.author: Ohmsick
Review.title: Very nice, fantastic photo quality, not for videos.

Text.text: I'm no camera expert, heck, I'm hardly a Novice, but this camera is fantastic.

This camera shocked me at how well it really does take photos out of the box.
i have included a picture of a flashlight, taken by me 3 mins after taking this guy out of the box on the Green 'auto' mode.
Just great!
For videos i wouldn't recommend it purely for the lack of microphone input alone, among other auto focus, and 1080p limited reasons.

Best camera for the money.
The wife loves it and has been asked by family to take pictures

I purchased an Alpha 6000 two months ago.

great 24 Mp allows low light low grain for wide range of Photoshopping.

( i have a 2.8 , & a Macro from sony ..'if I can see it , I can shoot it.
While this is a nice camera, the package I received right before the trip of a lifetime, did not include the listed battery charger or USB connector cable.
When you spend this much money for a camera you expect all the parts in the box.
I shoot portraits, landscapes, cities, and film videos.
I do it all with the a6000.
This is an amazing camera for beginners/intermediates or those looking for a compact camera.
The kit lens is dope if you provide good light, otherwise itâ€™s a little noisy in low light.
Once you upgrade the lens, wow.
The only real complaint I have is the batteries die quickly while recording video.
Other than that, I love this thing.
I love my camera great pictures and what i love the most i can export my picture to my phone instantly;)
I have wanted a camera since I was 19 years old.
Every year I told myself I would buy one - but every year unexpected bills or expenses would always put it on the back burner.
I got this camera a while back and have loved it ever since.

Review.author: Karen

Takes excellent pictures and the basic features are easy to use.
Love it, itâ€™s lite weight perfect for hiking!

Review.author: Blaze
Review.title: I am in love with this camera

Text.text: I am in love with this camera.
I do video work on the side and this device has been my bread and butter.
In combination with the Sony E 55-120mm lense I'm set.
The kit lense works absolutely fine in most videos I take and the auto focus is quick and accurate.
Honestly, why buy a huge DSLR when this camera takes pictures just as good and is something small enough you will actually carry with you.
Purchased this camera In Jan 2015.
Great camera, takes awesome pictures.
However, recently I'm getting a 'cannot recognize lens' error.
The lens click but won't extend.
After checking online it seems that this is not an uncommon error.
I spoke with Sony livehelp and they said that they are not aware of this issue.
Clearly, based on several message boards going back to 2013 with older models, including the Sony community board, this is an issue.
Google 'A6000 cannot recognize lens' and see for yourselves.
Sadly, unless Sony acknowledges and fixes this issue I cannot recommend this camera.

Review.author: Ortodontic

This is my first nice camera that I have bought and I couldnt be happier!!
Great camera for beginners!

Review.author: CN

Text.text: wow, it is my new world of photography, should have order this longtime ago!

It's all good
I enjoy this camera.
It seems to be cutting edge.
Takes a little effort to figure out the menu and all of the options, but it can be done.

Review.author: Stephen E Snyder
Review.title: ... the a6000 and the image quality appears to be excellent. However

Text.text: I've only taken about 300 shots with the a6000 and the image quality appears to be excellent.
However, the battery life sucks!
Even with the camera in airplane mode, the battery drain is unacceptable.
Don't be fooled into buying cheap replacement batteries.
They are even worse that the battery that comes with the camera.
I also found the electronic viewfinder annoying.
If I had to do it all over again, I would have bought something else.
Im a beginner and it has definitely served my needs
GREAT Camera.
The lenses have been an issue since I was clueless about what to order.
I love the pictures it takes.
I have even taken better photos than professional photographers at the last 2 events I attended.
It is fairly easy to use BUT there is a lot to this camera and so much it can do.

Review.author: JAS
Review.title: Great camera for the time being

Text.text: Great camera for the time being.
Although, I did buy it used so I had some complications with it.
Overall though this is probably my most favorite camera other than the Canon 6D.
I've been a professional advertising photographer for 35 years and have owned every type of camera.
This is my favorite all around camera.
Very light weight and very responsive.
The image quality is excellent.
The price makes it one of the best deals in photography.
I bought one for me and one for my wife.
I love this camera and look forward to many, many photos being taken with it!

Review.author: James A. White
Review.title: A camera you will carry that will make you better!

Text.text: Had this camera since January 2016 (8 months now), really have been impressed by what I can do with it creatively, and happy to have shed some weight from the DSLR world.
My photography has improved markedly, simply because I carry this camera much more often that I would a DSLR, giving me a lot more opportunities to capture the unexpected.

I fell into a Best Buy open box steal on this, having gone in to purchase a Nikon but the deal was too good to pass up - the camera came with the 16-50 and the 55-210 lenses, I love them both for my wide angle and wildlife work.

Additionally, I have purchased a nikon adapter and am using the a vintage 50mm 1.8 with very good results, and another vintage Nikon 300mm prime which I don't use as much due to the weight of that lens.
I also have experimented a lot with macro using the Marumi Achromat 49mm on the 55-210 with super results.
Camera has been very durable as well, I hike with it often and have dropped it a couple of times from 2-3 feet height on solid-rocky ground with minimal protection (fanny pack buckle flubs!

), and the camera/lenses suffered no damage - the wireless download via wifi to the playmemories app works flawlessly connected to my ipad - overall very happy, I am not missing the DLSR world at all -

Review.author: tSvi
Review.title: Awesome camera. Even in the smart modes you can ...

Text.text: Awesome camera.
Even in the smart modes you can hand someone this camera and get perfect shots.
Or you can take it fully manual and get very creative.
The compactness is amazing because you can take it everywhere.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera.
Not a professional by any means, just an amateur and love to shoot as a hobby.
I do recommend getting a better lens than the one that comes with it though.
Love that it has wifi capabilities.

I've had a Canon G1X for the past 4 years and for the last year or so I've I hesitated to buy the improved G1X Mk 2 for several reasons: (i) the $700 price was $250 more than what I paid for the original (ii) the image quality was the same (iii) it was still only 13 megapixels (iv) it was still a limited point-and-shoot.
The Sony a6000 was cheaper, had superior image quality, superior performance and produces 24 megapixel images.
On top of that, it is lighter than the bulky G1X.
I bought it with a Sigma 30mm F2.8 EX DN Art lens which gives excellent images.
At first I thought the lack of zoom would be an issue, but I've adjusted by using my feet and by thinking harder about how I want to compose the shot.
And at 24 megapixels, there is plenty of room to crop should the need arise.

Review.author: JD Law
Review.title: Excellent camera for the amateur photographer!

Text.text: I love this camera!!
Its absolutely one of the best purchases I have ever made.
I am a beginner to the camera world and this was my first step up from a point and shoot.
The camera allows you to break into the DSLR world very easily.
I use the digital viewfinder to learn how ISO, Aperture, and Shutter speed works.
I am able to easily change my settings while taking pictures and unlike a DSLR, I do not have to guess!
The viewfinder shows me exactly what the different changes do to my picture in real time.
Take a look at the pictures I took on July 4th.
I paired the camera with a good tripod and was able to take some wonderful pictures of the fireworks.
I think they look amazing for an amateur and I am very happy with this camera.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Camera broke, stopped recognizing lens three weeks in.

Text.text: I bought this camera specifically for a trip to South America.
Within three weeks it broke, the camera stopped recognizing the lens was attached.
Now I am without a camera for the remainder of my trip.
Really disappointed with this camera.
Photo quality was not what I expected, esp.
in low light.

Review.author: silentseeker
Review.title: it's the best that Sony has

Text.text: I can't believe that I spent my hard earned $$ on this camera and there is no manual.
What a POS!
Sadly, it's the best that Sony has, and only on their European site.
The USA site doesn't even have this 'web page printed to PDF' thing.
I don't mind the lack of a printed manual, but a professionally formatted PDF explaining all the settings is expected from this kind of product.
The official manual simply lists all the menu items without any explanation, which is a total waste of everyone's time.
There is really no ISO Auto setting!
Or am I blind?
Iâ€™m not 100% sure I received a brand new Sony a6000.
Looked on YouTube for unboxing a Sony a6000 and the camera had; Sony seal sticker on the box, sticker on the camera, a tag hanging from the neck strap holder and a battery half charged.
Another thing that makes me think itâ€™s not new is the scratches on the flash plastic housing also a scratch on the microphone accessory plug plus the battery was completely dead.
The camera is great!!!
Iâ€™m so happy with it!
Thank you for the quick service and shipping!
Very nice camera.
Maybe best buy mirrorless camera on the market.

Review.author: Luis Perez
Review.title: Amazing photos and new user friendly

Text.text: I relied to much on photos taken on my phone until I tried printing the images and would be very disappointed with the quality.
This camera captures amazing photos and itâ€™s very new user friendly.
It ranges from automatic to manual modes to meet your shooting style.
So far Iâ€™m very happy and excited with this purchase.
Still learning many things as I go.
The images attached havenâ€™t been edited.
This is my first non point and shoot camera.
I've had this camera for about 6 months now.
I've been mostly using all the auto features.
Auto intelligent setting mostly.
Just recently, I bought a book called understanding exposure and I can't believe how much I was missing out on by just using the auto settings.
This camera still takes great pictures in auto mode, but I want to know why it's taking great pictures and what settings do what.

Review.author: Larry Martin
Review.title: My son loves this camera, he didn't think I ...

Text.text: My son loves this camera, he didn't think I remembered it when he told me about it months ago.

Review.author: Maurice Alumbaugh
Review.title: this is the most easy to use camera I have ever had

Text.text: After watching a few videos on youtube, this is the most easy to use camera I have ever had.
The most liked feature is the live viewing mode.
What you see in the viewfinder, is what you will get as the picture.
Adjusting for different light exposures is so easy!
Nice little camera for my daughter as Christmas present.
Coming from Canon 70D, I wasn't expecting much from this, but was pleasantly surprised.
Picture quality is good even with the kit lens.
The wireless transfer of pictures to phones is nice, although far from perfect.
Excellent product and delivery on the date with nothing to question.
I love this camera.
As a beginner user that has not really done photography before, I think this camera is perfect - the kit lens is good enough and there is enough configuration to be good.
The app could definitely be improved, but overall great camera!

Review.author: Nicholas
Review.title: Starting out with photography, don't look any further.

Text.text: I have owned this camera for about a year now and have started out my photography hobby using this camera exclusively.
The camera has all the manual controls you need to take ownership of your pictures.
There are some usability features that match with full frame camera including programmable timer for your selfies and other purposes and bracketed shooting, which allows for exposure blending.
The kit lens is competent - if you set your picture up correctly, it will deliver.
I also have several lens: sony 35 mm prime and a wide angle lens (camera shops do rent higher dollars lenses for the A600, as well), they all perform great with the A6000.
Battery life is fine, assuming you aren't using this professionally- if so, I would suggest you buy some extra batteries.
For a 500 dollar camera the dynamic range is pretty good - I have taken some after sunset pictures that I didn't think were going to expose well at all, and the camera performed great.
Bottom line: if you are thinking about getting into photography, this camera will give you the tools you need to get started at a GREAT price.
If you are experienced photographer who wants a companion camera that's easy to travel with, take a look at this one.
This tiny monster doesn't disappoint.
(note: i have beaten this camera up with travel, an it still works great.
So It may be worth it took look at even cheaper used model from a reputable dealer, if you can get good price).

Review.author: John Brockell
Review.title: Great time for photography. So long 35mm.

Text.text: I use the Sony A6000 with the Sony Selp18105G E PZ 18-105mm F4 G OSS.
The ability to instantly upload to the iphone and view them is one of my favorite features.
I shoot with manual mode, in fine jpeg and do some simple photo editing in the iphone app.
You can send them off to the photo lab of your choice.
The average picture file size is 1616 x 1080.
So you can get a excellent 5â€ x 7â€ or a fairly good 8â€ x 10â€.
I order the 8â€ x 12â€ prints, and I still believe they have exceptable IQ.

Review.author: Axxman
Review.title: great camera, I dont care that it is not ...

Text.text: great camera, I dont care that it is not the latest and greatest, it works great, it goes full manual if I want control, and full auto if I am not in to mood to be a pro photographer.
this replaced my DSLR which I did like, but I never took it with me because it was too big.

Review.author: amansbsanchez
Review.title: this camera is so much more than expected. the ...

Text.text: this camera is so much more than expected.
the wifi feature is so really to use.
plus you can set it up so it saves directly with your phone

Review.author: David Velick
Review.title: I bought this camera just over a year ago & I have yet to be disappointed with the a6000

Text.text: Fancy cameras donâ€™t matter.

Review.author: Sonal Shah
Review.title: A very good beginner Sony mirrorless camera for the price of under ...

Text.text: A very good beginner Sony mirrorless camera for the price of under $500.
It is very light weight and great to walk around with it.
if you put long lens on it, then it may feel like unbalanced.
Picture quality is good in reasonable low light.
Again, this is more for beginners.
My first mirrorless camera and I love it.
Great company, shipped my package faster than excpected.

Review.author: Erica
Review.title: Camera is great. I didn't realize it wouldn't come with basic ...

Text.text: Camera is great.
I didn't realize it wouldn't come with basic things like a way to charge it or an SD card so I could use it.
So that sucked and was lame.
What a great camera.
Took it to Europe for a trip.
It never let us down, used Sony memory cards too.

Review.author: AlinaD
Review.title: Can't send photos to phone, region not supported

Text.text: I just got this camera and I've given a low review mainly for the PlayMemories app, which is not available in my region (Trinidad and Tobago) [...].
There is no alternative app for sneding photos from the camera to my phone, which makes it USELESS for transferring photos on the go which I need to do for my job.
Just warning others about this.
I bought it used, and being the previous model, I can tell you, that for an amateur like me it's more than enough camera to last a couple of years more.

Review.author: Al
Review.title: Bought it for my wife as a gift and she ...

Text.text: Bought it for my wife as a gift and she absolutely loves this camera.
Coming from an older NEC3 Sony, this is a huge step up and has all the functionality of a typical SLR she was looking for.
I have got this Camera for my wife and I so we can take pictures on our trips.
I recently bought a couple of lenses.
The fps are very fast and the quality of the photos is amazing.

Review.author: Charles
Review.title: but liked the idea of it being smaller than a SLR

Text.text: I wanted a real camera again instead of using my phone or a point and shoot.
I was hesitant about getting a mirrorless, but liked the idea of it being smaller than a SLR.
My friend who is a professional photographer recommended this and I'm happy he did.
It's compact and takes amazing photos.

Review.author: Matthew G.
Review.title: Great camera, couldn't care for the kit lens tho.

Text.text: Great camera, although i believe mine was defective.
Will definitely be buying another one in the coming months!
Took great shots when it did work, the AF is really fast and accurate.
I do not like the kits lens to much and when i buy this product again i will just buy the body.
Another thing i didnt really like is the file is ARW type which my first time encountering this file and nothing i had supported it.
Quick fix tho just google ARW drivers and you'll be set for viewing photos and being able to edit them with Photoshop.
Hope this review helped some of you guys.

Review.author: Justus
Review.title: I love the compact power this camera gives me

Text.text: I love the compact power this camera gives me.
So much so that I sold my old camera and all my lenses to transition to the Sony mirrorless system.
it is really good...I am just a beginner....

Review.author: Cee
Review.title: but my gosh you gotta love Sony mirrorless camera

Text.text: I am a Canon user, but my gosh you gotta love Sony mirrorless camera!
I love using this especially for street photography and small gathering.
You get to take photos without intimidating people.
GREAT STUFF SONY!
Got the camera a week before we left to Philippines.
Love the camera but after using it for just a week it was giving me lens problems.
it would say to check the lens mount.
this is the lens kit it came with and it is not recognizing it.
by the time we came back to US it was already passed the return date.
Now i have to call Sony but i saw reviews saying they will charge for any parts or repairs.

Review.author: Alexis
Review.title: sturdy. great automatic and manual features

Text.text: fast, responsive, sturdy.
great automatic and manual features.
easy to figure out the various buttons and menus.
built in guide/tutorials are a nice touch.

Review.author: Louis Lowther
Review.title: I absolutely love my Alpha a6000

Text.text: I absolutely love my Alpha a6000.
I was very hesitant at first since everyone I know owns a Cannon or Nikon DLSR camera and this would be the first mirrorless camera in my group of photographers.
Lets just say i am glad I went with my gut and not sticking to the 'norm'.

The pictures it takes are amazing, changing the setting are simple and easy to do and the compact size and lightweight makes it much simpler to move around and take complicated shots where I need one hand free.
The only wish list item for this is if it were to be touch screen.
Other then that this is hands down a fantastic camera.
I LOVE my Sony Alpha a6000.
It's a very professional camera, light weight and compact, and takes beautiful photos.
I'd definitely recommend this camera!
Every thing it lives up to
This is not a technical review but more of a user experience on this camera.
I have compared this camera with my review of the Panasonic G85, another excellent mirrorless camera.
I bought this camera new in 2015 when it first came out.
I was still new to photography and I really did not appreciate the quality of this camera until now that my photography skills has improved.
I did move to a full frame DSLR thereafter and sold my a6000.
Big mistake!
As a frequent traveler it was very cumbersome to carry a DSLR.
The quality of my Nikon D610 is excellent but it is a hassle to take with me overseas.
I had a few quirks about the a6000.

To name those that bothered me most - short battery life (typical to all mirrorless), long startup time (when used with aftermarket batteries, I have missed a lot of shots because of it, -1 star for this), and of course the short buffer.
But then again, the positives of this camera outweight the negatives.
Even the confusing menu system takes a while to get used to, but it the end it is the quality of your photos that really matter, plus, it is easy to carry around all day.
If you are a traveler like me, mirrorless systems is the way to go.
I am no pro but just someone like you interested in photography.
I was astounded when I learned using Lightroom and processed my photos on my recent 2015 trip to Italy.
Glad I shot it all in RAW.
I own a Sony A7R II now and would like get a used a6000 as a backup to use with my other FE lenses.
I also own a Panasonic G85 and GX8 which I also love using but won't be selingl it.
Mirrorless is the way to go folks, it is the future.
The a6000 is still IMO, one of the best performing and affordable camera to date.
All photos taken with the baldly reviewed Sony Zeiss 16-70 f4 (I beg to differ) and Sony 35mm f1.8.
Great camera.
Easy to use and not as bulky as a DSLR.

Review.author: TC
Review.title: This is the first digital camera I've been happy with. Images are tier 1

Text.text: This is the first digital camera I've been happy with.
Images are tier 1, the function is typical Japanese with many levels of menus.
Once you take the time to find the features you need, operation is very simple.
Common functions like modes, aperture and exposure, etc make good use dials like the film cameras of the past.
So light and compact i take it every where.

Review.author: KJH
Review.title: Lens will stop working at some point!!!!

Text.text: I bought this camera from Best Buy... not Amazon...but I wanted to WARN ALL POTENTIAL buyers!!!!!
The lens on this camera does NOT work well!
It might for a few months...even a few years if you are really lucky - but I promise you at some point the lens will stop working and you will NOT be able to take any pictures.
There is a default problem in the lens that Sony is aware of, and yet they continue to sell this camera with it.
So again... do NOT buy this camera!!!!
It will be a very expensive mistake.
I am in love with this camera.
I have bought antique/vintage lenses and with all of the adaptors available, am having a blast shooting in manual focus mode and loving it.
The camera is so light and easy to carry around.

Review.author: Gabriel
Review.title: it did a great job. The pictures are sharp and the Sony ...

Text.text: I took this camera on a trip to Canada , it did a great job .
Fast shipping, exactly what I ordered.
Photos were all taken by me.
I transfered from Facebook.
Not sure if that effects quality.
came as planned in great condition.
The camera is fine for now , but when I received the package, I found the box of the camera is not sealed and there's a fingerprint on the screen, it really makes me uncomfortable...

Review.author: MacMentor
Review.title: These digicams keep getting better and better!

Text.text: These digicams just keep getting better and better!
Here can bee seen the first of eighty four photos made by me on Halloween, 2015 in Salem, MA.
The rest can be seen by clicking the right arrow in the image.
I believe that they show what great camera the a6000 really is.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Works great! Is refurbished and has some small issues 'unrecognized ...

Text.text: Works great!
Is refurbished and has some small issues 'unrecognized lens'; takes great pictures though!
Nothing that needs repair at this time.
gave to granddaughter as a gift and she loves it.
does everything she needed it for and more.
Great camera.
I've been using it for a year now.
Fast focus, good tracking, great dynamic range.
E-mount lens selection is limited but its not the camera's fault.
Pair with the 35mm or 50mm primes, or the Sigma trinity for the best results.
Only things I miss?
A touchscreen would be nice and a microphone port would be nice as well.
Other than that, I love this camera.
It replaced 2 DSLRs and I don't miss them at all.
If you are shooting primarily wildlife or distance sports and you need very long zooms, this is not the family of cameras you should get.

Review.author: hempomatic
Review.title: Spectacular pictures from a novice. A great camera.

Text.text: I'm not one of those people that gives a 5 star review very often.
I'm not sure if I ever have.
5 stars implies perfection (to me anyway) and nothing is perfect.
That said, this is a GREAT camera.
It replaced my NEX5N that was stolen while on vacation (yes, all the vacation pictures were still in the camera).

I was actually debating about just getting a phone with a really good camera, but since only the lens that was on the camera (Tamron 18-200) was with it when it was stolen and I still had 2 lenses and a spare battery and wall charger, AND some of the phones I was looking at were MORE than the camera body, I decided to simply replace the camera body.
This is by far the best camera I've ever owned.
So easy to use, lightweight, and compact!
The picture quality is fantastic!

Review.author: Greg R
Review.title: A not-so-cheap imitation of better cameras

Text.text: Having used this alongside a Nikon D5500, I see what they were trying to do, what they were trying to emulate, but they fall short in build quality and features, and it costs just as much.
I love this little camera.
A great form-factor that is wonderful for taking on a day hike and excellent image quality.
The lens detaches with solid action and the interface for the various knobs is very customizable by the user.
Get a quality strap like BlackRapid though because the included strap is not very comfortable.
Can't add anything that hasn't been stated.
This camera and it's series are fantastic-rugged, capable and reliable!
I liked using my a6000 but If I could there would be negative stars here.
This is an expensive camera so I've taken very good care of it.
But occasionally the LCD screen freaks out and turns itself on and off repeatedly.
Then it tells me the (kit) lens isn't recognized and the only way to fix this is to remove the lens and remount it.
Sometimes I have to do this 2 or 3 times before everything works.
Other users have also experienced this issue right out of the box.
Of course, this started to happen after the return window closed.
Amazon flags this camera as a best seller, it's one of the things that drew me in.
But in addition, this is in expensive piece of unreliable kit.

Review.author: Quency
Review.title: UNSEALED BOX - Exhausted Battery (NOT BRAND NEW)

Text.text: Mine came in with the box unsealed and the battery exhausted.
Exhausted battery means that someone has already tried to used them, and the box being unsealed just give away that the camera that I received is second-hand.
Love it!

Review.author: Travis Meisenheimer
Review.title: Over the moon with this little photography monster.

Text.text: Bought this camera about a year ago as a gateway into photography.

I was hesitant at first because I know how expensive good cameras can be and this one was at the lower end of the price spectrum, but, after seeing what it can do, I'm so extremely happy with this purchase.
At 24 megapixels this thing is a beast.

I don't use auto-focus lenses for this because vintage manual focus lenses are much more affordable, and quite frankly its a bit more fun that just pushing down the shutter button and letting the camera do all the work.
Vintage lenses are a breeze to adapt to this guy.
Literally just a metal collar that changes from one mount to another.
There are adapters for more modern lenses but their generally a lot more expensive and you don't get the same auto-focus speed as a native e-mount lens.
Don't be afraid of the manual settings mode.
It will certainly broaden your horizons as far as what more you can do in photography.
Love this camera!
Size and image quality is perfect for me to take on the go when I'm exploring.
Very durable as well!
excellent camera for this money
Best entry level camera out there.
Perfectly sized with incredible image quality
takes amazing high quality photos and videos!
The Sony A6000 is hands down one of the best cameras I've had my hands on.
The camera with the stock lens takes very good, and sharp photos, but the 55-210mm lens for this camera is a MUST.
It improves the overall versatility of the camera with the ability to do portraits with a great shallow depth of field.
I bought this camera after much research in the 500-1000 price range and settled on this.
I've used Canons and Nikons before, nothing compares with speed, auto focus, ease of use, and most of all the weight.
The camera barely weighs a thing with the stock lens on it.
The 55-210mm does add some weight but its not unbearable.
Still lighter than most Canon Rebels with the stock lens on.
Love the camera except the video record button location and that it is indented.
Also the lcd is hard to see in the summer.
Great in general.
Sometimes reports a problem with lens recognition when turning off-on quickly (with original set lens), corrects after off-on again.
Battery cover opens accidentally easy.
Problem with web interface software out of USA.

Review.author: Jonathan W. Cohen
Review.title: Far better than any phone if you're serious about photography

Text.text: Very capable, lightweight camera.
Far better than any phone if you're serious about photography.

Review.author: Sarah Loy Gifford
Review.title: Great size and photo quality but you'll have to download ...

Text.text: Great size and photo quality but you'll have to download them onto your computer to really see them as the viewfinder quality isn't very good- looks very pixelated.
This is especially problematic because there is only an electric viewfinder.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Makes me feel like a professional

Text.text: Bought this camera to try and start taking some astrophotography shots.
Blown away by this little thing.
Pictures are quality and crisp.
Only downside is the battery life, but you can buy spares for $20.

Review.author: Josue
Review.title: Awsome Camera for Hobbiest or Biginner

Text.text: Grate camera for a Beginner or just a Hobbies

Review.author: John Demo
Review.title: Seriously..it REALLY is a joy to pick up everytime.

Text.text: I bought this at a special time when the price was $400 for the body alone.
Which made buying with both kit lenses really cheap.

Review.author: Adrian I.
Review.title: ... a professional photographer but this camera takes some very good pictures, don`t let the size fool you

Text.text: I`m not a professional photographer but this camera takes some very good pictures, don`t let the size fool you.

I recently took this camera on a trip to Italy and took it everywhere I went without being bothered by the weight of the camera and got some awesome pictures on the trip, I would highly recommend getting this camera.
You can also use old manual lenses from Minolta, Olympus, Nikon e.t.c.
with the fairly inexpensive adapters available so you can have some excellent quality manual lenses for a fraction of the price.
I love it and would recommend it to family and friends.
This camera is with no doubt one the greatest bang for your buck you can get!
The sensor on it is unbelievable.
Look up some star time laps videos of this camera on youtube.
The photo I attached is one that was taken at 1am.

Review.author: Patrick N
Review.title: and I cannot say enough good things about the Sony A6000

Text.text: Coming from a casual / amateur photographer, this will not be a technical review.
I have had the camera for a little over a month, and have only used the stock lens (16-50mm power zoom).
This camera takes fantastic pictures, and for someone looking for a good starting point for mirrorless cameras this is probably the perfect camera.
It's got loads of features but does a great job on the automatic setting as well.
This is a no brainer compared to a point and shoot with a permanent lens.
Fast, small, and easy!!
No more DSLR's for me, after the Canon EOS-M I was not happy with mirrorless, but the A6000 is a long way from the Canon.
Focus speed is much, much, much better, my only wich for the A6000 would be a touch screen for focus point.
i love the size of the camera.
i think its pretty darn confusing to learn....!
i have been a canon user, so the switch may be problem.
but it does take lovely pictures.
i feel like i'll never truly understand everything it offers...and i'm pretty well versed in iso, aperature, s s, etc.
I have spent hours scouring tutorials.
i guess i am not the point and shoot/automatic type!
otherwise, I guess its would be fairly easy to use.
I am a beginner and I love this camera so far!

Review.author: FaeRook
Review.title: The only thing I don't love is how it performs in low light situations

Text.text: I am a photographer by trade but I decided I needed a travel camera.
This thing fits the bill.
The only thing I don't love is how it performs in low light situations.
It seems to have trouble focusing.

Review.author: David A. Willis
Review.title: Takes Great Pictures at a Reasonable Price

Text.text: I really like this camera.
It is a replacement for my Digital Rebel which has gotten pretty long in the tooth.
I use it for both personal and business use and was initially attracted by the physical package, which is much smaller than it's predecessor.
It was also recommended by a professional photographer who uses it for much of his day to day work.
It was relatively easy to learn the important functions, although I would have appreciated a better printed manual than comes with the camera.
Online resources are good, but I find it difficult to find answers there when I have a specific question.
In actual use, I think I have been most impressed by how fast the autofocus works.
It is extremely quick.
I take quite a few aerial pictures and often don't get much composition time.
My only question is how durable it will be.
I carry the camera around in my coat pocket, it lays on the seat of my pickup etc.
So far I have had no issues and the quality of the pictures it takes is first rate.

Review.author: Teach
Review.title: So for this camera had taken beautiful pictures. I like the fact that I can ...

Text.text: So for this camera had taken beautiful pictures.
I like the fact that I can get better photos in low light.

Review.author: Desert View Photography
Review.title: Sony A6000 is a light gathering gem.

Text.text: I did my first shoot with the A6000 the night before last after only a few hours of familiarization.
I arrived at the shoot with the camera, kit lens and a slave flash not knowing what the lighting would be.
To make a long story short, I never used the slave, a couple of pictures were with the built-in flash but amazing to me, most of the pictures were taken in available light.
The latter pictures were by far the best!
The camera setting was 'intelligent' and the ISO max setting was 3200.
This camera is a light gathering gem!
The ISO settings of the images were between 1500 and 3200 with little or no loss of clarity.
Another outstanding attribute is that the camera automatically corrected the white balance almost perfectly, yielding pleasant skin tone and vivid colors.
Regardless of price I can't imagine a better camera than the A6000.
It automatically overcomes problems I have had with indoor people shots and I expect outdoor scenic photos will be easier as well.

Review.author: GForce
Review.title: Great that this takes FE lens

Text.text: Great that this takes FE lens.
I will upgrade to an A7 series... but then again I am enjoying this camera and may just stick with it.

Review.author: Peach Hasgotit
Review.title: Honeymoon in Paradise with BROKEN CAMERA

Text.text: Terrible user interface.
Okay photos are not worth the trouble on this one.
It broke on our honeymoon in Thailand leaving us with nothing to take pictures of the beautiful scenery.
Yes, Amazon will replace it but where will I be when it decides to fail again?
I read tons of reviews of this camera all of which read the same way, one of the best cameras out there.
I stocked the camera on various sites waiting for a price and package that made me comfortable.
I finally found that price point so I took the plunge.
All of the reviews I read were spot on, quite simply one of the best cameras I have ever owned.

Review.author: For Real
Review.title: A.m.a.z.i.n.g. image quality, light weight and easy to grip, I love it!

Text.text: As we got older, DH and I were sick of carrying our old Nikon digital SLR since it was so heavy even with the basic kit lens.
I could barely hold the body!
Then we discovered the a6000 at costco and bought it.
Finally an advanced camera I can carry and use!
Only half the weight yet 4 times pixel count and super fast auto focus.
(Power on, tho, is a bit slow..) The printed manual sucks.
The online help guide is 470 pages of PDF and sucks even more.
But the camera itself is amazing!
I just use Intelligent Auto and the image quality indoors and outdoors is the best I have seen.
The camera has like a billion functions and settings; I'm gonna to stick with auto.
Can't even figure out what this Superior Auto aka Intelligent Auto Plus does!
But I've taken great portraits, street scenes and night scenes in the past few days.
The image clarity and color balance are A+!
Beats our Nikon and all other compacts!
1080p video is excellent too and the audio is loud!
(So don't whisper things you don't want your audience to hear!)

Review.author: Nghi Nguyen
Review.title: the design was great too. I only have problem with the On/Off ...

Text.text: Works very well as a normal as well as professional camera, the design was great too.
I only have problem with the On/Off button, it doesn't work very well somehow

Review.author: Travis Southerland
Review.title: I switched from Canon Full Frame!!!

Text.text: The versatility is amazing!!!
The compact size of this with the amazing low light capabilities make this a must have camera.
I love the ability to use cheap adapters to connect legacy lenses.
I was able to get a camera body and 6 lens(with adapters) for the cost of a Canon full frame body.
This is a no brainer.
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS CAMERA.

Review.author: Jerry Palmerino
Review.title: Awesome Photographic Power in a Small Package

Text.text: This is a stunning little camera.
It takes DSLR quality photos without the size and weight.
If you have outgrown your cell phone photos or other smaller camera, this is camera is worth every dollar.
Amazing camera.
Not much else to say.
I love it
Pretty much the camera I had hoped it would be at a great price.
I can't say enough about this camera.
For the dollars nothing comes close.
Light weight, high frame rate(double compared to mirrored) extremely fast focusing, built in stabilizing that's unreal, German lens with Japanese brains!.....
I could go on.
Bought it for video shooting, but I'm re-interested in general photography again.
Beautiful pictures is an understatement.
If your on a budget, get the alpha with the single lens.
I bought extra batteries and the dueling charging dock.
Use San Disk Ultra Extreme SD cards too.
Don't mess about.
This camera is worthy.
Bought this camera for my husband cause he wanted it so bad.
It takes great pictures.
Better to carry this around than my Canon D70.
But don't believe that it tells you its prime, cause i had to wait a week for this product, and yes it was in stock.

Review.author: Kindle Customer
Review.title: Exceptional quality and features in a lightweight, small package.

Text.text: A college graduation gift for our daughter who will be backpacking in Europe next fall.
She will be able to take exceptional photos and videos with a very small, light load.
There is so much to love about this camera; she was especially tickled about the wifi to send pics directly to her phone.
I doubt she will ever need another camera, nor will she ever run out of features to discover.
Wish it had been for me...I lug around a full Canon kit!
Works well
Bought this as my first 'real' camera.
Loving it so far.
I recommend looking up YouTube tutorials specific to this camera to get the most use out of it.
I am new to photography, and I love this camera.
I've taken it to a few countries as well as some *sort of* high adventure camping.
Small enough to carry around with the lens I have.
I'm addicted and have acquired a few more lenses and some gear for it.
I don't have any complaints, but don't know enough about photography to really give this any more of a detailed review for now.
I've forced myself to shoot manual and read about how cameras work and this is a really fun camera to work with.
I've come pretty far and enjoy the fact that I can be lazy in some situations and use the various auto settings.
Often those come out better than my compositions!
Gave some nice candid pictures to a few of my family members for Christmas.
They came out really well and I guess I can get really large prints too since the megapixels are high.
I have yet to do that, but so far this has been a wonderful hobby to get addicted to.
I was skeptical about the box, It could've been better.
The camera needed a little more protection.
The box bad no sealed tape and the screen wasn't protected.
I did run the shutter count and the camera had 16 shots prior to my picture.
Not a big deal but I wish it would've been zero or brand new, maybe it was tested?
The camera is new in quality and the accessories were new.
Very nice camera.
The picture quality is fantastic even with stock lens.
The auto focus is fast and accurate.
The main flaw for this camera is short battery life.
I went to an auto show took like 100 pictures and the fully charged battery was already drained to 35% left even when I have airplane mode on.
Also, another flaw is that you should not delete pictures right from the computer.
You should always delete the pictures from the camera which is quite inconvenient when you have a lot of pictures on the camera.
If you just delete the pictures from your computer, when you go view pictures on the camera, you will see the deleted pictures are still on the memory card and just blank black.
As the user's manual says, you shouldn't delete the pictures right from your PC, it could mess things up.
I have not used the a6300 or even the a6500, so i don't know if SONY has fixed this problem.

Review.author: Danilo
Review.title: Wow! Great pictures! Easy to use

Text.text: Product quality great!
Wonderful camera for starters.

Review.author: Ronaldo A.
Review.title: Having fun wich such portable camera...

Text.text: Most of my photographs are (or have been) long exposure, so soon I got used to carry a â€œfewâ€pounds of equipment with me, including my not so light full frame camera.
At first everything was a marvel, but more recently the weight began to be a nuisance, to such an extent that I realized I was reducing my photo trips or walks, due the equipment weight.

Review.author: Scott Redfern
Review.title: Know your digital camera sensor type! This one is superior

Text.text: I haven't had the opportunity to test out the one biggest reason I bought this camera (night shots), but I really like it so far!
It has far more options than I will ever use but I bought it for the high quality sensor it has which is an APS-C format and is far better quality than in most compact digital cameras!
Don't buy a camera without knowing what the sensor is and whether it will give you the quality you need for the type of phtography you plan to do!

Review.author: James A.
Review.title: I'm really happy with the camera - especially the small footprint

Text.text: The quality of the pictures taken with the standard kit lens is comparable to the first run of mirrorless Alpha cameras from Sony a35, a55).
I'm really happy with the camera - especially the small footprint.
ALSO, I am not going to lie and say the fact that it is cute is not a factor in my rating.
Excellent camera.
A little small for my hands, so put the battery grip on it and feels much better.
Went from a Nikon D4, so size does matter!
I like it
very fine camera, takes very good pictures and very fast,

Review.author: Zachary R. Davis
Review.title: Can't shoot time lapse with Sony a6000

Text.text: I leave a 1-star review solely because their app network is a mess.
If you want to do time lapse with this camera, it requires that you purchase an app for $9.99, which isn't the worst.
The problem is that you can't actually buy the app.
After going through the laborious process of trying to download the app, after confirming your payment, it brings you to an 'internal error' page.
This is the case when trying to download both on the camera and a computer.
This is a widely reported problem 'search sony a6000 time lapse internal error', yet Sony has done nothing about it.
Maybe this review will get in front of someone who has the power to fix the problem.
This little camera has surpassed my expectations and more.
It has entirely replaced my Nikon D7100 and lenses for travel, portraits, and lifestyle photography.
My husband jokes that itâ€™s my â€œtoy camera,â€ but he shuts up pretty fast once he sees the images.
Beautiful photo quality, intuitive controls, versatility, and all around an awesome camera.
Camera came used and dirty .
I absolutely love this camera!
It's automatic, but it has manual settings.
I did buy a different lens for it, to be able to manual focus, but this is a great camera for beginner photographers to learn.
Plus, it's compact!
I've been shooting Canon for 14 years professionally and decided to dive into the mirrorless camera scene for fun.
This camera was supposed to be my point and shoot amateur camera and I was so disappointed in the performance overall.
The screen is useless and is better off not moving at all, not to mention, it drains the battery insanely fast.
The battery % would go down by the min.
I had a full charge, played with the menu and settings and was down to 70% already.
I have never, during the past 40 years, had a camera fail on me, but sadly the a6000 has just died.
'Camera Error.
Turn Power off then on.'
Now I sit with five Sony lenses but no camera to use them on.
Oh boy.
I was looking for a small, lightweight, good quality travel camera; and if you're looking for the same-stop now!
This is it!
It didn't take me long to pick this one after looking at all the positive reviews, and this Sony Alpha A-6000 is fantastic.
The black/silver color looks vintage-y and stylish, and the photos it takes are stunning!
I even found that it takes night photos (of the milky way!!)
on the automatic setting when held super steady, but I'll have to learn more about the settings (and buy a tripod) to take more professional ones.
My only complaint would be that the wifi transfer seems to degrade photo quality a bit from camera to smartphone, but I think the cord transfer to computer works better.
All in all, 5 stars!
Buy it and snap away :)

Review.author: Ninjawarrior
Review.title: Great picture quality for its price and sleek durable design

Text.text: Great camera!
Takes awesome photos and has a seamless and slick design.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: Takes great pictures and easy to use

Text.text: Bought this for our son.
He loves it.
Takes great pictures and easy to use.

Review.author: Dave S.
Review.title: Get it already what are you waiting for

Text.text: absolutely love all the features this camera has the offer!
great camera, shipped and came super fast.
no damages
I'm an experienced professional photog and designer.
At first let me preface this by saying that camera worked GREAT, picture quality was high, the high speed AF was really impressive.
However, after literally an hour of use, it craps out.
Right after snapping a shot it freezes and shows this error 'camera error, turn camera off and on.'
I follow directions, speak to customer support, etc.
Sony customer support says that I have send the camera in for service (takes 7-10 business days upon arrival of the facility).
I'm sorry no one has time for that, and in my particular case this was going to be used specifically for an upcoming trip.

Text.text: Not satisfied with the quality of the photos.
Compared to my old Canon Power Shot, this camera has poor color capture and poor clarity.

Text.text: Nice camera , vendor shipped immediately, no complaints at all on price/delivery.
Great camera.
Got it while Sony was running a sale at the end of 2015.
The menu is not as terrible as some may argue, it simply takes a day or two of exploring and using to get used to.
The images are exceptional, the autofocus is great and the fps is unbeatable.
Great camera for action sports but it excels in many other areas as well.
My only complaint is that there are not many lenses for this camera, or rather not many affordable lenses.
Great for beginner, great for advanced, just a great camera to keep with you weather you have a career in photography or just want great photos of your kids playing sports.
Definitely the best camera for the price.

Review.author: Shouyan Gardiner

Review.title: The a6000 is an amazing camera for the price.

The internet is replete with favorable accounts and reviews for this APC-S mirrorless gem, so I won't waste time recapping all the pluses well documented on the internet,

Review.author: Nas
Review.title: Excellent camera. I think best crop sensor camera for ...

Text.text: Excellent camera.
I think best crop sensor camera for the price range.
But, If u have the cash the a7ii is much better in terms of egonomics and features.
That said the sony a6300 has included some of features that i would have really liked to see in the a6000.
I love this camera.
It's cheap, gets the job done, and has advanced features you can't get on bodies 3 or 4x as expensive.

Biggest complaints: it's too small and feels unbalanced with big lenses on it, I hate that the lens selection is so terrible (this will improve over time) - it's leagues above my canon t5i and was about the same price.
I think the a6000 is the cheapest professional camera on the market - would definitely go Sony over any other brand.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: THE MOST FUN YOU WILL HAVE WITH A CAMERA! Beyond impressive!

Text.text: First off!
THANK YOU Sony for releasing such an amazing product!

Okay so anyone looking to buy this camera let me tell you right now nothing compares to this camera even in a higher bracket EXCEPT for the newly so to be released A7000 (not a replacement for this camera just a higher bracket camera with 4K video) the pictures I have taken with this camera even starting off as an amateur resorting to Youtube have been beyond impressive, I now have a canvas collection that I started for the house and everyone is always blow away that I have taken these photos, I am always being offered money for my canvas prints.
The date is 3/3/16 and this is still by far the best bang for the buck you can buy SPEND THE MONEY!
You will love this camera and how fun it is to tinker with, the community and support for this product is HUGE!
I have owned this camera for over a year and have much more expensive cameras and I consistently choose this camera in almost every situation then my higher end ones.
PS no longer a Canon fan boy.

Review.author: Ed
Review.title: Arrived in great condition! So far really loving the camera and ...

Text.text: Arrived in great condition!
So far really loving the camera and the innovation built into it.
I have a first gen nex 3 and also the nex-f3.
This is a a great step forward.

Review.author: Alex Mladenovic
Review.title: Would be perfect if not for a big problem.

Text.text: I have two a6000's.
I loved those cameras, and now I am afraid of using them.
The first one is 2.5 years and the second one is 1.5 years old.
After little bit more than one year the first camera start freezing itself.
I could take the pictures on current setting but could not change anything or see the taken images.
All keys were unresponsive except the trigger and the on/off.
After removing the battery and waiting for some random time the camera would work again and then freeze again, sometimes 10 minutes later, sometimes a month or two later.
The newer camera started behaving the same after using it for one year.
Resetting and initializing the camera did not help.
Unfortunately I also purchased a7M3.
Luckily I kept my Nikon which has been working reliably in the last six years.
I love Sony cameras when they work.
This camera made me fall in love with shooting mirrorless!
the kit lens was less than impressive and broke after month but I bought a few adapters in addition to a 30mm 1.4 and I am a happy camper.
Great Pictures.
Great extras.

Review.author: jojo
Review.title: Excellent camera for a great price!!

Text.text: This is my first mirrorless camera, and my first Sony!
I thought Iâ€™d give it a go since I heard such great reviews!!
It is phenomenal, I really enjoy this camera!
It is easy to use and the picture quality is excellent.
If your looking for a really good camera for a good price, this is it!
The only downside that it has is that it doesnâ€™t take an external mic, which is fine by me, I donâ€™t do video.

Review.author: Rae
Review.title: SO IN LOVE WITH THIS CAMERA!

Text.text: I can't even tell you how happy I am that I made this purchase.
At first I was feeling a bit of buyers remorse, but once I started taking pictures and seeing how well they came out, I am so glad that I bought it.
I haven't taken photography since high school so I consider myself a beginner again.
I did a lot of research between this camera and several others, and with talking to friends who also use this camera, I thought, 'well, I will give it a try'.
I have seen a lot of reviews and tutorials online about this camera being great for beginners and I think that it really is.
Even for those who don't want to go photography and just want a family vacation camera or what have you, this is an amazing camera!

Review.author: njoiram

Text.text: Beginner to the hobby , very happy with the pictures .
Not happy on purchasing all these extra apps to do things the camera is capable of doing and should be included with purchase
Solid choice for mirrorless!
Honestly, my Google Pixel 2 XL takes better pictures.
I took out out of the box, took a few pictures and realized that it wasn't worth the $600 price tag.
It's not worth $200 in my humble opinion.
I think it takes great pictures, but no better than the latest top tier cell phone.
Even the depth of field was disappointing compared to my phone.
I thought there would be a significant improvement in quality and there just wasn't.
I couldn't justify this piece of equipment.
I do love Sony, though.
The camera is good...just not justifiable with the latest cell phone device in hand.
I use it for my fashion blog and its pretty much all I need.
Super user-friendly and image quality.
Great investment.

Review.author: D. Ogdin
Review.title: Cool camera, bizarrely missing important landscape feature

Text.text: I just received this camera today and am sending it right back after testing for 15 minutes.
It's a cool little dude with a solid feel, good access to features, customizable buttons, great size/form factor, etc.
Nice camera until it overheats.
I honestly don't know how Sony can get away with selling a camera without disclosing such a serious problem.
The menu system (especially App menu) is very clunky too.
almost 1 year to the date the camera won't recognize the lens when it is turned on.
Camera took great pictures when it worked but we didn't realize it would have issues so soon.

Review.author: Emilie Lombardo
Review.title: The Camera is great, but the menu set up is quite complicated ...

Text.text: The Camera is great, but the menu set up is quite complicated and takes a lot of getting used to.
I wish the features were clearer.
The sensor gets dirty quite often even though I don't change the lens.
Otherwise great camera

Review.author: Dwayne Collingwood
Review.title: This totally blows my previous Canon xTi out of the water in clarity with minimal effort on adjustments.

Text.text: I recently took this on a NYC trip and found the extremely fast and sharp focusing to be of excellent value!
This totally blows my previous Canon xTi out of the water in clarity with minimal effort on adjustments.
It was extremely satisfying to be able to point and shoot for the majority of photos and I found the hand-held night scene option very superb!
If you haven't tried it, you are missing out on a great feature.
Normally I steer away from auto-scene modes, but found myself falling in love with this particular mode after the first photo taken.
I would highly recommend this camera to anyone with a lower budget who's looking for a camera that will take sharp photos out-of-the box.
There is no need to purchase another lens, but I plan to for some specific photo ideas later on.
Sony has impressed me once again!

Review.author: M. M
Review.title: Switches on in the bag=CONSTANTLY! 5X NOW.

Text.text: I love the photo quality.
Video.is TOP notch for the price, even in VERY dark conditions.
Stylish (mine is white), small, lightweight.
Offering colors makes it look 'more friendly' for street photos of strangers.
It doesn't look as advanced as it is; looks like a consumer 'point n shoot,' especially without a big lens on it.
LOVE IT!
Highly recommend the silver one, it looks very retro and it not even silver itâ€™s almost like a champagne color, the kit lense is SILVER though!

I initially had trouble deciding on which color to get, the white or silver but I went with the silver because Iâ€™ll be traveling a lot and from what I heard the white gets dirty easily if your not careful.
Theyâ€™re both really nice colors, the black is a bit simple for me, all my past cameras were black and Iâ€™m just kind of over it and looking for something different.
If thatâ€™s you, defintely check out the other colors.
But on my part I recommend the silver, truly beautiful.
And also the camera is great LOVE the viewfinder and love itâ€™s compact size, very easy to take anywhere.
Pictures + Video below!
:) Hope this was helpful!
We've had this for about a year and a half so far.
It's a good camera for beginner photographers as it's easy to learn to use.
The pictures generally don't need editing and are clear and bright.
It's quite a change from the digital we had before that was much cheaper, or our phone cameras.
I wish the battery lasted a little longer and it did better in dark lighting.
I love this camera more than I should.
Yeah there are newer models with a few more features.
Not enough to bridge the price gap for me though.
And at the same sensor resolution?!
This camera is nothing short of awesome for the price, and the two lens bundle is a great starter kit.
Not world class lenses, but again at the price point a killer deal.

Review.author: David A. Stank
Review.title: Body Only does not include Body Cap. Come on, Sony!

Text.text: Just received this camera body today, delivered to my office.
Because I have the NEX-5 and its lenses, I ordered the a6000 body only knowing I was getting a great camera.
I'm disappointed the camera came without a charger (seems the charging must happen through-the-camera) but a bigger disappointment is receiving the camera body without a body cap on it.
The body arrives tucked into something like a Tyvek bag.
I had hoped to charge the battery while at work but I won't leave the body out without a lens or body cap on it.

Review.author: Shoppers

Text.text: Love this camera and it takes awesome fast moving sports pics.
I have big hands and the form factors is not designed for me.
My wife loves it.
I bought the leather bottom cover that helps a little.
I am not sure why Sony decided to use motorized zoom on the 16-50mm kit lens.
I can still accidentally rotate the motorized zoom ring and worry about breaking it one day.
It is awkward since the longer zoom lens kit has manual zoom.
Otherwise it is an awesome camera.
Camera is great!
DSLR's are dead.
Or at least they should be.
This camera packs huge punch for a mirrorless camera.
Read the other reviews, its all great.
love the interchangeable lenses options.
Love the moveable screen.
Its all great.
A small DSLR in my mind.
Allows to change the lens.
Small but top quality.
Highly recommend.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: this is a great camera. I can go anywhere and it's right ...

Text.text: For a journalism major, this is a great camera.
I can go anywhere and it's right with me.
The electronic viewfinder takes getting used to, but overall, I love it.
Pair it with old legacy lenses, sony, sigma or Rok and you will find it holds up well to even it's bigger brother.
Amateur sports photographers can also find this to be useful due to size and extremely fast autofocus.
First of all I was lucky to get this for $435 before the price went up again.
Still worth it at its current price.
First of all the reputation of this camera speaks for itself, so I'll focus on details other people may have not covered.
It's a beautiful camera with a great sturdy feel.
The images are excellent and the kit lens not bad!
The controls are all good and viewfinder does the trick, while not great it works.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: but I love taking a million photos everywhere I go and wanted ...

Text.text: I bought this after a recommendation from a friend and it was exactly what I needed!

I'm not a professional photographer, not by a long shot, but I love taking a million photos everywhere I go and wanted something that had really great/fast focus and a LIGHT body because I can't stand how heavy dSLRs can get after just a couple hours.
I bought a Sony Vario-Tessar 16-70mm F4 lens to go with it and the results have been awesome.
Here's a few shots I took.
The auto focus is so fast and my go-to setting on the SCN is the action/sports mode which lets me take incredible shots of my dog and other moving objects (like that bubble!)
I would recommend this to amateur/beginners as well as experts who want something lighter and less heavy duty.
My Beloved â™¥
Best camera that I've owned... and I've had quite a few.
This one is both easy to use and highly customizable for those who like to tinker.
The photo quality is excellent.
The lens system is both plentiful and easy to use.
Given the price at which these can typically be bought at, they are a steal.
This is the best camera I have owned, period.
It is easy to carry, set up, and shoot.
It takes great pictures especially with the Sony 1.8/35 mm prime.
Let me start out by saying that this is not a bad camera.
It's affordable, pocketable, and the image quality is *almost* good enough for *some* professional photographers.
Excellent camera and price matched the difference after I received this camera.
Go mirrorless or go home
worth the cost.
portable and powerful.
Most important thing is - it sits well in my son's stroller tray.
So no additional bag required.
Great camera!
Moved up from a canon rebel T5 and could not be more pleased with the Sony A6000.
Starting to wish I had sprung for the A6300 because of the mic jack but this is working wonderfully for vlogging, with the fast auto focus and face tracking.
I also use it for city photography and outdoor/hiking, all of these generally done at night.
Really a wide range of use.
Would recommend this to anyone looking to step up from a beginner dslr but still on a budget.
Note- Kit lens, Like most cameras is not great.
I have sense started using a canon 10-18mm lens as i prefer wide angle shots and videos
Super Nice Camera!

It's very easy to use in auto settings and I'm still learning how to customize the settings.
You don't realize what your missing until you try this camera!
I love it!
Ever since I got it i haven't touched my canon 6d in months.

It's so much fun playing with this cam with vintage glass, If you'd like to see more here's my Instagram @mindtrips

Well packed.

Review.author: Katharine McMurdo

have fun!

Super pleased

Review.author: alan perez
Review.title: great camera for the price range and for beginners

it takes Beautiful pictures and great video at 1080p 60fps, easy to use, a awesome auto-focus, easy menu handling, and ok battery.

This is the first camera I ever get.
I am not professional photographer but it is way above my expectation.
If you know each function of this camera, you will be able to take professional-like photos!
It is light and battery can last for three days even though I always turn it on and shut it off during the whole day on my Cali trip.

Review.author: Skyler L.
Review.title: Camera is great. Seller is questionable.

I love this camera
Just buy it!
Great camera!!!
It has too much to offer for what I paid for it.
55-210mm lens is great for outdoors.
small and
Never see the product after paying the money.
Excellent camera!
Love this camera.

Review.author: Mickey Esquivel

Review.author: JimBob77
Review.title: Bought used and have taken countless terrific photos. Started with a Sony A3000

Text.text: Bought used and have taken countless terrific photos.
Started with a Sony A3000, and wanted something with more features, a little smaller, and a bigger sensor.
The sensor size allowed my to print a properly shot and printed 20x30 poster, and looked like a professional had done it.
Perfect for those moving up or starting out in photography.

Review.author: Leanne Nicole
Review.title: Amazing camera, I carry it with me everywhere

Text.text: I switched over from Nikon to sony and I dont regret it one bit.
Amazing camera, I carry it with me everywhere!
It brings out amazing color and it's so easy to travel with.
Its wonderful product

Review.author: Deborah
Review.title: It's an awesome camera, pictures come out great and you can ...

Text.text: It's an awesome camera, pictures come out great and you can send it from the camera to your phone.
This camera stopped charging via USB after only 3-4 charges.
Like this camera very much.
The kit lense is not prefect but worth it for the price

Review.author: MJB9
Review.title: Excellent value--just needs more lens choices

Text.text: For the cost, it deserves 5 stars.
But Sony gets 3 stars for VERY limited lens selection.
I know, it's not an A7 which has a ton more 'fast' lens choices (f1.4, f1.8, f2.8) in a bunch of different lens packages.
Again, for the money you can't beat it, but I'm wanting to move on for better lens choices, not a better camera.
I just need more time to play and learn
Such a great camera for the price and packed with features.
I especially enjoyed the ability to adapt legacy glass, the wifi sharing, ability to track a moving subject, and of course it's compact size.
Lens selection is still growing, but I expected that caveat.
Overall, highly recommended.
Fell in love with photography all over again.

Review.author: Joseph L. von Oy
Review.title: It takes good pictures. I am having problems in acquiring a ...

Text.text: It takes good pictures.
I am having problems in acquiring a manual for it though.
Love the camera.
I bought it used for about $300 and it came in perfect condition, with no scratches as described by the Seller.
The camera is very comfortable in my hands and lightweight - great for traveling and backpacking.

Review.author: B D
Review.title: Really nice camera. Lots of functionality

Text.text: Really nice camera.
Lots of functionality.
Great pictures.
First one quite working after 30 minutes of use.
Amazon had me a full replacement in two days, at my door, return of the original paid.
That is significantly more convenient than it would have been had I bought it through brick and mortar.
I like Amazon!

Review.author: Pequiste
Review.title: Brilliant technology but at the same time almost too much ...

Text.text: Brilliant technology but at the same time almost too much technology and too many features.
Love it, all about it!
I loved this camera so much I bought the upgrade (a6300) the minute I saw the announcement.
Be aware that the learning curve is steep - this camera has massive amounts of features and compute power and to use it well is a big project.
And there are a whole bunch of annoyances - I have to be very careful not to change the ISO setting in using the rear control wheel for shutter speed, for example.
And yes the viewfinder shade falls off easily, and there are a bunch of other irritations.
For me they are all overmatched by 1) the lightness of the camera and 2) its *awesome* power to take fantastic pictures.
It really is.
Especially in low light.
Lastly the wi-fi implementation to upload to smartphone OR laptop works great and greatly facilitates posting to social media.
Now that it's cheaper its and even better deal.
Love the Sony E-Mount cameras.
This is my 3rd purchase of this line.
Previous owner of NEX-F3, NEX-6 and now A6000.

Review.author: Jason Gill
Review.title: I purchased the camera to take some amazing pictures in Iceland

Text.text: I purchased the camera to take some amazing pictures in Iceland.
I can't say that I'm avid photographer, but I've taken quite a lot of amazing shots.
I was really excited to take some killer shots with the camera, but wasn't impressed.
I kept the camera in Auto majority of the time with the occasional chance to play with settings in manual mode.
Most of my pictures, though they looked nice on the screen, were quite grainy when zoomed in on the computer.
I have used cheaper cameras in the past that have taken better pictures.
In fact, the pictures I was able to take using my Samsung Galaxy S6 edge came out the same or better.
My friend used her iPhone with similar results.

Review.author: M. E. Cote
Review.title: the body only option is useless apparently. Its nice

Text.text: Learning how to use.
This camera is amazing!
