Review.author: Nathan Strietelmeier
Review.title: This camera will break within 13 months

Text.text: GoPro has the worst customer service I have ever seen.
I paid over 500 dollars for my GoPro and even more on the accessories...Just to have it stop working 13 months later....1 month past the warranty.
I didn't fly my camera over volcanoes....I didn't jump out of a plane with my GoPro....I didn't dive into the salty oceans with my GoPro....I didn't even get my GoPro wet.
I filmed myself walking my dog and it still broke after 13 months... GoPro customer service asked me to mail them my old camera and pay another 350 dollars for a new one.
I was stupid for buying a GoPro camera.
But I am not that stupid to mail them my broken 500 dollar camera and then pay another 350 dollars for a new one.
Do You want to spend hundreds of dollars on a camera that has the worst customer service and a camera that will break within 13 months?
Then go ahead a waste your money and buy a GoPro camera...Just remember when it breaks and stops working...I told you so.

On the second day I thought the camera had died.
I had taken the battery out and did not replace it right.
It seams to be working great now.
I own the hero 3+ and hero 3.
Both take amazing video.
The wide viewing angle and resolution are phenomenal.
I've had many water proof video cameras like Olympus stylus', Kodak, and Fujis but none rival GoPro in picture quality viewing angle and versatility.
GoPros are mountable to just about anything for hands free filming.
I've used them cliff diving, hiking, canyoneering, and climbing and they are so light weight you hardly notice you have them on.
Having two GoPros is a must so you can film and have an adventure partner film you too.
The water tight case is very durable, scratch resistant, and I've rarely had fogging problems.
Everything about GoPros is top quality.
I would not ever consider anything but a GoPro for an action camera.
They are like the iPhone's of the action camera world.
I have a feeling this company will be on the cutting edge of adventure technology for many years.
Let's hope they follow Apples business strategy and only make high quality devices.
I hope to get a Karma drone soon.
As good as GoPros are they can still improve.
Longer battery life would be a plus.
GPS tracking with your smart phone would also be great so if you drop your go pro you can find it.
Solar and kinetic self charging to extend battery life would be awesome.
MP3 player with blue tooth should come standard and you should be able to use wifi and down load smart phone apps.
Highly recommend it

This camera is rated tops (actually the Black Edition) by scuba.com for beginning underwater photographers.
I don't think one needs the professional features of the Black Edition so I purchased the silver edition and I'll be just fine.
I saved $100 which I needed to purchase accessories that are required.

If you are going to use this camera underwater, the housing is just fine but you will also need to purchase: 1) An SD card, 2) an extra battery and charger, 3) a red filter or filter set, 4) a waterproof and, preferably, shock proof case, 5) a micro HDMI cable, 6) a floaty backdoor, 7) a floating wrist strap and 8) a floating grip extension.
In addition, you might want a head strap and gripster tripod with tripod mounting adapter.

Review.title: Great video, not just for action recording

Text.text: I use mine for various reasons.
I love the beautiful quality of the video.
I shot a mini movie with it and the quality was fantastic.
I do have some cons:
The videos from this GoPro are HD, so it does just what I need.
You can also take pictures with it as well.
I purchased it used so connecting it through the GoPro app was never possible, which is why it is receiving 4 stars rather than 5.
It does not have a screen to view your videos, but for the price I don't mind.
While doing anything even remotely adventurous, the last thing you'll want to be doing is running the batteries viewing a screen anyways.
I've realized without a screen, I just keep recording rather than stopping every 2 minutes to view the video, which has allowed me to get really good footage.
For the price of this one compared to the newest GoPro, this one is definitely worth it.

I bought this camera blindly and was expecting a typical instant print camera.
Once I received it in the mail I opened it up and tried to set it up to use.
The first problem I ran into was loading the smart sheet into the camera so it will be able to print going forward.
I did exactly what the instructions said to do to load the paper/smartsheet into the camera and no luck it would not recognize that the paper was inside.
Eventually I just put the smart sheet in by itself and it worked.
The second problem with this camera is the battery that Polaroid decided to use.
Just after one print and a few selections the battery went from fully charged to half charged.
Was not very impressed by the battery and manual setup of this camera.
The third problem was that the camera does not have an auto focus function; it's sort of hit or miss with focus when you take a picture.
If those three major problems were fixed then this camera would have been 4 or maybe 5 stars.

Text.text: Product failed within 6 months.
The door mechanism got stuck and polaroid have a vague warranty process.
Don't buy.
Photos have poor quality

Review.author: David E.
Review.title: WARNING!!! DO NOT PURCHASE FOR PASSPORT PHOTOS!!!!!! TERRIBLE QUALITY!!!!!!!

Text.text: I purchased this camera based solely upon its claimed capabilities to take passport photos.
The quality of the photos that it takes is really pathetic, far worse than any other option that I have tried!
I thought the pictures would turn out clearer.
Doesn't work well in low light even with the flash.
I just expected it to be a little better.
I'm better off taking pictures with my regular camera and making wallet prints at Costco.
I liked the sticker effect of the Polaroid, just wish it was better or a cheaper price.
We ordered this after seeing it featured on a local tv station's 'Tech Check.'
The photos, although exactly as described, are really, really small.
And our prints had really bad streaks.
We took only 3 shots, and the streaks just got worse.
We returned the camera.
Neat little camera!
Takes great photos.
Good value and my daughter loves it too!
Only problem is the film has to be purchased online.
The photos keep turning out blue.
I purchased this camera for my 11 year old daughter and she absolutely loves it.
It's very easy to use and looks great.
I love this Polaroid it was everything I wanted.
It's a great size and it prints perfect Polaroid pictures.
Very easy to use as well.
You won't regret buying this C=
I am happy with this camera, I knew I would when I purchased it.
This camera did not live up to my expectations.
Its very bulky, which i guess isnt to bad because it does print pictures instantly.
But compared to a regular digital camer this is very poor quality.
It feels cery cheap.
And the quality of the pictures printed from it are not very good.
I returned mine about 2 days after i got it it was not worth the money.
I got a fujitilm instax mini for $60 and it is much better quality than this camera
Bought it as a gift.
Excited at the beginning but get bored and limited by the product.
This was a big hit when I went back home for the holidays.
It was very easy for everyone to use and the kids (the big kids too) loved watching the pictures develop instantly.
I am so excited to have a modern day polaroid camera and this one is so much fun!
I works like a digital camera and you get the benefit of being able to print the picture right after you take it!
Then to top it off, the backing on the paper can be peeled off and you can stick your picture ANYWHERE!
I recently had a project to do for my 5 year old's class and we needed pictures for a poster.
This came in handy because I found the item I needed a picture of, snapped a shot of it, printed it, and then stuck it to the poster!
So simple!
I am so happy I received this product in return for my honest review and I would highly recommend it (especially to those of us who remember the old polaroids from back in the day)!

Review.author: Lissie
Review.title: This was before smart phones and instagram

Text.text: In my youth, I always carried my bulky old school Polaroid camera with me, and I have to say that some of those polaroids are the only evidence of certain moments in my life.
For example, a lone polaroid picture is the only photo I have of my childhood dog.
This was before smart phones and instagram.
Polaroids were my everything, but in time, I just stopped using it.
Now, with the all new Polaroid, that feeling from my childhood is back.
That need to have a tangible item in your hand, like instant photos, is back!
And its in a convenient little package.
I can't praise this item enough and not to mention everyone wants to play with it and see it.
I have been using it when I'm out with friends and everyone starts talking about how they had a polaroid when they were a kid.
Without a doubt, this is one of my favorite items that I carry with me daily.
Best gift I got for my 18 year old granddaughter, loves this camera!!!!

Review.author: Jen
Review.title: Exactly what I would expect from Polaroid

Text.text: this was more then I even expected, the look reminds me of vintage Polaroid, the display screen on the back is very large which is awesome to review photos before you print them, I also love you can insert a ad card in to print out other photos not just ones you've taken with this camera, the photos are easy to load just open and place in, they print out very fast and the quality is good, give them a few moments to dry so they don't smuge, the camera is light weight but would be easier to hold with a carrying case, I enjoy this camera very much, I did get a discount for review but I never let their effect my opinion either way.

Review.author: Kyle hensler
Review.title: this camera is way too cool

Text.text: Boy was I excited to get a chance to review and test this product!
When I was a kid my dad had a big ole polaroid camera and photographed me and my family constantly and I always thought it was so amazing that a little picture just comes to life before your eyes.
This camera is amazing its so small compared to old ones which is a huge upgrade and the fact that it doesn't use ink or cartridges is a HUGE plus!
Who wouldn't be happy about that?
Its a little dissapointing though that is only comes with 10 picture sheets, because that just doesn't seem like enough pages to really appreciate and figure the camera out.
They aren't top notch quality photos but they are still pretty great.
My niece loved having me take her picture and watching it come right from the screen to a picture she could really hold.
And the sticky back was a very nice feature, I could stick them right on my fridge to display.
The camera holds a nice charge I had the time to roam around aimlessly taking picture after picture all day when I first opened it and it managed to last almost the whole day.
I wish the picture would print a little faster though that would be nice, but it probably wouldn't be as good of quality if of did.
It wasn't the easiest camera to figure out but not as hard as my higher end ones.
So all in all I loved this camera and lived how it took me back to old times.
I would recommend this to anybody.
Purchased another Polaroid printing digital.
Had problems close to end of warranty.
Polaroid sent 3 defective replacements, lost use for several months,never got dependable camera but Polaroid refused further help because in the mean time the warranty had expired.

Review.author: Henry J. Rybaczewski
Review.title: As Much As I Love The Camera.........

Text.text: Added on January 5, 2016
This camera is fun for the price point.
good stuff.
Quick, easy and made for fun
Pictures are not big enough, I bought the 300 wide two weeks later
Photos are small but clear; however, this product is way overpriced.
Great product.
It's awesome how the pictures have adhesive and can be used as stickers.

Review.author: Teresa V.
Review.title: I am absolutely in love with this camera

Text.text: I bought this camera refurbished, and it works great!
The only problems that I've had are very minor to me.
The first picture I ever printed had a very faint line through it, but that never occurred again.
The plastic screen protector is scratched up from the previous person who had it, but this truly is not a problem because its just the cheap one that comes with it.
And the last problem that I had is that in order for the pictures to print, I have to angle the camera to the side for the picture paper to catch the rollers.
But to me this really is not a bother because it still works.
I love this camera because contrary to the standard polaroid cameras, you dont waste printer paper printing bad photos.
You get to see the photo before they print.
The paper is really cool and can be a sticker if you peel the back off.
I just wish that they had an option to put a fake little frame on the photo to pretend it looks similar to the original polaroids.
And it would be really cool if you could adjust the photo color.
lastly, it is cool how the camera comes with different outlets.
People that use these camers tend to travel, so it is cool to be able to have a different outlet according to the country you are going to.

My niece seemed really delighted with it and so I was pleased with my choice.

Text.text: A great combination of the new (digital) and the retro (instamatic).

Paper for printing seems to be hard to find, but that may be due to the Christmas rush and residual delays of high demand.
Delivered as/when promised.

Review.author: Carolyn Pinther
Review.title: The camera was purchased for my great granddaughter. Because she was so eager to use ...

The camera I received was full of someone else pictures.

The latest expected delivery date was 1/18/16.
I'm still waiting.

Review.author: Ely V.
Review.title: printer not so good after a FEW months and very few pics.

Text.text: great camera, cheap looking but I love it.
I like choosing the pictures i want printed and edit them.
Lots of fun.
Overpriced for cheaply made product.
I love this camera!
It's a little thicker than I anticipated, but it makes sense as it's got a printer.
I personally have no problem with the quality of the prints, as they're very small and pretty cute.
The battery seems fine, too.

The charge it came with (one bar on the little battery symbol) lasted me more than enough time to take about fifteen pictures, print six of them, and probably would have done a seventh, but I decided to play with the video feature for a while instead.
It's exactly what I was hoping for!

Review.author: Jasmin L.
Review.title: Fun camera for teenagers, not for those who want high-quality pics...

Text.text: I got this camera for my 13 year old daughter.
She was very excited to get this, as she has never experienced a Polaroid camera before.
Before she played with it; however, I took it for a test drive, so to speak, to see what it could do.
I am no camera expert but this camera weighs more than I expected it to.
It also has a long shutter lag which contributes to an overall grainy digital image.
I would not choose this camera for my personal use.
However, the concept is neat and my kids enjoyed using it.
The novelty of being a printable camera is still fun and the 2015 version takes away many of the drawbacks of the old Polaroid camera.
For example, by having the digital screen, you can actually see and choose what you're going to print without wasting the 'film'.
It comes out finished, so no fanning and therefore running the ink along the bottom.
The 'film' or zink prints are far better priced than the old ink print rolls.
Additionally, you can skip the film and upload the pictures to your computer to share them or print them at a regular size.
It has lots of options that are aligned with current cameras like mode selection and editing.
The detailed instructions are downloadable from a provided software disc or on the Polaroid site as the camera itself comes with a short start guide.
OMG this thing is amazing !
It is awesome to be able to carry around a camera that can instantly print me a picture.
As a parent, I can use this at any time.
I love that I am able to pick the picture that I want to print and even see a preview before I print it.
Also, I plan to use this camera at work.
As a teacher, I think its going to really come in handy.
I love this camera !
When I first purchased this, everything was awesome.
After a few months, the print quality some how diminished.
I don't know why, but it did.
Eventually the first pictures I've took, and printed, all faded.
Soon after, nothing was printing.
It was a waste of money.
I've emailed Polaroid before, and never got a response.
I called it a loss and went to purchase a Fujifilm Instax, which hasn't failed me yet.

Review.author: Booky
Review.title: A lot of fun using this camera!!!!

Text.text: I love the idea of being able to have a printer on the go, my kids are having a blast with this camera, my kids always hated to smile, when I wanted to make a picture they would run away, they were all screaming NO we hate to smile every minute for pictures, leave us alone, but since I have this camera it became a lot of fun taking pictures, they are waiting we should snap more pictures because they wanna be able to print it.
I am absolutely in love with this camera!
It takes decent pictures and i get them instantly!!
It is a little big and bulky, however i remember having a old school polaroid back in the day and this is much much better.
I am so happy to have this camera in my life once again!
Love it!
Kids love the picture printing.
Eady to use!

Review.author: Jeanne
Review.title: There is absolutely nothing not to love about this camera

Text.text: There is absolutely nothing not to love about this camera!
The only surprise was the weight, but after all......it has a printer inside!!
It has everything, and is just such an amazing concept...
I am in awe.
Out of the box, I charged the battery.
Next I ran through all the settings to familiarize myself with everything and discovered many perks along the way.
The variety of possibilities is daunting, but it is so user friendly that it is just plain fun to work with.
I loaded the paper which came with the camera, read the manual, and finally took a few shots.
They were great, but the test was in the printing, right?
I hope the photo I will post shows well, because I believe the proof is in the pudding.
I chose to shoot and print my very colorful phone case because I thought it would be a great test of the trueness of the coloring in the finished product.
When I agreed to test this camera for a discounted price in exchange for an honest review, I did not expect it to be this great and this much fun.
So when I was ready to print, I just pressed the print icon and a minute later out rolled my finished product.
It actually comes out smoothly and efficiently and was a delight to see...please note in the picture the amazing color reproduction.
Except for size, you cannot tell the difference, and this size, by the way, is so fun to use to insert in cards (real mail is back in!!
), and I use it for journaling adventures, because a picture is worth 1,000 words, right?
Do not hesitate to buy this camera; you will thank yourself as you have fun with it!
im not a photographer, but i think the pictures come out pretty well.
you do have to purchase an extra sd card and more paper refills, but it was worth it.
i love it and i would recommend it to many people.

Review.author: BellaRue
Review.title: Save your money... look at a different product

Text.text: We got this for our teenage daughter's 14th birthday.
She used it twice.
'something' happened and the LCD is messed up.
I called Polaroid customer service (which BTW is a misnomer) who said that cracked crystals are not under warranty nor repairable.
I questioned this happening after such minimal use and Mr. Smarty Pants customer rep. says 'They don't break on their own maam.'
So, I am thinking that I will spread the word about our $180 worthless piece of junk that really didn't take good pictures anyway... not even as good as a classic polaroid.
Look for a different product and a different company.
As a Polaroid enthusiast, I was excited to try this new camera.
Like others, I have found it very difficult to get a decent quality image from this camera.
No matter what the lighting is, it seems like every shot I take with this camera is blurry.
It is unusable to me as a camera but I'll keep using it as a printer.
I love the sticker paper photos!
I use this in my classroom.
The students LOVE watching their photos print out.
I also use the memory card to print out photos taken with my Cannon.
It makes a great photo printer for pictures taken with other cameras.
i got it for christmas and by the end of my trip it was broken.
every single time i turned it on it would print out a piece of the paper, which took forever and got really annoying.
then it just wouldnt print at all, even when i wanted it too.
Pictures are very low quality.
The color on the printed 2X3 is inconsistent, sometimes very orangish.
In order to store a decent amount of photos on the camera you will need to by a memory card in addition to the camera.
My 10 year old loves it though.
pricing is better from the polaroid website at 180. but the camera is cool i would just would not buy on here
I'm nobody's photographer, but just about every shot I take with this camera comes out blurry.
From reading the other reviews, I'm thinking either I'm doing something wrong or mine is defective.
I just got back from a trip to DC where I used my iPhone as a backup sometimes, and I got much better quality from the iPhone!
Sadly, I took most of the pictures with this camera, so I have a LOT of BLURRY pictures of monuments and pictures of people whose facial features are not clear at all.
I like the idea of the camera (the printing is pretty awesome, if you can take a picture clear enough to be worth printing) more than the camera itself.
I'm not asking for professional quality here, but it should at least be as good as my iPhone, if not better.
I'm disappointed there aren't more settings (the point-and-shoot digital camera I bought back in 2006 seems to have more) or it's not intuitively obvious how to use them.
I've had this camera for about two months now, and so far I would NOT recommend it.
I got this for Christmas.
I ultimately returned it.
The quality and build of the camera is okay at best.
The resolution of the screen and low light pictures are terrible.
My six year old point and shoot camera gives better quality photos and a better screen than this camera.
In the end I can't see how they can justify the cost.
It's not worth 200 bux.
Awesome concept, fun camera but I wish it cost less.

Battery life is limited when printing but many pictures can be taken and you can choose which pictures to print.
I like it.
The prints do resemble original Polaroid prints so if your not expecting professional quality prints than this is just fine.
Don't move when printing, don't bang it around or get dirt or water in it.

The perfect gift
On an impulse I bought for my daughters' birthday party.
Well I really bought it to have some fun with.
It is a digital point and shoot that prints but has some limitations.
Many have mentioned build and photo quality.
I found both just fine.
My biggest issue is limp flash.
It cannot overcome dim lighting.
But with digital screen you can see and just take picture again under some light.
This camera is perfect for someone who loves snapping shots and just having fun with their camera.
It's perfect for scrap booking and the kids love sticking the pictures all over there stuff.
Cons of this camera are lighting ... you need good lighting in the room or outside in order to have a half decent picture.
You are able to lighten up before you take a picture but it doesn't help much.
Natural lighting is by far best for this camera.
And even with natural lighting I still set it up a little lighter before I print.
The biggest problem and most annoying is the door that holds the film in place opens at the slightest touch!!
The film has poured out so many times its annoying messy and completely inconvenient.Keep a rubber band around the camera so it doesn't pop open.
All in all it's a camera meant for fun.
You need time on your hands to fiddle with the settings as well.

I bought my camera brand new at Camera world in Portland Oregon while visiting great helpful staff.

The camera worked just fine for the first 10 photos when I had to re load the film my camera would not push out the blue piece of paper for the new film to be ready I took it back to the store they messed with it over and over again.
Ended up pushing the blue paper into the rollers to give it a head start that work well although that is not how this camera is supposed to operate so first day red flag.
They were nice and gave me a free pack of film for the inconvenience and sent me on my way the next day when I turned on my camera the screen was messed up.
When the camera is shut off the lcd screen is solid still has the protective film and everything but when u turn it on half the screen is black and miscolored.
I contacted Polaroid about the mishap directly emailed them the problem as long as it's not cosmetic damage they can replace it or if the store authorized to they can.
Well the damage was right off the bat with the rollers not pushing out the paper is not cosmetic, just like the screen being messed up from the inside out, is not cosmetic.
It's not my doing the store couldn't replace it and Polaroid emailed me back telling me they could not help me that it was cosmetic I don't know what to do at this point.

I would love it fixed or replaced however looks like that can't happen at this point and I know amazon won't help me out either being I didn't buy it here but this is the closest I can get to leaving a review for Polaroid because there site sends you to amazon for the purchase.
So that's my expierance either it's a crappy quality over priced camera or I'm just unlucky and they don't want to deal with it or both.
I assumed Polaroids were good quality if anyone has any advice I would appreciate it greatly.

Review.title: This camera works great. The clarity of the picture is good

Text.text: This camera works great .
The clarity of the picture is good.
Got this as a Christmas gift from my husband and I love it.
I volunteer at church to teach kids with special needs.
Being able to instantly print photos when I teach makes the lessons more meaningful.
People are impressed by the quality of the photos.
Also, the size of the camera makes it easy to carry around.
It's fairly easy to use but the manual isn't much help.
I had to figure out most of the functions by trial and error.
Also, the older POGO printer was bluetooth which meant I could print photos from my cell phone.
This is not.
Nevertheless, it's an excellent camera an well worth the money.
First off I love Polaroid products and their creativity for new stuff!
I just got this today and was able to test it out.
Unfortunately I ran into some problems with image quality (perhaps you can leave a helpful comment below if you have advice).
The image contains white lines in the photos and a slim white one side border when no border was selected.
It's mostly the vertical lines throughout my pictures that bother me though.
The camera for the price it is, should be more acceptable quality photos like what is shown in it's advertisements.
Hopefully it is just a minor adjustment?

Review.author: Rocky W.
Review.title: Look elsewhere if you are looking for quality pictures

Text.text: We actually were under the impression that we would be able to print pictures taken from other cameras as long as it was on the memory card.
Boy were we wrong.

After a few back and forth emails with their customer service department we were told that this camera would not be able to print pictures taken with other cameras as the picture formatting was not compatible.
Also, the prints came out rather blurry and very dark with a strong blue-ish tint (but this may have been due to the zink paper that we purchased and promptly returned both).
We are now looking for a good portable printer that actually has ink cartridges instead of the zink paper because it fits more what we are looking for.

Review.author: BP
Review.title: Fun camera, perfect for capturing our new baby

Text.text: So yeah it feels kinda cheap and the screen on the back could be much nicer but it is perfect for capturing the family around the new baby.
The camera itself shoots much better pictures than the screen shows and prints are pretty true to color.
Also, the camera has enough manual settings to get some really nice shots.
I did pull several pics off my computer and loaded them on an Sd card for printing.
These turned out incredibly nice and I ended up sticking them to those cheap refrigerator magnet ads and trimming to suit.
The result is pretty fun.
I am very happy with the Polaroid and reccomend it highly to folks who don't take themselves too seriously.
My only other reccomendation is to pair it with a wi-fi sd card so the pics can be shared via email etc
I had high hopes for this camera as a simple one for my wife to use.
Unfortunately, the camera lacks some key capabilities for a camera in it's price range:
I bought my wife one of these and she loves it.
It prints a photo in less than a minute and the quality is exellent.
You can also save the photo and print from a normal photo printer for higher quality and a bigger size 'The 2X3 is actually great for on the go'.
There is also the neat feature of puting SD cards from other cameras in this and using it as a pogo printer so you always have a photo printer on hand.
I highly recommend this product for the price.
The film/paper isn't expensive and makes for fun stickers if you want.
A nice idea, but that's about it.

Review.author: Makoto
Review.title: Way below expectation. It can just be a toy, not a digital camera...

Text.text: I did actually purchased the camera.
and now I'm going to return it.
I give this 4 stars because it is a bit bulky, the materials feel pretty cheap and it feels a bit like a toy camera.
The little latch in the back to open the camera and insert the zink paper is really flimsy.
I accidentally bumped it once and all the papers fell out.
The power button on top can easily be accidentally toggled as well.
I've resorted to keeping a rubberband around the body to keep it from opening.

It is only a little bit inconvenient that in order to review your pictures you have to move over the little slider to the playback option, much like older cameras, rather than a playback button - but that's just a minor complaint.
If you like using your phone to take instagrams your going love this camera!
Insert sd card and choose the prints you want to print.
Sticky backed photos perfect for scrapping.
You can also upload to Mac or windows and print off larger images.
Best of all, the instant camera prints are only 50 cents a piece.
Not bad for instant crafting.

Kind of a long time when you expect a poloraid quickness!

Review.author: Julie P
Review.title: I bought this despite the bad reviews as a birthday present for my 9 year ...

Text.text: I bought this despite the bad reviews as a birthday present for my 9 year old daughter.
She loves taking pictures & wanted a 'real camera' for her birthday.
She likes using my DSLR so I toyed with buying her a nice point & shoot.

She had talked about how much she wanted one of the print out cameras, but those print every pic they take & she is very used to the digital luxury of taking 50 pictures of one thing & knowing you can delete it all later.
This seemed like a great compromise.
I was afraid she would be disappointed in the quality of the pictures, though.

She absolutely loves the camera, loves the instant gratification of being able to print out pictures she loves or give them to a friend, but she also can keep taking pics until she finds the 'perfect' one to print out.
As long as you have realistic expectations of this camera, you will love it.
Its not a high end amazing camera, its a gimmick, but absolutely perfect for a 9 year old.
I do think the price point is a bit high & think this would have been a much bigger success if it is was around $50 cheaper.

Review.author: Layla Nia
Review.title: Old School with a Modern Twist

Text.text: Taking it back to the old school with a modern twist!
This camera is a great modern day Polaroid, having incorporated with digital media technology you now have an option to choose which photos to print.
Saving money and the environment!
This is obviously not the best digital camera around however, keep in mind the main focus of this camera is the ability to print on the go!
Biggest advantage is being able to print photos when you want.
Yes, it will not spit out the most glamorous prints but I feel like this is all a part of the Polaroid experience.
It began a toy camera and made its fame.
So why should not the tradition carry on after a few necessary upgrades?
For those seeking quality prints, there always exists the option of taking your sd card to a proper print shop later on.
Despite all that, I do have one complaint about the software.
The preview button is in essence the same as the print button.
But the options offered by the two are mismatching, and slightly confusing.
It takes a little time to get used to, and is hence not a major fault to turn me off from the purchase.
Recommended to old school Polaroid enthusiasts looking for a modern touch, all young people who missed the Polaroid age, and any shutterbug who seeks instant printing!

First off, I should say that I received this at a discount in exchange for a review, and also that I really wanted it to work well.
First things first it's VERY bulky, and made of cheap plastic, so obviously it won't fit in your pockets or camera case etc.

The photo printing which is the main feature of this camera is actually pretty good, and could print quality pictures, for a cost of about 50 cents per picture, so after using the 10 included sheets, you're left with a digital camera, that Is, if the camera was capable of taking decent pictures.
The UI and buttons are clunky, and the camera quality itself is awful, it's advertised as 10 mp, but I wasn't able to get a single quality picture.
The zoom is completely digital and only goes up to 2.4x.
My wife has an ancient Samsung phone, with a 5mp camera that can easily out shoot this.
I really wanted this to work, but it doesn't, If Polaroid releases another upgraded version, I would love to try it, but I can't see myself keeping this one.
Gave it as a gift...she loves it!!

Review.author: ALC
Review.title: I like this camera, but its kind of deceiving...

Text.text: Ok, After reading reviews from multiple reviewers, I knew that this camera wasn't going to be small, but I didn't think it was going to be that big either.
That wasn't a problem for me.
It's fine if I just bring it out once in a while, but it's not something I would have just laying in my hand bag.

It takes pretty decent pictures with the correct film, but my problem with the camera is that the picture you take is not a 2x3 photo, but the film is 2x3, which means when you print your picture, parts get cut off.
This was something NO ONE has mentioned or noticed (I guess).
The other thing is that this camera has frames for pictures you have taken.
I thought it was pretty cool and loved it!
I thought the frames were kind of cute...but it was not cool when I printed the pictures out.
You first need to take a picture, then you can add a frame.
The problem with this is that you can't tell what's going to get covered up by the frames.
I wasn't able to readjust the picture to make everything fit.
Some reviewers mentioned that your photo will just get smaller to fit into the frame, which is NOT true.
Then when you print out the photo, the frames get cut off because they are not within the 2x3 size.
the picture you take and the picture you print out are not the same size.
I feel that this is very deceiving to the customer.
If you are going to digitize something, make sure it works when you are printing both from the camera and computer.
I wasted film because I was trying to figure out if it was just me or the camera.

If Polaroid can fix this so what you see on the camera screen is the same as what will be printed out (with the frame) , then I would definitely buy this camera again, but for now, I think I'd just rather return the camera and get my money back.
I really like that it's a digital camera and I was fighting with myself about whether or not to return it, but I think I have to return the camera if it's not meeting all of my standards for it.

If the camera is supposed to print out 2x3 photos, then they should make the screen 2x3, so that the whole picture fits and there should be an option to shrink the image to fit the whole picture into the frame.
There is an option to shrink the photo, but that's only when you make a collage...so sad, but I will have to return this camera.
I really do like it a lot and I hope polaroid can fix these things so that I can print out photos with cute frames straight from the camera.
Currently, the photos I took are of family and I don't want to post those on the internet, so I'll add a photo to show you what I'm talking about in the near future, before I return the camera.

Review.author: All4Selene
Review.title: So much fun with the Polaroid Z2300

Text.text: The Polaroid Z2300 is seriously super fun and awesome to toy with.
It's an Instant Printing Digital Camera with the ability to print 2x3 inch digital photos right out the camera.
You can crop the pictures, add borders, or apply filters.
The pictures come out pretty lovely on the screen, but they print out with more of a bluish tint.
It does look like a very cute brick.
It's blocky and bulky, but still great.
It does fit into a Shirt pocket and even some back pockets, but it is a bit larger than a traditional point and shoot camera.
I believe that Polaroid is best known for their more bulky/larger products so it feels right even with its size.
I bought this for my 7 year old and 9 year old daughters to take on vacation.
Best idea ever!
They were able to take all the pictures they wanted.
We printed pictures they liked and added to their vacation scrapbook (which was so easy with the sticky photo paper).
The ones that we didn't like we just deleted.
Well worth the money and would recommend to anyone.
It took me a few months to learn all the great futures this camera has but now I love it!
You can do so much with it, you have a few borders options that you can even add after the photo has been taken.

You save your pictures with memory card 32gb then you print whenever you want and those pictures you can brighter, change to black/white or leave color either way, have printed the date and it's has a rechargeable battery!
I'm also happy with the film it's affordable and you only print the ones you really want to; I have bought the cheapest film that I phase payed $24 for 80 films!
They work great!
The quality is pretty much similar to the prime film that comes with the camera.
I had bought tha instax 8 fujifilm and I didn't like at all.
I love the Polaroid Z2300 you will fall in love too.
picture quality is the same as the cheap ones.

For being brand new and nearly 200 dollars i wasn't excepting the screen to be so scratched and scuffed upon unpacking it.
Very disapointing.
As for the camera polariod aspect it works as well as you would except a self printing camera too!
The 'polaroid border' mode prints noticeably crooked, but i am happy with it!.

Review.author: Jrbenton12
Review.title: Works great. Smaller than a normal Polaroid and memory doesn't ...

Text.text: Works great.
Smaller than a normal Polaroid and memory doesn't last long without a memory card.

Easy to replace paper and easy to figure out.
I've had this camera for 3 days now and I love it!
The colors are fantastic on the pictures that I print although they are a little bit off they are still very accurate.
The optical zoom isn't very good, its not exactly zooming in.
It's just enlarging the picture and cropping it.
The ten megapixel are lovely though.
The printing time for the picture isn't long at all usually a few seconds and ta-dah you have a printed picture.
I would definitely recommend this camera.
The cost of the films isn't very costly compared to some other polaroids.
It's $25 for 50 sheets.
You can also select which picture you would like to print which is great.
It's not very heavy and really it's not too thick, it's about the length of your thumb (unless you have really, really big thumbs).
It's also great for kids with a simple(ish) software to take pictures.
Over all I recommend this camera for sure!
Although beware this style of camera is only 5 megapixels in best buy and is only 10 megapixels on amazon.

I have read all the reviews and still decided to purchase.
I have discovered that there is more to this camera than I ever imagined.
I am a Spirit Cleanser and investigator and the camera is a very important tool in my work.
I have gotten great results with Polaroid in the past, so am looking forward to testing it in the field.
With this camera, I can control the settings from vivid colors to black and white and can add frames to the photos.
You do have to pay attention to the latch on the back, but a band or a small piece of duct tape fixes that issue.
There is a little bit more weight to the camera because of the on board printer, but that is one of the reasons you buy this camera.
I will report back after I have had the camera for a little while longer and after a clearing.
I also love the photo software, as it was easy to install and use.
So far, I love this camera.

When we were on vacation at the beach in a high rise condominium, we were able to take pictures of the stairs and elevator after we got there and give her a choice!
By the second day, she was choosing the elevator.
Last year she was so scared to ride the elevator and had several meltdowns.
So much better when she can tell/show us her choice!

I grew up with pictures taken from a Polaroid camera and it was much fun.
This camera takes me back to those carefree days.
Polaroid was never meant to be camera that took flawless photos; they were meant for instant pictures that could be shared and saved in photo albums.
That is what this camera is with the added feature of digital technology.
It's the best of both worlds.
The camera arrived in excellent condition and was easy to set up and use.

Overall I am happy with this camera and plan to have lots of fun using it.

While testing this camera out, I took a picture of my daughter and added a border that said 'Princess!'
When I printed the photo, the colours were washed out, the text on the border was cut off so I could only see 1/3 of it, and the entire image was pixelated.

Transfering the photos to my computer showed that while the original photo was 10MP, the print version was only 640 pixels wide (if you don't know anything about printing photos is about 2/3 of what it should be for a 3' print-quality image).

When I went to Polaroid's website to check for firmware updates or troubleshooting tips, I found that the camera has been COMPLETELY removed from their site - there is no product page nor support page.
If that's not a massive red flag, I don't know what is.

Review.author: John S.
Review.title: Trying to fill a novelty niche, but falls horribly short

Text.text: I don't mind the cheap plasticy feel of the device nor the rather limited feature set compared to most other point-and-shoot cameras.
However, what I cannot forgive is the horrible quality of the printout.

The come out with a blue-green hue that almost resembles that 'vintage' look, but actually comes off as terrible quality from a sub-par and over-priced product from what used to be the most trusted name in instant cameras.
What I love about the product is that you can take photos, store them on memory (internal or an SD card) and then print on-demand.
You can even print multiple copies.
I also like that the pictures are also stickers.
It's a great idea for fun with your kids.
But these positives don't even come close to outweighing the horrible quality of the printouts.
In the end, when reviewing a product, it all comes down to whether or not it's worth he price.
In my opinion, this product is not worth any price.
Polaroid would have to increase the quality of the printout significantly, and then this device would be worth having as a novelty for-fun item.
But it would be better priced at around $50 -- not almost $200.
That pricepoint is just laughable.
We bought ours for a crafts project with our 4-year-old, and we have already packed it up to be returned.
We bought a competing product -- for quite less money.
This camera is great, easy to use, you can take pictures and also HD Video, which is just amazing.

The camera intrigued me because it functions both as a digital and an instant print, and the prints are pretty good quality!
I gave the camera as a gift and though it's fairly large in size, considering it has a printer included I'd say the the size is perfect.
I like that you can choose the photos you want to print instead of printing every shot; the photo paper is conserved for the images you really want printed and you can keep others you don't.
For my company I was the designated photographer for one of our events and they wanted me to use this particular one so that customers can also get a copy.
I liked it because I was able to make more than one copy, edit it as well as change the setting.
I think it's a great camera for someone who knows the basic of a camera.
However, I had a few others doing the photography with me didn't have a steady hand and even though that there's an anti shake it still didn't help them.
I haven't tested fully but I wish it prints a larger picture, at the end is practical also requires an improvement in the quality of prints

Review.title: I really really wanted to like this, but I just don't

Text.text: I really really wanted to like this, but I just don't.
I do some professional photography and this was to be a fun toy for my kids.
I didn't expect perfection but I also didn't want to cringe every time I looked at the photos.
The photo prints came out grainy, dark and blue.
I tried photos both indoors and outdoors with the same result.
I even brightened with the editing on the camera beforehand.
I wasn't expecting it to look as good as my dslr prints or even as my iphone prints, but I did hope it would look similar to my 80s polaroid prints.
But it doesn't.
It looks like I printed out a crappy digital photo on crappy printer paper.
I don't even have a photo printer and I can print a better copy on regular paper from my printer.
I was eager to fiddle with the settings in manual......., but they seem non existant.
Also it says the prints are waterproof , but its not.
If you get a tiny bit of water on it , it will lighten that part of the print.
We will be returning this and trying a Fuji film.

Review.author: Leah H
Review.title: Fun to play around with but very disappointing in quality

Text.text: I should have listened to the other reviews.
I thought people sounded overly negative and must be exaggerating.
But I was wrong.
The concept of the camera is pretty cool, and I didn't mind the small size of the prints.
The idea that I could take pictures, edit, AND print them with the camera, ans take videos as well seemed too good to be true.
I thought it would be nice for scrapbooking without the wait to order prints from my phone.
But the pictures come out very grainy no matter how I play around with the settings.
There are also only 2 focusing options which really limits what you can even take a picture of.
I've had the best luck with pictures indoors at night with flash.
For some reason the pictures I've taken in natural light come out worse.
The border options that come with it are tacky and also print out extremely low quality.
I would return it if I hadn't already thrown out the packaging.
This camera is not worth the money and it's such a disappointment because it was a lot of money for me to spend and I can't affors to just buy another camera.
If you want instant pictures, just buy the classic style Polaroid that prints actual useable, quality pictures.
This one seems to have taken technology back in time in the worst ways.

I got it for a Christmas gift and now I will have to return it and wait for my refund to get a different camera.
Super bummed.
Is there any way I can give it back?
it does not work anymore

Review.title: ... received this and so far I think it's a good camera. I'm not rating it as fantastic as ...

Text.text: I just received this and so far I think it's a good camera.
I'm not rating it as fantastic as the photos aren't quite as clear as I had wished.
It's very light weight and I would suggest a case in the event of it being dropped, I am worried it will break.
I may add a couple foam sticky square in the corners to prevent such a situation when out of the case.
The pictures don't print with the 'retro' white border but you can add a variety of your own borders.
Still fun to have around.
You also can pick the photo you desire to print unlike the original polaroids.

Review.author: Elisabeth C'deBaca
Review.title: One of the best gifts I've received.

Text.text: This camera was a gift from my grandmother for my 17th birthday two years ago.
I love this camera!
However, it does feel cheap and plasticky so you have this unnerving worry that your going to break it even though at the same time it still feels sturdy.

Like all other Polaroid cameras (or cameras in general) you have to make sure you don't bump it against anything so I do recommend getting a case for it, I haven't had a problem with the pictures being grainy, but I will agree sometimes it's not the clearest picture.
The Polaroid film it self is wallet sized, cheaper in price compared to most films, and doesn't have the Polaroid border.
But besides all that I travel with this camera all over and is very simple to use.
Being the proud owner of several Polaroid cameras I do recommend this one and it has lasted me quite awhile.

I'm assuming these people have never had an actual Polaroid camera.
If you compare this camera to the top cameras on the market today, of course you're going to set yourself up for disappointment.

Everyone asks her about it and then ask me how much I paid for it.

The old POGO film works with this camera and is cheaper than the Z2300 film.

The 10mp camera is great but don't expect much in low lighting.
Edit March 2015: I got my first Z2300 (black) late 2012.
It had firmware version 1.03.
It still is fun to use so I decided recently add the red version.
This has firmware 1.06.
The appearance of the menu is a little different.
I also compared picture quality and noticed an improvement, black is more black on the digital files and prints, the auto white balance is better and also the picture sharpness has improved.
I hope Polaroid will release the firmware update.

Review.author: Gil Asakawa
Review.title: Useful camera when you need an instant image that's printed

Text.text: Took this new-generation Polaroid on a trip to Japan so my mother could have instant memories in a scrapbook as we went, and write down who's in the photo, where they are, what date, and what's going on.
It was very handy.
Prints are not exactly high quality but I was surprised after we got back stateside and I downloaded the digital files off the Micro-SD card.
The digital quality of the original images are pretty good!

Two potential issues that might keep this from being a pro or semi-pro's companion to 'real' cameras: It overheated if I tried to print out four or more copies of the same photo (which is what I did when we had group picture of my mom with friends, so we could give copies to everyone).
And, the rechargeable battery had a relatively short lifespan.
I ended up charging the thing every night and it ran out a couple of days during the afternoon.
It will work plugged in, but it's very awkward.
Oh yeah, the image is very small -- business card size.
The digital image can be enlarged, though!

Review.author: DarthKater
Review.title: ... for Christmas 2015 and the quality of the photos SUCK. I don't expect it to be amazing

I don't expect it to be amazing, as it's a Polaroid, but I am horribly disappointed in the quality.
The pics are not at all clear, and even outdoors on a sunny day, the pics are dark and you can barely make out faces.
She has always been disappointed with the camera, so for her birthday this year, my grandma bought her the Wide Lens Fuji camera, hopefully that one is better.

Review.author: dillan gissel
Review.title: The Printing Isnt Worth the Time

Text.text: ten megapixels??
that's it??
Now, granted, I knew about this before purchasing, but I said hey, its a polaroid, it prints it's own photos, I'm gonna try it out.
Sure enough, after that first print, I wanted to get rid of this thing.
The image quality is crap compared to my Lumia 950 (10mp vs 20mp) and I use various DSLRs, so my bar was set pretty high.
Now the film prints out even worse, it takes a bad quality photo, shrinks it to 2x3, and then puts weird lines throughout, though I think that's from the printer.
We bought this for fun, and to enjoy an upcoming borthday party.
Sad to say, when we started using it there were massive vertical lines on every photo.
We are returning the item.
Great idea, but poor execution on Polaroids part.
My daughter loves the instant pics.

so as far as prints go I have yet to know its quality.

I am so upset with this camera.
I don't know how it is so expensive if it's been so cheaply made and handled.
I received the camera without a screen protector and for some reason, the camera was covered in scratches as if someone has been using it for months.

I then inspected the camera and opened up the port where the film is placed, and it doesn't even close properly or all of the way, even, because it's still jutting out a bit even after it's been closed.
There wasn't a replacement option, but only a refund option, so now I have to go through the process of waiting for my money to be returned and then placing another new order.
Very disappointed in this product for the kind of price that this company asks for.
I've also heard many others complaining about the fuzziness and quality of the printed pictures so I'm just not sure anymore if this is even worth it.
Packaging should especially take extra care during Christmas season because now this gift won't be under the tree.

Excellent 360 camera for the price, beware of the red spot (flare) that occurs in outdoor pictures taken in sunny days.
I called Ricoh's technical support and they advised me to either return the camera to Amazon and get an exchange or send it for repair.
I did get an exchange only to find out that it is a common problem with wide angle cameras.
Ricoh's support should have been aware of the issue!
I give the camera 5 stars anyway for its low price, simplicity and picture quality.

Review.author: R. Marlowe
Review.title: Love this â€” wish more photo software knew how to handle it

Text.text: This produces great 360 photos with a single touch.
No more taking the phone and spinning in a slow circle in a crowded room, taking 15 seconds and being obnoxious about it.
The photos look pretty darn good for the time it takes.
I wish more display software understood how to stitch it back into a scrollable 360 photo with complete continuity, but thatâ€™s a minor complaint.
A must-have for realtors, lawyers, and those who want to remember exactly what the entire scene wa slime at a specific point in time.
It takes good 360 photos.
I would spend some time researching what all the settings mean because auto function for image capturing does not return the best photos.
A really good 360 camera, and if you are a software developer the APIs are rock solid.
Love it.
Everything seems to be fine with it.
It works like charm.
And quality is good.
If you wish super sharp clear quality get the 4k one.
But take advantage if you can cuz no one seems to be picking up this technology and how amazing it is.
You can upload your pics and vids to facebook and youtube.
Pictures upload directly from your phone, videos need to have a 'meta tag' added (google for '360 video meta tag for facebook' and itll show up.

Review.author: Unique Individual
Review.title: Amazing Image Resolution and Dynamic Range

Text.text: Amazing image quality.
I did not expect image quality this good.
You can clearly see faces up to a few feet away (they'll be tiny, but you can zoom).

Plus the sensor must have some dynamic lighting algorithm because I'm amazed at how it takes in the shadows outside without blowing out the sky too much, regardless of my hand's subtle shakiness, I've never seen motion blur.
I've been photographing with the exposure bias at one whole stop brighter and everything looks great at that setting.
Otherwise, presumably everything would be too dark.
But with that one adjustment, I've been amazed by the image.
The body is hefty, and I dropped it on my third photograph, and all that happened was the facade separated a little (like when you pop the case/back off a phone body).
I snapped it back in and although a little loose, it works A-OK. Only gripe is that sharing the files aren't as easy as I expected.
I have to connect to it with my camera through wifi in order to see the image live, and when I take a photo it takes a moment to transfer the image to the phone.
To see it in 3-D it has to be in the app (on my phone), or I can post it to my facebook which has a 3D viewer.
I found the files in my phone and they appear like the flat map projection of earth from NASA (with the top rows really stretched).
The secondary Ricoh app that I thought would allow me to render out OTHER flat projections doesn't do any of the projections I expected it to do... That's my only issue.
Otherwise a new way to visualize and more-or-less document my travels.
Also neat to take a photo when eating out with friends and everyone is frame!

Review.author: Steven Andrew Gibson
Review.title: Know you need to shell more $ out after you buy the cam

Text.text: Awesome tech but why does one have to download an app to run all the available functions?
Also, why should we have to purchase more in apps to edit the videos and stills.
That should be free due to the cost of the product.

Review.author: Trigger Happy
Review.title: Save your money for something better

Text.text: Bought this because of the relatively low price and as an introduction to 360 camera.
Didnâ€™t expect much and didnâ€™t get much.
Video quality is horrendous if any type of movement is involved since there is no stabilization.
Video in generally is terrible because of the low resolution.
Pictures are ok but your average phone will take better pictures.
Donâ€™t be fooled by when it states HD video or 14mp photos.
What you have to consider is that when you record or take photos in 360, you have to spread those pixels across a much greater range.
A 14mp photo looks like a 3mp photo on a non 360 camera but of course with more in the frame.
Same with video.
Because the area of coverage is so great, you can barely make out what you are looking at.
The camera seems well built and helped me understand in what situations a 360 camera could be useful.
Fun for awhile until the novelty runs out.
Have used this with IPhone and the images are stunning.
Using specifically for Google Streetview photos and so far it's working perfectly.

Review.author: Amazon Customer
Review.title: but the video were very very bad even with all the best conditions

Text.text: The still images were all ok, but the video were very very bad even with all the best conditions.
To say that the Theta S records 'Full HD' video is misleading at best and false advertising at worst.
The video files that camera records are 1920x1080 pixels, but most of those pixels are black (see attached frame grabs).

The actual recorded video file is two circles within a 1920x960 area, not even using it to the maximum, but each only 890 pixels in diameter (Full HD 1920x1080 video is 2,073,600 pixels or about 2.1 Megapixels, the combined resolution of the two recorded circles is 622,113 pixels or 0.6 Megapixels which is less than 1/3 the resolution of 'Full HD').

Once you run that file through the theta software to de-squeeze it the output is 1920x960 pixels (see photo with orange denoting Full HD frame size), but now at a significantly reduced bitrate (from the original 16Mb/s down to 6.6Mb/s) along with an associated reduction in quality with increased macro blocks, moire and other ugly artifacts.
Love it!
Worked great right out of the box; simple, fun and easy to use for both work and play.
This thing is awesome.
The pictures are so cool and the app is pretty intuitive.
I have found that the pictures are pretty clear with little noise even in low light.
Certainly would recommend this for gadget freaks, camera buffs, or anyone that wants to do something different and creative with their photography.

This camera seems to be the best consumer 360 camera available.

Not a professional camera but with good light I will be using this for auto interior ads.

Review.author: Matt
Review.title: Simple to use. Arrived on time. The iPad ...

Text.text: Simple to use.
Arrived on time.
The iPad app is very basic and sometimes a little bit glitchy but it serves its purpose.
I expected the quality of the pictures and videos to be better, based on the specs.
In addition, the software that supports this camera NEEDS A MAJOR UPDATE.

It is terribly slow, you cannot preview the pictures or videos while they are stored in the camera (you always have to transfer them in order to see them), and the theta360 stuff in the apps is annoying.
The PC/Mac viewer is useless.
You have to constantly drag and drop each file in order to see the file.
This can be changed to like display a gallery of files within a specific directory... Another bad thing is the WiFi transfer speed.
It took me exactly 23 minutes to transfer a 586mb video from the camera to an iOS device; HORRIBLE!!!

I simply cannot use the camera on a full day trip to take several videos and pictures because with 14 videos of 5 mins each, I will not have enough space for more and I would have to spend HOURS to empty the camera before I can use it... What I like is the layout of the device, it feels solid on your hand, and it is not bulky as many of the 360 cameras out there.
I may return it because it does not execute as promised or expected.

Also some cameras have an issue with storage space being eaten by unknown problem.
Bottom line: good for taking quick 360 photos and making okay quality street view.

Review.author: Mr. Murphy
Review.title: Battery Won't Hold A Charge - Can't Use

Text.text: Sadly I cannot give this product a good review.
After purchasing this nearly 11 months ago it sat in its protective case going largely unused.
Last month I finally decided to use it on my cruise to Alaska and planned to get some great 360 degree photos of my travels.
I plugged it in overnight to charge and the fully charged indicator never clicked on.
As soon as I connected to my iphone to take pictures it shut down.
Now it only turns on when plugged in; clearly a battery issue.
The one time I wanted to use it, I could not, so I am not very happy about that especially on such an expensive camera.
Great for easy still 360 photos; 360 video leaves a lot to be desired...

Review.author: Marc
Review.title: The camera works great and takes good quality photos for the price

Text.text: Purchased the Theta S on July 6th.......
Dropped it on August 2nd.
The camera works great and takes good quality photos for the price.
But, there is a design/quality issue that Ricoh should address.
The lenses are easily scuffed.
Worse, if you drop it (and, sadly, didn't purchase the product protection plan) the lens cracks easily.
I had the padded slip case on mine, which provides zero impact protection, in my shirt pocket.
It fell out and landed on one of the lenses and left a cute little impact star on the lens.
You would expect lense replacement to be relatively simple and inexpensive.
If you crack your lens it's $200+ to send it in to the one and only repair center in the whole United States to get it fixed.
At $200+ I can purchase a couple 50mm camera lenses for my son's Nikon DSLR with change left over.
My only disappointment with an otherwise superb little camera.

Text.text: Yeah, it could be better video quality, and I wish the Android app did everything the Apple app does, but it's a pretty slick little camera.
I don't use it for video since the quality is not what I would like.
The pictures are great though.
I've played with the various modes.
The best pictures are HDR on a tripod, but I've carried this thing down the Strip in Vegas and snapped pictures and held it out the window of a moving car to get some decent shots.
I wish it was more stable on its own (not on a tripod).
I've already dinged one of the lenses because wind blew the camera over.
Luckily, the crack is near the bottom of the lens and isn't very noticeable.
In hindsight, I would never use this thing outdoors without a secure tripod.
That's unfortunate since the camera crops itself out of the picture, outdoor shots without a tripod are the best ones.
That's why the four stars instead of five.
Just a little more stable, equality in the Apple vs Android apps, and it would have the extra star.

Review.author: eclipse1960
Review.title: Ricoh managed to hang on to the brilliant optical and industrial design that allow it to disappear ...

Text.text: The Theta S is an improvement over the first-generation Theta in just about every direction.
With four times the resolution, vastly improved color sensitivity, a wider lens aperture, and a reduced price, it overcomes all of the shortcomings of the original as a still camera.
Meanwhile, Ricoh managed to hang on to the brilliant optical and industrial design that allow it to disappear from its own pictures with practically no stitching error.

The advances in the Theta S put it into a strong position in the spherical photo market ... but with everyone and their cousin jumping into that market over the coming months, Ricoh is going to be hard put to it to hang on.
Fun for a geek.

Review.author: MQ
Review.title: Good product for its price point.

Text.text: It's a good tool for anyone getting into 360 video/images, it is simple to produce 360 images/videos because their software does the automatic stitching of the two cameras.
For this price point, you are not going to get or should expect clear images or video, like what you would get from a 6 camera GoPro rig.
Unfortunately their software is biased towards compression speed vs clarity so videos tend to be on the soft side even though the original footage on the camera is relatively sharp.
It is understandable since the videos would be quite large if they did not compress it so much.
I look forward when they will produce another camera with higher resolution and maybe an external storage interface.

The current 8GB gives you about 45 minutes of video recording which is more than enough since the battery dies before that, but it would be great to not have to constantly remove data from the camera to free up storage.
Pix are great.
